TEXT:
Halloween approche Ã  grands pas... Ã  pas d'ogre, de loup, de vampire, de sorciÃ¨re et autre squelette, et vous, vous fuyez. Non pas de peur, mais d'horreur! Vos petits monstres, eux, trÃ©pignent d'impatience et comptent les heures qui les sÃ©parent de la grande fÃªte.

Vous Halloween, Ã§a ne vous parle pas. Vous Ãªtes dÃ©jÃ  en train de calculer votre budget de NoÃ«l et vos mouflets ont dÃ©jÃ  dÃ©coupÃ© la quasi intÃ©gralitÃ© des catalogues de jouets pour la "fameuse lettre au PÃ¨re-NoÃ«l"

Et tout cela alors que vous vous remettez Ã  peine des heures oÃ¹ vous avez dÃ» consoler votre chÃ¨re tÃªte blonde de ne rien avoir trouvÃ© Ã  la chasse Ã  l'Å“uf organisÃ©e dans le parc d'Ã  cÃ´tÃ©. Ssans parler qu'il n'y a pas si longtemps, vous avez vÃ©cu l'angoisse de ne pas trouver une fichue piÃ¨ce d'1 ou 2 euros dans votre porte-monnaie quand sa Ã©niÃ¨me dent est tombÃ©e...

Bref, vous n'en pouvez plus!

Mais, en tout bon parent que vous Ãªtes, vous vous dites que c'est bien de faire perdurer la tradition, d'aider vos enfants Ã  rÃªver, qu'il faut participer aux rites initiatiques, et vous avez envie de garder vos enfants, encore un petit peu dans un monde de Bisounours.

Et vous faites bien, car vos enfants vivent en partie dans un monde imaginaire et ces croyances (PÃ¨re NoÃ«l, petite souris, cloches et autres lapins de PÃ¢ques) sont importantes pour son dÃ©veloppement. Elles lui permettent, entre autre, d'affronter parfois une rÃ©alitÃ© un peu difficile.

Courage, ces croyances s'arrÃªtent vers 7 ans environ!

Bon et Halloween lÃ -dedans? Une croyance? Un rituel? Ou juste une fÃªte commerciale?! Pour l'apprÃ©cier, peut-Ãªtre devez-vous faire l'effort de la comprendre? Et de comprendre pourquoi vous la dÃ©testez autant?

Voici une petite liste -non-exhaustive- de raisons qui vous poussent Ã  ne pas l'aimer.

C'est une fÃªte qui a un cÃ´tÃ© commercial

Oui, c'est vrai! Entre les catalogues de jouets de NoÃ«l, on essaie de vous vendre le costume de squelette, de diable, de sorciÃ¨re, la citrouille-panier, des sacs de bonbons, les dÃ©corations, etc.

On ne l'aime pas car on ne la connaÃ®t mal et on ne l'a pas fÃªtÃ© enfant

Rendons-nous Ã  l'Ã©vidence, on est trop vieux (enfin moi en tous cas!). Et on ne l'a jamais vraiment fÃªtÃ©e, donc elle ne fait pas partie de nos traditions! Et nous, on les aime nos traditions, nos petits rituels, notre madeleine de Proust, la dinde de NoÃ«l, le sapin, chercher les chocolats dans le jardin...

Parce qu'elle est mauvaise pour la santÃ©!

Alors qu'on essaie d'inculquer la nourriture "healthy" Ã  nos enfants... Halloween nous inflige de ramener Ã  la maison un tsunami de bonbons qui sont en gÃ©nÃ©ral ni bio, ni healthy! En plus, Ã§a va gÃ©nÃ©rer des frustrations et possiblement des crises quand vous allez devoir expliquer Ã  votre petit amour que "oui, ce sont bien SES bonbons, mais que NON il ne peut pas tous les manger et encore moins les manger quand il veut".

Il va falloir Ãªtre gentille avec tous les gosses du quartier

MÃªme ceux qui ont piÃ©tinÃ© vos fleurs au printemps dernier avec leur ballon. Et mÃªme si vous leur avez achetÃ© un calendrier, des bons de tombola, des brioches, des pizzas tout au long de l'annÃ©e, il va falloir en plus leur acheter des bonbons!

Le 31 octobre, il fait froid, il fait nuit et encore s'il ne pleut pas

Comment faire un chouette dÃ©guisement quand il faut mettre une doudoune dessous sans ressembler Ã  Bibendum? Parce que si vous mettez la doudoune par dessus, vous aurez le droit Ã  "Mais maman!!! on le voit plus mon costuuuuuuuume!!! Les vampires... Ã§a peut pas Ãªtre malade !!!"... Donc il va falloir trouver un stratagÃ¨me pour que petit chouchou n'attrape pas une angine blanche (et qu'il vous pourrisse votre seule semaine de vacances) et qu'il soit "beau"... disons reconnaissable Ã§a sera dÃ©jÃ  pas mal.

Moi aussi, il faut que je me dÃ©guise?

PitiÃ©! Le maquillage Ã§a gratte et Ã§a donne des boutons. Et si Ã§a me gratte, je vais en avoir plein sous les ongles. Et je suis nulle en maquillage. Je vais Ãªtre ri-di-cule...

Comme je vous disais la liste est non-exhaustive. Je vous laisse le soin de trouver encore plein de raisons totalement valables de ne pas aimer Halloween! Parce que...

OUI! Vous avez raison de DETESTER Halloween. Mais votre bout de chou, il vous regarde avec ses yeux remplis de larmes et il vous dit "Mais mamannnnn... touuuuuuuuus mes copains, ils fÃªtent Halloween, moi aussi je veux me dÃ©guiser et des bonbonnnnnnns!!!..."

Alors voici, mes raisons et astuces pour fÃªter malgrÃ© tout Halloween avec vos enfants... sans trop souffrir...

Tout d'abord, un peu d'histoire. C'est quoi Halloween? Encore un truc que nous envoie les amÃ©ricains?

AprÃ¨s quelques recherches, voilÃ  ce que j'ai trouvÃ© (et oui, internet est mon ami!) Halloween est d'origine Celte (dont le peuple gaulois en Ã©tait un des plus nombreux!) et surtout Irlandaise et on parlait alors de la fÃªte -paÃ¯enne- de la Samain... elle fÃªtait Ã  la fois le dÃ©but et la fin de l'annÃ©e Celte, il y a environ 2500 ans. Entre ces deux moments, il y avait une sorte de "trou noir", qui permettait aux dÃ©funts de passer du monde des morts au monde de vivants pour revoir des Ãªtres chers.

On guidait leurs Ã¢mes avec des lanternes pour leur montrer le chemin jusqu'aux maisons. Cette tradition a migrÃ© avec les Irlandais en AmÃ©rique et est devenue cette chÃ¨re fÃªte d'Halloween soit "All Hallow E'en" c'est-Ã -dire "la nuit sainte", notre Toussaint.

Halloween, telle que nous la connaissons Ã  ce jour a Ã©tÃ© largement relayÃ©e par les mÃ©dias, sÃ©ries amÃ©ricaines. Plusieurs siÃ¨cles aprÃ¨s la naissance de cette fÃªte, serait apparu le fait de se dÃ©guiser pour effrayer les vilains esprits. Quant Ã  la tradition des "bonbons ou un tour", ce serait encore plus rÃ©cent puisqu'apparue au 19e siÃ¨cle.

Rendez-vous Ã  l'Ã©vidence c'est finalement une fÃªte qui a une histoire... et qui est assez proche de nous car celtique donc Gauloise en partie... Cocorico! C'est de chez nous! Alors on revendique la SAMAIN et on explique toute l'histoire Ã  nos enfants, qui Ã©pateront la maÃ®tresse Ã  la rentrÃ©e et nous, Ã§a nous permettra de briller un peu en sociÃ©tÃ©! J'habite en Bretagne... donc je valide deux fois plus la Samain, en chauvine que je suis!

Ce n'est certes pas une tradition que vos parents vous on transmise, mais pourquoi ne pas crÃ©er une nouvelle tradition pour votre famille Ã  vous?

Et vous dire que toute occasion est bonne pour passer du temps avec vos enfants Ã  faire une activitÃ©, des crÃ©ations, du partage! Et puis pourquoi pas se saisir de l'occasion pour faire une fÃªte Ã  la maison avec les copains! Vos copains Ã  vous et les leurs!

Une balade Ã  pieds

Eencore une occasion de partager! On se dit que ce n'est pas grave s'il fait froid, Ã§a "ravigotte" comme on dit ici! Et le ridicule ne tue, pas. Touvez un dÃ©guisement oÃ¹ on vous reconnaÃ®t pas, avec un masque (Ã§a Ã©vitera le maquillage qui coule et gratte). Ou encore mieux, allez dans le village ou quartier d'Ã  cÃ´tÃ© oÃ¹ personne ne vous connaÃ®t! Ce qui fait qu'en prime, vous ne serez pas chez vous pour faire la distribution aux gamins du quartier (surtout Ã  ceux qui vous ont piÃ©tinÃ© les fleurs!).

Proposez pour finir Ã  une bonne copine de venir avec vous, Ã§a vous paraÃ®tra moins long!

Pour le cÃ´tÃ© commercial, oui c'est vrai, comme les cadeaux de NoÃ«l, comme les chocolats de PÃ¢ques, mais est-ce que Ã§a vous empÃªche d'offrir cadeaux et chocolats?

Et puis vous avez aussi le droit de faire de la rÃ©sistance!

Confectionnez vous-mÃªme les costumes de vos chÃ©rubins plutÃ´t que de vous ruer dans les magasins pour le leur acheter!

Vous n'Ãªtes pas une super couturiÃ¨re? Ce n'est pas grave! Ils faisaient comment nos parents pour le carnaval? Du papier crÃ©pon et des agrafes! Un rouleau de papier toilette... on tourne, on scotche et hop une belle momie... le tour est jouÃ©! Et puis on ressort des vÃªtements thermiques du dernier sÃ©jour Ã  la neige, ou en emprunte aux copines pour Ã©viter d'effet bonhomme Michelin.

Pour le cÃ´tÃ© "orgie de bonbons", j'ai dÃ©couvert une faÃ§on de faire ses propres bonbons!

Si si... Ou vous pouvez prendre des bonbons type au miel, au pin, Ã  la menthe...(ce qui les aidera Ã  se remettre de leur angine!) bref le plus naturels possible. Ou choisissez des petits gÃ¢teaux emballÃ©s ou sucettes en chocolats Ã  distribuer avec parcimonie pour lutter contre l'orgie... (tant pis pour le surnom de "radine"...)!

Quant Ã  la gestion de la frustration de vos tÃªtes blondes face Ã  leur sac rempli de bonbons (ou Ã  l'absence de bonbons aussi)... on fait comme Ã  PÃ¢ques!

On cadre avant. "Bien sÃ»r que ce seront tes bonbons, et que tu pourras les manger, mais te rappelles-tu pourquoi il ne faut pas trop manger de bonbons?" Rien de vous empÃªche d'intervertir discrÃ¨tement ses bonbons chimiques par les vÃ´tres plus sains.(et c'est vous qui mangerez les fraises Tagada! AH-AH-AH)

Un dernier argument?

C'est bon pour vos enfants! Et oui, Ãªtre dans le "faire semblant", d'avoir "pour une fois" un peu de pouvoir sur les adultes, de les menacer de leur jouer des tours et de leur faire peur, d'affronter aussi un peu leurs propres peurs. Autrement dit, Ã§a les aide Ã  se construire, Ã  grandir, Ã  prendre confiance en eux. N'encourage t-on pas les enfants Ã  demander Ã  la boulangÃ¨re la baguette de pain? Ã€ donner la monnaie? D'aller vendre les tickets de tombola aux voisins? Alors ne serait-ce pas un peu la mÃªme chose??!

Allez, courage:) Ã§a va bien se passer! Joyeuse fÃªte de la Samain Ã  toutes et tous!

Ã€ voir Ã©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: Mes conseils si vous dÃ©testez Halloween et que vos enfants veulent le fÃªter

SUMMARY:
Nach der VerÃ¶ffentlichung der Absetzung der Regionalregierung von Carles Puigdemont am Samstag im spanischen Amtsblatt ist der MinisterprÃ¤sident Mariano Rajoy auch RegionalprÃ¤sident Kataloniens.
Ob und wie viele Politiker und Beamte im Rahmen der Ãœbernahme von Madrid nach Barcelona versetzt werden, war vorerst noch unbekannt.
Physischer Widerstand ist von den Politikern allerdings nicht zu erwarten.
Es ist aber davon auszugehen, dass die BefÃ¼rworter einer Spaltung von Spanien wieder auf die StraÃŸe gehen werden.
Der 54-JÃ¤hrige kÃ¶nnte schon am Montag von der Generalstaatsanwaltschaft unter anderem der Rebellion beschuldigt und inhaftiert werden.
TEXT:
Pro-unity supporters dance at Sant Jaume square after taking part in a demonstration in central Barcelona, Spain, October 29, 2017. REUTERS/Jon Nazca | Jon Nazca / Reuters

Offiziell fÃ¼hrt jetzt Madrid die AmtsgeschÃ¤fte in Katalonien

Nun besteht Hoffnung auf VersÃ¶hnung - aber auch ein Boykott der Staatsbediensteten droht

Die separatistische Regierung Kataloniens ist entmachtet. Auf dem Papier zumindest.

Die spanische Zentralregierung stellte die Region im Nordosten des EU-Landes unter Zwangsverwaltung. Das Hauptziel Madrids sind Neuwahlen am 21. Dezember.

Doch wie es in der autonomen Region weitergeht, ist ungewiss. Was wird beziehungsweise kann nun in den nÃ¤chsten Tagen und Wochen bis zum Urnengang passieren?

10 Fragen und Antworten im Ãœberblick:

1. Wie lÃ¤uft die Ãœbernahme der AmtsgeschÃ¤fte durch Madrid genau ab?

Nach der VerÃ¶ffentlichung der Absetzung der Regionalregierung von Carles Puigdemont am Samstag im spanischen Amtsblatt ist der MinisterprÃ¤sident Mariano Rajoy auch RegionalprÃ¤sident Kataloniens.

In der Praxis Ã¼bernimmt seine Vizechefin, Soraya SaÃ©nz de SantamarÃ­a die AmtsgeschÃ¤fte. Die StaatssekretÃ¤re in den Madrider Ministerien Ã¼bernehmen die Leitung der jeweiligen Regional-Ressorts. Ob und wie viele Politiker und Beamte im Rahmen der Ãœbernahme von Madrid nach Barcelona versetzt werden, war vorerst noch unbekannt.

2. Ist seitens der abgesetzten Regionalregierung Widerstand zu erwarten?

Puigdemont hat die UnabhÃ¤ngigkeitsbefÃ¼rworter am Samstag zum friedlichen "demokratischen" Widerstand aufgerufen. Sein bisheriger Vize, Oriol Junqueras, der nicht Puigdemonts liberaler Partei PDECat, sondern der linken ERC angehÃ¶rt, schrieb in der Zeitung "El Punt Avui", fÃ¼r alle Separatisten bleibe die Regionalregierung im Amt.

Physischer Widerstand ist von den Politikern allerdings nicht zu erwarten. Medien schrieben unter Berufung auf Sprecher der Separatisten sogar, viele der Minister in Barcelona bereiteten sich schon auf eine "SchlÃ¼ssel- und BÃ¼roÃ¼bergabe" am Montag vor.

3. KÃ¶nnte Madrid bei der Ãœbernahme der AmtsgeschÃ¤fte dennoch auf Schwierigkeiten stoÃŸen?

Ja. Die katalanische Regionalregierung hat in Barcelona knapp 110.000 Beamte sowie rund 90.000 Angestellte und Praktikanten, von denen sehr viele Ã¼berzeugte Separatisten sind. Dem sogenannten "Verband der Gemeinden fÃ¼r die UnabhÃ¤ngigkeit Kataloniens" (AMI) gehÃ¶ren zudem 787 aller 948 BÃ¼rgermeister an. Beobachter rechnen mit Boykottaktionen.

Die Schriftstellerin und Journalistin Esther JaÃ©n, die sich als Katalanin in der Region sehr gut auskennt, warnte vor einem "absoluten Desaster" bei der Vorbereitung der Neuwahlen. Madrid drohte WiderstÃ¤ndlern mit der Entlassung.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Der Katalonien-Konflikt gilt als demokratischer Freiheitskampf - doch er ist vor allem ein Duell rigoroser Nationalisten

4. Was passiert unterdessen bei der Polizei? Und mit der Justiz?

Die beiden Chefs der katalanischen Polizeieinheit Mossos d'Esquadra, Pere Soler und Josep LluÃ­s Trapero, wurden abgesetzt und nahmen ihren Hut bereits widerstandslos. Die "Mossos" (Jungs) werden jetzt nach MedieneinschÃ¤tzung den von Madrid eingesetzten neuen Chefs folgen, da bei der Polizei das Gehorsamsgebot gelte.

Im Bereich der Justiz - anders als mit der katalanischen Polizei - war Madrid in Katalonien nie auf Probleme gestoÃŸen. Die katalanische Justiz entschied zuletzt mehrfach gegen die Separatisten.

5. Und was ist mit den Hunderttausenden AnhÃ¤ngern der UnabhÃ¤ngigkeits-Bewegung?

Es gibt Beobachter und Organisationen, die vor Unruhen in den kommenden Wochen warnen. Am Wochenende gab es aber wider Erwarten vorerst nicht eine einzige Protestkundgebung der Separatisten. Diese haben bisher auch zu keiner Demonstration aufgerufen. Es ist aber davon auszugehen, dass die BefÃ¼rworter einer Spaltung von Spanien wieder auf die StraÃŸe gehen werden.

6. Sollte man von der Planung einer Urlaubsreise nach Barcelona lieber absehen?

Nicht unbedingt. Das AuswÃ¤rtige Amt hatte Spanien-Reisende wegen des Konflikts vor einigen Wochen bereits zur Achtsamkeit aufgerufen. Aber selbst nach der Eskalation des Konflikts gab es bei groÃŸen Kundgebungen allenfalls nur kleinere Ausschreitungen.

7. Welche Folgen hat das alles fÃ¼r die Politiker in Katalonien?

Im Prinzip keine GrÃ¶ÃŸeren. Obgleich alle abgesetzten Minister ab sofort keine LeibwÃ¤chter mehr haben. Alle Abgeordneten bekommen aber bis zur Konstituierung des neuen Regionalparlaments ihre BezÃ¼ge weiter ausgezahlt. Ãœberwiesen wird das Geld aus Madrid, da Rajoy unter anderem auch die Kontrolle Ã¼ber die FinanzbehÃ¶rden der Region Ã¼bernommen hat.

8. Gibt es Konsequenzen fÃ¼r die Menschen?

Auf den StraÃŸen wird sich wenig Ã¤ndern. Das Zusammenleben war im Zuge der Eskalation des Konflikts in den vergangenen Wochen in Katalonien schon heftig in Mitleidenschaft gezogen worden.

Es gab Diskussionen und auch handfeste Streits unter Arbeitskollegen, Freunden und AngehÃ¶rigen. "Ich habe Freunde verloren, die ich seit meiner Kindheit hatte", sagte Anwalt Pedro der Deutschen Presse-Agentur. Viele hoffen nun, dass es zu VersÃ¶hnungen kommt.

9. Werden die separatistischen Parteien an der Wahl im Dezember teilnehmen oder den Urnengang boykottieren?

Das stand am Wochenende noch nicht fest. Die Einschreibefrist lÃ¤uft am 7. November ab. Medien berichteten, es habe in den Parteien bereits Treffen gegeben, um Ã¼ber diese Frage zu sprechen.

10. Wird es auch einen Kandidaten Puigdemont geben?

Entgegen frÃ¼heren PlÃ¤nen wird Madrid eine Kandidatur von Puigdemont nicht verhindern - sofern der liberale Politiker bis dahin nicht hinter Gittern sitzt.

Der 54-JÃ¤hrige kÃ¶nnte schon am Montag von der Generalstaatsanwaltschaft unter anderem der Rebellion beschuldigt und inhaftiert werden. Es droht eine Haftstrafe von bis zu 30 Jahren.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Konflikt um Katalonien: Wie eine verfassungswidrige Abstimmung eine politische und soziale Krise auslÃ¶st
TITLE: Widerstand, Festnahmen, Boykott? Wie es in Katalonien nun weitergeht

ADVERTISEMENTAHMEDABAD -- Former Congress leader Shankersinh Vaghela on Tuesday demanded a pre-release screening of movie "Padmavati" for Hindu and Kshatriya community leaders to check whether facts have been distorted in the film and warned of violent protests if its makers failed to do so.
Vaghela said one cannot tamper with historical facts and present them as per one's wishes to get "cheap publicity".
The upcoming movie had earlier run into controversy after Rajasthan-based Rajput community group Karni Sena raised objections over depictions in the movie, claiming that history was being distorted.
Earlier this year, Bhansali was attacked by Karni Sena members during the shooting of the film in Rajasthan.
They also threatened to oppose the screening of the movie in theaters if the facts were distorted.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

AHMEDABAD -- Former Congress leader Shankersinh Vaghela on Tuesday demanded a pre-release screening of movie "Padmavati" for Hindu and Kshatriya community leaders to check whether facts have been distorted in the film and warned of violent protests if its makers failed to do so.

"As the movie is expected to be released on December 1, I want Bhansali to first show it to Hindu as well as Kshatriya leaders as people suspect that some facts have been distorted and presented in a wrong way in the movie," the Kshatriya strongman told reporters here.

The film, directed by Sanjay Leela Bhansali and starring Deepika Padukone, Ranveer Singh and Shahid Kapoor, is scheduled for release on December 1.

Vaghela said one cannot tamper with historical facts and present them as per one's wishes to get "cheap publicity".

"If the movie is released without pre-screening, Gujarat will witness violent protests and law and order may go out of control. I apologise to the cinema owners in advance if people take law into their hands," the former Gujarat chief minister said.

Vaghela quit the Congress after the Rajya Sabha polls in August and launched a new front, Jan Vikalp, which would field its candidates on all the 182 seats in Gujarat, where assembly elections will be held in December in two phases.

The upcoming movie had earlier run into controversy after Rajasthan-based Rajput community group Karni Sena raised objections over depictions in the movie, claiming that history was being distorted.

Earlier this year, Bhansali was attacked by Karni Sena members during the shooting of the film in Rajasthan.

Last month, alleged Karni Sena members burnt posters of the film after the first look of main characters -- Padmavati (Deepika Padukone), Maharawal Ratan Singh (Shahid Kapoor) and Allaudin Khilji (Ranveer Singh) -- was released.

They also threatened to oppose the screening of the movie in theaters if the facts were distorted. "Padmavati" is slated to release on December 1.
TITLE: Congress Leader Shankersinh Vaghela Demands Pre-Release Screening Of Padmavati

Vogue Arabia announced the Nefertiti-inspired Rihanna shoot in a tweet on Oct. 17.

â€œThousands of years apart, two iconic women will finally meet in the pages of Vogue Arabia,â€ the magazine said.

Thousands of years apart, two iconic women will finally meet in the pages of Vogue Arabia. #VogueArabiaXRihanna pic.twitter.com/m9qpKMPbNt â€” Vogue Arabia (@VogueArabia) October 17, 2017

While most of the singerâ€™s fans were excited about the shoot, others found it problematic. Some people thought the shoot was an example of cultural appropriation, considering Rihanna is from Barbados.

isnâ€™t this culture appropriation? â€” hayley ğŸ¦„ (@hayleymaraj) October 18, 2017

Yes it is. The double standard in this country is astonishing. â€” Cylus Cox, BS, ICADC (@DrFatalThumbs) October 27, 2017

Cultural appropriation, damn. â€” Dan ğŸŒ (@megadrivedan) October 27, 2017

cultural appropriation â€” Sheyna (@layrencamy) October 17, 2017

Rihanna is not African she is Barbados or something like that so yes she is appropriating â€” Yr (@Yaradouid1) October 27, 2017

Ignoring the MANY cultural issues here, she looks nothing like the powerful #Nefertiti and these photos aren't helpingğŸ‘#VogueArabiaXRihanna pic.twitter.com/dBztEm8lkJ â€” Elizabeth King (@ElizabethKing) October 27, 2017
TITLE: Some People Have A Major Problem With Rihanna's Vogue Arabia Cover

TEXT:
Una nueva funciÃ³n de Whatsapp permitirÃ¡ que puedas borrar ese gif chistoso, pero totalmente inapropiado que enviaste al chat familiar por error. SÃ­, a todos nos ha pasado.

Luego de meses de especulaciÃ³n entorno a esta funciÃ³n, Whatsapp finalmente la habilitÃ³ pero solo si utilizas el botÃ³n de "eliminar" en los primeros siete minutos despuÃ©s de darle enviar a ese mensaje (del que te arrepentiste en el segundo despuÃ©s de darle enviar).

"Una vez que han pasado los siete minutos, no hay forma de eliminar los mensajes para todos", advirtiÃ³ Whatsapp en su blog oficial.

La empresa tambiÃ©n informÃ³ que cuando utilices esta funciÃ³n aparecerÃ¡ la leyenda "Este mensaje fue eliminado" en el chat grupal o individual al que lo enviaste, asÃ­ que ten en cuenta que dejarÃ¡s una huella detrÃ¡s de cualquier forma.

Antes de explicarte cÃ³mo usarla, tenemos que decirte tres cosas muy importantes sobre esta nueva herramienta.

Uno, si el destinatario es muy clavado y estaba viendo el chat en el segundo en que lo enviaste no hay manera de que lo saques de sus ojos; dos, para que funcione la herramienta es necesario que tanto tÃº como a quien envÃ­as estos mensajes estÃ©n utilizando la versiÃ³n mÃ¡s reciente de WhatsApp; tres, puede que el mensaje no "se envÃ­e correctamente", en cuyo caso la app no te avisarÃ¡.

Ahora sÃ­, Â¿cÃ³mo funciona? Solo debes seguir dos sencillos pasos:

1.Abre WhatsApp y ve al chat que contiene el mensaje que deseas eliminar.

2.MantÃ©n presionado sobre el mensaje para seleccionarlo > toca el botÃ³n de "Eliminar" dentro del menÃº.

TambiÃ©n puedes eliminar varios mensajes, solo tienes que seleccionar los mensajes y pulsa el botÃ³n "Eliminar" para que se borren todos.
TITLE: Â¡Aaaaal fin! Puedes borrar mensajes ya enviados en Whatsapp

"VerÃ¡, doctor, tengo un picor muy agudo en el pecho.
Pla se lamenta.
AsÃ­ que el mÃ©dico acaba reconociendo al paciente que "lo suyo no tiene cura", por lo que le propone seguir siendo europeo, como "paliativo".
El mÃ©dico le espeta: "No se preocupe, que eso no va a pasar en la puta vida".
TEXT:
Esta es la historia de un picor insoportable, viejo de 25 aÃ±os. Que empezÃ³ con los Juegos OlÃ­mpicos de 1992 en Barcelona, que pasÃ³ tiempos mejores -los turistas, la sangrÃ­a, la paella, los souvenirs...- y ha ido empeorando Ãºltimamente, hasta llevar a su paciente sufridor al mÃ©dico, buscando soluciones.

Es el argumento de un corto llamado El catalanazo, difundido este lunes y en el que el actor y cantautor Albert Pla se convierte en ese enfermo de procÃ©s independentista, que con la camiseta del BarÃ§a y la bandera senyera al cuello, ruega por una salida.

"VerÃ¡, doctor, tengo un picor muy agudo en el pecho. Un dolor. Me siento muy catalÃ¡n, pero no tengo un paÃ­s propio", comienza su discurso el artista, en un clip que protagoniza junto al actor Gorka Aginagalde, el mÃ©dico que lo atiende con poca paciencia y cara de disgusto. Es el cineasta vasco Juanma Bajo Ulloa (Airbag, La madre muerta, Alas de mariposa) quien dirige la hilarante historia.

Pla se lamenta. SÃ­, lleva 25 aÃ±os aguantando el picor, dice, pero es que pasaban cosas que le bajaban el desasosiego, como la apertura de Barcelona tras los Juegos y la llegada hasta de toros y flamencas. "Si la bossa sona...", se rÃ­e Ã©l mismo de los topicazos.

Pero llegan los problemas, y empiezan a llamarle "espaÃ±ol". "Â¿Y hombre, eso a quiÃ©n le gusta?", le plantea al doctor. Vino la crisis, la corrupciÃ³n del Gobierno central... Y ya no aguanta mÃ¡s.

AsÃ­ que el mÃ©dico acaba reconociendo al paciente que "lo suyo no tiene cura", por lo que le propone seguir siendo europeo, como "paliativo". Con un atlas en las manos, va dando opciones. "Â¿PortuguÃ©s?", le sugiere. "No fotis", contesta el paciente. "Â¿Italiano?", continÃºa el facultativo. "Si no hay mÃ¡s remedio", admite. Al final, Pla acepta ser de CÃ³rcega.

Antes de salir de la consulta, Pla se gira y pregunta al doctor: "Oiga, si la SelecciÃ³n vuelve a ganar el Mundial, Â¿lo de CÃ³rcega es reversible?". El mÃ©dico le espeta: "No se preocupe, que eso no va a pasar en la puta vida".

UNA PARTICULAR VISIÃ“N DE LA CRISIS

SegÃºn informa El PeriÃ³dico, con este corto Bajo Ulloa "quiere explicar cÃ³mo estÃ¡ viviendo la crisis catalana, que, a su juicio, tiene mucho que ver con la crisis de la marca EspaÃ±a".

"Es curioso que Bajo Ulloa haya elegido a Albert Pla para protagonizar El catalanazo despuÃ©s de la polÃ©mica a raÃ­z de la irÃ³nica carta que el cantante redactÃ³ sobre la situaciÃ³n polÃ­tica de CataluÃ±a antes del referÃ©ndum del 1 de octubre", recuerda.
TITLE: A Albert Pla le pica el 'procÃ©s' independentista

SUMMARY:
Vidya Balan, a talented actress who has played powerful roles in several films, went on a TV panel discussion, a short clip of which was shared by the channel on Saturday, and discussed the issue of sexual harassment.
I would sense that something creepy and I would just walk away from that opportunity.
I could walk away.
It's classic victim shaming to imply that a woman brought on her harassment because she did not "walk away".
She had extended her support to Kangana Ranaut, an actress fighting for credit for a film she claimed she co-wrote.
TEXT:
Jury Member actress Vidya Balan poses on the red carpet as she arrives for the screening of the film "Inside Llewyn Davis" in competition during the 66th Cannes Film Festival in Cannes May 19, 2013.

ADVERTISEMENT

The last few weeks have been momentous for survivors of sexual violence, all over the world. Women embraced the hashtag #MeToo to join their voices to the rising chorus of sexual assault victims coming forward to share their trauma, inflicted often by the people they worked and lived with.

The accounts â€” by both men and women survivors of sexual crimes â€” were difficult to read, so much so that men joined in with hashtags of their own to show that they were listening, processing and hopefully bettering themselves as allies.

Women shared stories of complicity by institutions, conspiracy of silence in families, of unequal power equations at work spaces, threats to their employment, life and liberty, apart from the patriarchal tool of shame being held over their heads to strangle their voices in a society that already sees sexual harassment more as a result of female provocation and less as male aggression.

However, as the stories of systematic abuse kept pouring in â€” from Hollywood producers to bar owners â€” one thing stood out as a beacon of hope â€” women felt for the first time they have a movement going worldwide that was disruptive and resonant and as a result of which powerful men, predatory men who have never been held responsible their entire lives, were now being outed.

In India, several celebrities came forward to narrate their own stories of surviving sexual violence.

Vidya Balan, a talented actress who has played powerful roles in several films, went on a TV panel discussion, a short clip of which was shared by the channel on Saturday, and discussed the issue of sexual harassment.

This writer has not seen the entire discussion, which will be aired on Sunday, 29 October, and will update the commentary when it does. However this is what she said in the clip that was shared.

"I've been in films for 12 years and not once have I been propositioned y anyone. I've not given anyone I think the space to say anything remotely uncomfortable to me.... There were times.... I would sense that something creepy and I would just walk away from that opportunity. Having said that this was not my bread and butter, I lived with my family in Mumbai, I had food on my plate, I didn't have to worry about rent, I had emotional sustenance... I could walk away. I think no one dared say or do anything to me, I made sure I didn't come across as vulnerable..."

While Balan acknowledged her privilege, her comments were symptomatic of the reasons women don't A. report abuse B. hesitate to speak up C. are not believed when they do.

It's classic victim shaming to imply that a woman brought on her harassment because she did not "walk away". Or that she somehow "made herself vulnerable". Case studies and statistics show that women of all ages â€” babies as young as months old â€” are raped every day in this country. To say that Balan herself had not faced any sexual harassment in 12 years because she did not "give anyone the space to say anything uncomfortable" is to imply that those who do get "propositioned" invite it by giving their harassers the "space". It's not only wrong, but it's an attitude that has seeped into the very fabric of society, colouring the way it looked at women who are sexually active, lead independent lives and fight sexism at all levels.

And it's surprising that Balan phrased it the way she did, since she has been a strong champion of gender rights, standing up repeatedly for women, including those she worked with. She had extended her support to Kangana Ranaut, an actress fighting for credit for a film she claimed she co-wrote.

Here's the clip.

If violent sexual assaults, coercion, blackmail, and toxic male aggression could be stopped at spaces occupied by women by not appearing "vulnerable" and "desperate for a job" or just by simply walking away, Balan would not have been on the panel talking about these issues.
TITLE: Vidya Balan Says She Was Not Sexually Harassed At Work Because She 'Didn't Come Across As Vulnerable'

TEXT:
Der abgesetzte katalanische Regierungschef Puigdemont ist nach Belgien geflohen

Zuvor hatte die spanische Staatsanwaltschaft Anklage gegen ihn und weitere AngehÃ¶rige der abgesetzten Regionalregierung erhoben

Nach seiner Absetzung und einer Anklage wegen Rebellion ist der katalanische RegionalprÃ¤sident Carles Puigdemont nach Belgien gereist. Der AnfÃ¼hrer der UnabhÃ¤ngigkeitsbewegung habe dort am Montag mit einem Anwalt gesprochen, berichtete die belgische Nachrichtenagentur Belga am Abend unter Berufung auf den Juristen.

Unklar blieb zunÃ¤chst, ob der Katalane in Belgien Asyl beantragen will.

Der Chefkoordinator der Volkspartei (PP) des spanischen MinisterprÃ¤sidenten Mariano Rajoy, Fernando MartÃ­nez MaÃ­llo, kommentierte die Medienberichte mit den Worten: "Ja, das ist anscheinend bestÃ¤tigt." Die Flucht zeuge "von Verzweiflung", sagte er am Montag vor Journalisten in Madrid.

Anklage wegen Rebellion

Die spanische Staatsanwaltschaft hatte am Montag Anklage gegen Puigdemont und weitere AngehÃ¶rige der abgesetzten Regionalregierung erhoben. Die VorwÃ¼rfe gegen die Angeklagten lauteten unter anderem auf Rebellion, Auflehnung gegen die Staatsgewalt und Unterschlagung Ã¶ffentlicher Gelder, sagte Generalstaatsanwalt JosÃ© Manuel Maza am Montag in Madrid.

Am Wochenende hatte Belgiens StaatssekretÃ¤r fÃ¼r Asyl und Migration, Theo Francken, fÃ¼r EmpÃ¶rung gesorgt, weil er sein Land als mÃ¶glichen Zufluchtsort fÃ¼r die abgesetzten Politiker ins Spiel brachte. Katalanen, die sich politisch verfolgt fÃ¼hlten, kÃ¶nnten in Belgien um Asyl ansuchen, sagte der Flame dem flÃ¤mischen Sender VTM News.

Der belgische Premierminister Charles Michel wies ihn laut Nachrichtenagentur Belga zurÃ¼ck: "Ich bitte Theo Francken, kein Ã–l ins Feuer zu gieÃŸen."

HÃ¤tte ein Asylantrag Puigdemonts Erfolg?

Ob ein Asylantrag Puigdemonts in Belgien Chancen hÃ¤tte, gilt als sehr fraglich. Ãœber den EU-Vertrag ist geregelt, dass sich die Mitgliedstaaten im Zusammenhang mit Asylangelegenheiten untereinander als sogenannte sichere HerkunftslÃ¤nder betrachten - das heiÃŸt, es wird grundsÃ¤tzlich davon ausgegangen, dass es in EU-Staaten keine Verfolgungsgefahr gibt.

Deshalb wurde festgelegt, dass der Asylantrag eines StaatsangehÃ¶rigen eines Mitgliedstaats von einem anderen Mitgliedstaat nur unter ganz besondereren Bedingungen berÃ¼cksichtigt werden darf.

MÃ¶glich wÃ¤re die BerÃ¼cksichtigung des Asylantrages demnach nur dann, wenn Spanien unter Berufung auf einen Notstand die Verpflichtungen der Konvention zum Schutz der Menschenrechte und Grundfreiheiten aussetzen wÃ¼rde - oder wenn gegen das Land ein EU-Verfahren wegen des Verdachts auf schwerwiegende VerstÃ¶ÃŸe gegen die Rechtsstaatlichkeit laufen wÃ¼rde.

Da beides nicht der Fall ist, mÃ¼sste Belgien auf jeden Fall den Rat der EU-Mitgliedstaaten einschalten. Dieser dÃ¼rfte wenig begeistert sein, wenn Belgien der spanischen Zentralregierung mit Asyl fÃ¼r Puigdemont in den RÃ¼cken fallen wÃ¼rde.

Bislang stehen die EU-Partner geschlossen hinter der Zentralregierung in Madrid, unter ihnen auch der belgische Premierminister Charles Michel, der nicht der flÃ¤mischen Partei N-VA abgehÃ¶rt.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Widerstand, Festnahmen, Boykott? Wie es in Katalonien nun weitergeht

(jg)
TITLE: Abgesetzter katalanischer Regierungschef ist nach Belgien geflohen

SUMMARY:
It was 2005 and the conversation about campus sexual assault still had another decade before it became part of the mainstream discussion.
â€œWhen I reported it to the police, they told me, quote, â€˜not to mix alcohol and beautyâ€™ and told me my experience was consensual,â€ Corsie told HuffPost in a recent interview.
Now, sheâ€™s using her expertise as a filmmaker to highlight the impact of victim-blaming in sexual assault cases.
Something one of the women in our film says is, â€œComing out about your sexual assault is like joining the worst sisterhood ever.â€ Right?
Coming out about your sexual assault is like joining the worst sisterhood ever.
TEXT:
Jillian Corsie had only been at college for a month when she says she was sexually assaulted by a male classmate in her dorm.

It was 2005 and the conversation about campus sexual assault still had another decade before it became part of the mainstream discussion.

When she turned to her friends for support, she says one suite-mate advised her not to tell their dorm roomâ€™s R.A; another let out a sigh of relief: â€œThank God I wasnâ€™t there or it wouldâ€™ve happened to me.â€ Her boyfriend at the time later admitted that he thought Corsie had simply cheated on him and regretted it.

Corsie, who had turned 18 just a month before, went to local police for help.

â€œWhen I reported it to the police, they told me, quote, â€˜not to mix alcohol and beautyâ€™ and told me my experience was consensual,â€ Corsie told HuffPost in a recent interview.

For the remainder of her freshman year, Corsie says she was forced to see her assailant three times a week in the class in which they had met. The rest of her college career, she says, was spent avoiding her attacker on campus. She struggled with anxiety and feelings of isolation, barely talking about her assault even years after it happened.

â€œI didnâ€™t have any support,â€ Corsie said.

Now, sheâ€™s using her expertise as a filmmaker to highlight the impact of victim-blaming in sexual assault cases. Corsie and co-director Amy Rosner are raising money to create a documentary-style short film called â€œSecond Assault,â€ in which viewers follow Corsie as she travels back to her college campus and confronts the different people and road blocks she faced when she reported her assault 12 years ago.

â€œThe film is about my journey to confront a system that failed me, and also to confront the culture that we live in,â€ Corsie said. â€œAnd how that supports this idea of a second assault, which isnâ€™t necessarily just what happens when you report, but also what happens when your friends and boyfriends and people around you donâ€™t believe you.â€

The film is currently in production and Corsie and Rosner are awaiting more funding in order to complete it. As of Wednesday afternoon, the two had raised just over $9,000 on SeedAndSpark.

Jillian Corsie/Amy Rosner Jillian Corsie (L) and Amy Rosner (R).

Corsie and Rosner were inspired to create â€œSecond Assaultâ€ after they heard the 2016 leaked audio of President Trump bragging about grabbing women â€œby the pussy.â€ Just days later, Corsie decided to publicly share her sexual assault story for the first time using the hashtag #NotOkay.

â€œI started getting contacted by news outlets and other documentary filmmakers asking to tell my #NotOkay story. Iâ€™m a documentary filmmaker and I knew that if anyoneâ€™s going to tell this story after a decade, it should be me,â€ Corsie said. â€œAmy and I had been friends already for a few years, and weâ€™d been talking about collaborating and just never had. So she just naturally became my co-director.â€

Rosner started her career as a union organizer, but quickly realized she could make a larger impact as a documentary storyteller.

â€œThere was so much learning along the way,â€ Rosner told HuffPost about â€œSecond Assault.â€ â€œWe realized that Jillâ€™s story, as personal as it is, itâ€™s really a universal experience shared by a lot of women.â€

HuffPost spoke with Corsie and Rosner about the creative process behind â€œSecond Assaultâ€ and what they hope comes from such a personal film.

HuffPost: Why did you two decide to make this film?

Rosner: Something that we really wanted to highlight with this film is what does survivor justice look like? If you plagiarize, youâ€™re more likely to get expelled than if you rape someone. So, when people make the argument that we need to depend on the â€œlegal processâ€ what they need to understand is that only three percent of rapists go to jail and it can take up to six years for a case to be tried. So students, like Jillian, are usually forced to spend the rest of their college careers with their rapists.

The system is broken at every single level. When people come out about their assaults, thereâ€™s so much personal and professional risk. Everyoneâ€™s afraid of retaliation. Jill was afraid that her school was going to come after her. We wanted to highlight just how many roadblocks survivors face when they come out.

What was it like â€• 12 years later â€• confronting the different people and roadblocks you faced in your reporting process?

Corsie: I mean, frankly, a year ago I would have told you that I would never have done any of this. It wouldâ€™ve taken a whole bottle of vodka. I couldnâ€™t tell you why but I had kept the business card of the cop who filed my report. I had considered calling and maybe trying to look at the report, and I had done that several times over the years, but I had always chickened out. I was just afraid that the report was going to tell me what everybody else told me, and that it was going to be one more thing that invalidated my experience. Now that itâ€™s done it doesnâ€™t seem like as big of a deal, but at the time it was really challenging.

This past year has been wrought with discussions around sexual violence including the Trump tapes, the Cosby trial and now the Harvey Weinstein allegations and the #MeToo campaign. What has that been like for you as a survivor?

Corsie: I think the #MeToo campaign has been really interesting because I think it shows survivors that theyâ€™re not alone. Thereâ€™s something about these collective voices of women coming out and coming forward that is empowering. Without the #NotOkay campaign last year, I would never have spoken out, and I would never have gotten the opportunity to heal.

Something one of the women in our film says is, â€œComing out about your sexual assault is like joining the worst sisterhood ever.â€ Right?

Rosner: Yeah. Thereâ€™s so many shitty, shitty fucking sisterhoods that women join that are not choices, and this is one of them. So I think while, yes, #MeToo is a trigger-fest and it has been really tough for a lot of people to take, I agree with Jill. I think we have to practice revolutionary self-care right now and always.

I think the universal issue here is that thereâ€™s a deeper systemic problem within our culture that makes difficult for women to speak out publicly or see legal action. So seeing it in mass numbers like this, particularly men seeing this, I think has been a really helpful thing.

Coming out about your sexual assault is like joining the worst sisterhood ever. Jillian Corsie

How do you think that the reporting processes â€• whether through Title IX or the justice system â€• can improve to better support survivors?

Corsie: If weâ€™re talking about, how do we make change on campus with Title IX, with the legal process outside of campuses, how do we actually make actual positive change? I donâ€™t know. Itâ€™s systemically broken at every level.

Rosner: Itâ€™s just so absolutely depressing. Thereâ€™s a systemic problem, and I think one of the major things that Jillian and I really believe in is the conversation around consent. A revolutionary start with this battle is how we talk about consent.

And involving men in that conversation is key.

Rosner: Yes! For Jill and I, we talk a lot about involving men in the conversation. In the beginning, it was really hard for Jill and I to talk about, and I think it is really triggering to even discuss including men, but then when you step back you go like, â€œWhy would we not?â€

First of all, why arenâ€™t we talking about consent and what that really means? Why arenâ€™t we educating people? People seem to be focusing so much time on educating our daughters about how not to get raped instead of talking to their sons about how not to rape. It starts with some kind of more profound sexual education.

Corsie: We keep saying rape is a womanâ€™s issue, but itâ€™s not: itâ€™s a human issue.

What do you hope survivors take away from this film?

Corsie: The one thing that I would want survivors to take away is that we believe them. Because thatâ€™s the hardest part. The go-to response to any assault survivor â€• male or female â€• is: â€œWe donâ€™t believe you. Stop whining. Itâ€™s not that big of a deal.â€ Once people started believing me, that changed everything.

What do you hope men (although men can be survivors, too) take away from the film?

Rosner: I would hope that men take away that talking about consent is important. Because talking about this, letâ€™s be honest, is really difficult, and thereâ€™s a lot of land mines. Consent is not taught to be a part of masculinity. Our goal is for men to see this film and feel that consensual sex can be empowering and masculine.

This interview has been edited and condensed for clarity.
TITLE: Why These Women Are Tackling The 'Second Assault' Of Reporting Sexual Violence

Bob Levey via Getty Images Dawson was born with Poland syndrome, a rare disorder that can cause underdevelopment and deformation in hands.
On Saturday, Dawson added the World Series first pitch to her list of baseball milestones.
Alex Trautwig via Getty Images Dawson threw out the first pitch at Game 4 of the World Series.
TEXT:
Hailey Dawson reached an incredible milestone on her journey to make Major League Baseball history this weekend.

The 7-year-old from Nevada threw out the first pitch at the Game 4 of the World Series in Houston, Texas on Saturday. Dawson was born with Poland syndrome, a rare disorder that can cause underdevelopment and deformation in hands.

As a result, she uses a special 3D-printed robotic hand, which gives her the ability to do things like grasp and throw a ball.

Alex Trautwig via Getty Images Hailey Dawson reached an incredible milestone on her journey to make Major League Baseball history.

Bob Levey via Getty Images Dawson was born with Poland syndrome, a rare disorder that can cause underdevelopment and deformation in hands.

The robotic hand is perfect for Dawson, who loves baseball. In fact, she has a special goal for her hand: to throw out the ceremonial first pitch at all 30 MLB ballparks.

A viral news story about her goal caused an outpouring of invitations from MLB teams all around the country. Sheâ€™s thrown out the first pitch at Oriole Park, Nationals Park, and now Minute Maid Park.

On Saturday, Dawson added the World Series first pitch to her list of baseball milestones. Before the Houston Astros and Los Angeles Dodgers faced off, she pitched to Astros second baseman Jose Altuve.

Alex Trautwig via Getty Images Dawson threw out the first pitch at Game 4 of the World Series.

Alex Trautwig via Getty Images Dawson uses a special 3D-printed robotic hand, which gives her the ability to do things like grasp and throw a ball.

â€œIâ€™m really, really excited,â€ Hailey told MLB.com before the game.

â€œSheâ€™s really a terrific young lady,â€ MLB commissioner Rob Manfred said after meeting her. â€œItâ€™s an honor for Major League Baseball to have her here to throw out the first pitch. Itâ€™s an amazing scientific and medical accomplishment.â€
TITLE: 7-Year-Old Girl With Robotic Arm Throws Out World Series First Pitch

SUMMARY:
A Danish inventor has admitted dismembering a Swedish journalist and dumping her body parts in the sea, but insists he did not kill her.
Peter Madsen is charged with murdering Kim Wall in his home-made submarine in August.
He denies the charge and told police she died from carbon monoxide poisoning inside the submarine while he was on the deck of the vessel.
Madsen, who had earlier claimed he dropped Wall off alive in Copenhage, also denies the sexual assault charges.
Scanpix Denmark / Reuters Peter Madsen has admitted dismembering Wall's body but denies murdering her
TEXT:
A Danish inventor has admitted dismembering a Swedish journalist and dumping her body parts in the sea, but insists he did not kill her. Peter Madsen is charged with murdering Kim Wall in his home-made submarine in August. He denies the charge and told police she died from carbon monoxide poisoning inside the submarine while he was on the deck of the vessel. Wallâ€™s headless torso was found washed ashore in Copenhagen. Her legs and skull were located separately, though her arms and mobile phone remain missing.

TT News Agency / Reuters Journalist Kim Wall's dismembered body was found in August

Post-mortem evidence showed Wall was stabbed in her ribcage and genitals â€œaround or shortly after her death.â€ The police said they would now extend the charges against Madsen - which already include murder and mutilating Wallâ€™s body - to include sexual assault without intercourse, based on 14 interior and exterior stab wounds to the journalistâ€™s genitals. â€œKim Wall had suffered 14 stabs in and around the genitals and it is due to these stabs that we have said that there must have been a sexual motive,â€ police spokesman Jens Moller Jensen told journalists in Copenhagen. The cause of death was still unknown, said Jensen. Madsen, who had earlier claimed he dropped Wall off alive in Copenhage, also denies the sexual assault charges.

Scanpix Denmark / Reuters Peter Madsen has admitted dismembering Wall's body but denies murdering her
TITLE: Kim Wall: Peter Madsen Admits Dismembering Journalist But Denies Murder

TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

GONDA, Uttar Pradesh -- An eight-year old boy died after he was allegedly hit by a car in the convoy of an Uttar Pradesh minister, Om Prakash Rajbhar, along the Colonelganj-Paraspur route in Gonda district on Saturday.

The boy was playing along the footpath late in the evening, when the minister's convoy drove over him.

The minister's convoy, reportedly, didn't stop after this incident.

The villagers laid the body of the child on the road in protest.

"A vehicle from Om Prakash Rajbhar's convoy hit him and he died on the spot. We have registered an FIR," said Vishwanath, the father of the victim.

Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has announced Rs 5 lakh as compensation to the kin of the deceased.

Besides announcing the compensation, the chief minister directed the DGP to submit a detailed report and initiate strict action against those responsible for the incident.

Also on HuffPost India:
TITLE: UP Minister's Convoy Runs Over 8-Year-Old Boy But Does Not Stop

SUMMARY:
Bikinis or burqas: is one a sign of greater emancipation and one a sign of greater oppression?
Dialogue over dogma: we need to have an open, honest and civil discussion about bikinis, burqas and everything in between.
Dialogue over dogma: we need to have an open, honest and civil discussion about bikinis, burqas and everything in between.
This is a discussion we need to have, before we think about whether there is a need or justification for a next step.
We should be having the discussion about bikinis and burqas.
TEXT:
"Women in the West are sexually exploited. They are portrayed indecently in their media."

That's a paraphrase of the words printed on the inside cover of my Grade 5 school book in Iran. And while I don't recall the precise wording, the message made a lasting impression on me.

Even then, however, I did not buy into the conclusion that the note was asking us to draw: that the imposition of modest attire, including the hijab (not niqab or burqas) required by the Islamic Republic of Iran, were, therefore, more respectful to women than Western standards.

I instinctively felt that objectification of women in the West did not justify subjugation of women in the East.

What I read in that textbook in 1981, and what I had learned in Iran in many contexts, did contribute to my looking critically at how women were treated and sexualized in Western media and culture. And when I came to Canada with my family in 1983 at the age of 12, I could see, in ways that some of my peers could not, the impact of fashion magazines and the movie and television industries on girls' free will, on our conduct, and certainly on how we dressed.

As a result, every time we have a "debate" in this country about burqas or other religious garb (including the Quebec government's attempt to legislate "social cohesion" and equality through Bill 62), I recall that passage in the textbook. And I arrive at the same conclusion each time: what we need now is conversation, not coercion.

What could we discuss?

Neither system grants us women complete autonomy. And neither frees us from objectification or coercion.

Bikinis or burqas: is one a sign of greater emancipation and one a sign of greater oppression? Is it outrageous to ask the question?

There are vast differences between the institutions and value systems that permit or require these extremes. Still, neither system grants us women complete autonomy. And neither frees us from objectification or coercion.

Neither the protectionism of religion nor the liberation of secularism; neither the modesty of a long, flowing dress, nor the freedom to go shirtless on public streets; neither the building of a closer relationship to G-d, nor the legislation of gender equality; none of these have succeeded in granting women complete autonomy over our bodies and our choices.

None of these have freed us from sexual harassment and assault. None of these have stopped the rape of women and girls in war. None of these have stopped abusive marriages. None of these have stopped the trafficking of young girls and the marriage of young girls to much older men. None of these have placed us on an equal footing in high-powered jobs and in the boardroom.

I am not arguing that as a progressive, inclusive society, we should embrace or even permit all religious practices or restrictions. We do not and we must not. And I am not arguing that the political, religious and cultural institutions that permit bikinis or require burqas have equal impact on women's rights or even equal moral legitimacy. They do not.

But unlike theocracies or extreme interpretations of religion, progressive liberal democracies give us the freedom to engage in meaningful discussion instead of coercion. And that is precisely why the liberal democratic state should not overstep its role and irresponsibly legislate what women cannot wear.

Dialogue over dogma: we need to have an open, honest and civil discussion about bikinis, burqas and everything in between.

My views may seem irrelevant to some â€” after all, I am not even Muslim (I am Jewish) â€” so who am I to offer my opinion? Yet for years, I adhered to and internalized the Iranian State's values with regards to modesty, so much so that when we first arrived in Spain after leaving Iran, I refused to remove my hijab. In Canada, I resisted wearing shorts. And I did not wear a bikini until my late 20s. Many Jews, as well, adhere to a strict notion of modesty in dress. So I have had my own discussions about these complex issues, and have arrived at my own conclusions. I have clearly and consciously chosen progressive, liberal democracy, despite its shortcomings in achieving gender equality, over state-sanctioned or culturally imposed religious authority.

I know the undeniable value of discussion and citizen engagement in a robust democracy.

Dialogue over dogma: we need to have an open, honest and civil discussion about bikinis, burqas and everything in between. It is incumbent on us to have this conversation, for the sake of our democracy and the rights and freedoms we cherish. This is a discussion we need to have, before we think about whether there is a need or justification for a next step.

But the people having this discussion first should not be decision-makers who then impose broad discriminatory laws. They should be women, primarily. We should be having the discussion about bikinis and burqas. We â€” women â€” must engage in an open, meaningful exchange about our choices and challenges; societal and cultural pressures and freedoms; oppression and liberation; sexism and misogyny; and whether bikinis or burqas are appropriate in certain circumstances. We, including burqa-wearing women. We must make every effort to have respectful discussions in the absence of a sense of moral or religious superiority.

Through dialogue, understanding and mutual trust, we will achieve better social cohesion.

So when it comes to bikinis and burqas, let's seek conversation, not coercion.

Follow HuffPost Canada Blogs on Facebook

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: We Need Honest Discussion About Bikinis, Burqas And Everything In Between

SUMMARY:
A rapidly-growing snowball effect that began with allegations against Hollywood director Harvey Weinstein, before encompassing Labour MP Jared Oâ€™Mara and government minister Mark Garnier so far shows no sign of slowing down.
One former Labour special adviser told of a lewd advance made towards her by a still-serving Tory MP while on the Commons terrace one sunny afternoon.
It was a nice day, it must have been about 4pm, and they had brought the leftover sandwiches out from an event.
Bloomberg via Getty Imagesâ€œA Tory MP walked over to my table, and said â€˜I just want to see if the sex kitten wants any of my sandwichesâ€™.
The Leader of the House said Parliament needs a new independent body to protect MPsâ€™ staff from abuse and unwanted attention.
TEXT:
Whispers about WhatsApp groups, redacted spreadsheets and the biggest controversy since the expenses scandal are rife in the corridors of Westminster. A rapidly-growing snowball effect that began with allegations against Hollywood director Harvey Weinstein, before encompassing Labour MP Jared Oâ€™Mara and government minister Mark Garnier so far shows no sign of slowing down. HuffPost UK talked to a number of current and ex-staff members, from across the political spectrum, working within parties and for individual MPs, about their experiences and concerns. One former Labour special adviser told of a lewd advance made towards her by a still-serving Tory MP while on the Commons terrace one sunny afternoon. â€œRecent events have made me think a lot about some of the incidents I experienced,â€ she said. â€œOne that sticks out is something that happened after Iâ€™d actually left politics, but Iâ€™d come back to Parliament for a meeting and I was on the terrace. It was a nice day, it must have been about 4pm, and they had brought the leftover sandwiches out from an event.

Bloomberg via Getty Images

â€œA Tory MP walked over to my table, and said â€˜I just want to see if the sex kitten wants any of my sandwichesâ€™. He looked really proud of himself, like he was paying me a big compliment. â€œI was completely mortified, as were all the people I was with. I just said â€˜no thanksâ€™. I think he genuinely thought he was being lovely. â€œThere were so many incidents like that - just examples of deeply, deeply outdated attitudes towards women.â€ The former staffer said on another occasion, a then-senior Labour cabinet minister made her feel â€œvery uncomfortableâ€ at a party conference event. â€œHe kept going on and on about a blouse I was wearing, how it looked and the shape of it. It was just really awkward and he wouldnâ€™t shut up about it. â€œThese kinds of attitudes were just pervasive throughout politics. This idea that women were almost ornamental and you could speak to them in any way you liked.â€ MPs from across the Commons, including former Labour deputy leader Harriet Harman, leader of the House Andrea Leadsom and Tory backbencher Anna Soubry, have called for urgent action to be taken to address a â€œculture of sexual harassmentâ€ between members and their staff. Theresa May pledged to write to John Bercow, the Speaker of the House, to ask for his help in tackling the issue - but despite the PMâ€™s tough talk, only a single minister has been placed under investigation.

PA Wire/PA Images

Another former party staffer, who worked for Labour both in government and opposition, said: â€œI think the worst thing was being warned as young woman not to be in a car alone with certain ministers. â€œWhen I first got into politics, as a young researcher, older friends would warn you to make sure you werenâ€™t alone with certain male politicians at conference parties.â€ One former researcher for a since-retired Tory MP told friends his boss â€œon more than one occasion asked if he would - â€˜for funâ€™ - wear plastic breasts in the office and dance around.â€ Another former senior staff member said: â€œI once knew of an MP who had a work experience student staying at his flat. He actually got into this guyâ€™s bed â€˜for a cuddleâ€™. â€œThis sort of thing was totally ingrained in the culture. Probably still is.â€ A senior Lib Dem source confirmed the issues span the entire political spectrum and have done for several years. â€œThe split in the Parliamentary party - when we had one - [on who to avoid] was always the God botherers and the women botherers,â€ they told HuffPost UK. Other current staff members, who asked not to be identified because of the potential impact on their careers, confirmed there had been little improvement in recent years. â€œWe have all known for years which MPs to avoid, but I donâ€™t think anyone will actually come forward and speak out about some of them,â€ one said.

PA Wire/PA Images

Responding to an urgent question tabled in the Commons on Monday afternoon, Leadsom said events in recent days were in danger of bringing Parliament into disrepute. The Leader of the House said Parliament needs a new independent body to protect MPsâ€™ staff from abuse and unwanted attention. Speaker John Bercow agreed members needed to act â€œswiftlyâ€ to tackle what he branded a â€œdisturbingâ€ culture. But Baroness Anne Jenkin, who with Theresa May co-founded Women2Win, a campaign to increase the number of female Conservative MPs, cautioned against creating an environment where false allegations could be made. She told HuffPost UK: â€œOf course it is stating the obvious that unwanted sexual behaviour is unacceptable in any walk of life and must be stamped out. â€œHowever, I think there is a danger, in the current environment swirling with gossip and intrigue, of creating an atmosphere where people are afraid to say anything and just retreat into themselves, which would be really quite depressing. Or even that unsubstantiated allegations can be made without any proof. â€œI am not suggesting for one minute that there is not some behaviour that goes on that is beyond inappropriate. Properly predatory behaviour, grooming and such like, of young women and young men, has to be stamped out as a matter of urgency.â€

PA Archive/PA Images

Jenkin, who has sat in the House of Lords since 2011, said the â€œvast majorityâ€ of incidents could be resolved â€œthrough people using common sense and good mannersâ€. â€œThis is a matter for Parliament to sort out and I look forward to seeing the Speakerâ€™s response to the Prime Ministerâ€™s letter,â€ she added. â€³I would be the first to come down on such behaviour like a tonne of bricks, if it were brought to my attention. Everyone knows I am hugely supportive of the Conservative women MPs and I am sure they, and I hope their staff, would come to me if there was a problem. Or someone else in authority who will take allegations seriously. â€œI have actually put out a message asking anyone to get in touch with me with any concerns, and so far nobody has.â€ But Unite, the union which represents hundreds of Parliamentary staff, said the issue could not be left to political parties alone to deal with. It urged any employee with concerns to get in touch with their union rep and said the Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA), the Commons watchdog, needed to do more to support its efforts.

Doug Peters/EMPICS Entertainment
TITLE: 'I Want To See If The Sex Kitten Wants Any Of My Sandwiches' - Female Staffers Lift Lid On Harassment In Parliament

TEXT:
No todos pueden decir lo mismo, y la cosa no pinta muy bien para alguno de los personajes principales. Estas deducciones se remontan al capÃ­tulo anterior , en el que se pudo ver a un envejecido Rick.

El Ãºltimo capÃ­tulo estrenado en la madrugada del domingo al lunes terminÃ³ con unos cuantos personajes de AlejandrÃ­a recibiendo disparos y con la reapariciÃ³n de un personaje que todo el mundo habÃ­a olvidado hace tiempo: Morales (Juan Gabriel Pareja), del que no se ha sabido nada desde la primera temporada. Y regresa reteniendo a Rick a punta de caÃ±Ã³n contra su cabeza. Pero, siendo realistas y teniendo en cuenta que la serie estÃ¡ siguiendo de forma aproximada la lÃ­nea argumental del cÃ³mic en cuanto a la guerra contra Negan (Jeffrey Dean Morgan), a Rick probablemente no le va a pasar nada.

SPOILERS : si no quieres saber nada de lo que pasa en el segundo capÃ­tulo de la octava temporada de The Walking Dead , no sigas leyendo.

"No me da miedo ningÃºn bÃºho", comenta Rick.

Incluso hay un plano en el que, durante unos segundos, parece como si acabaran de matarle a tiros, aunque luego se ve que no le pasa nada.

El aÃ±o pasado hubo mucho revuelo por la posible muerte de Carl, ya que Chandler Riggs anunciÃ³ que iba a empezar la universidad. Y este aÃ±o parece que podrÃ­a llegar el momento temido.

Carl tambiÃ©n aparece en la escena futura de Rick y, curiosamente, no asistiÃ³ a la Comic-Con de Nueva York como parte del plantel de The Walking Dead. No es que eso sea un indicador, pero no deja de ser extraÃ±o. AdemÃ¡s, en el estreno de la octava temporada, uno de los Salvadores le dice a Rick: "Tu hijo morirÃ¡".

Â¿Puede ser esa frase un presagio?

David Alpert responde al HuffPost: "Llevamos tiempo demostrando que todos los personajes se la juegan y que somos la clase de serie que no tiene problema en desviarse de la lÃ­nea argumental del cÃ³mic".

Y va mÃ¡s allÃ¡: "Hemos recibido mensajes de los fans diciendo: 'Como muera Daryl, nos rebelamos'. DEUIL - La mort d'un Ãªtre cher peut Ãªtre coÃ»teuse. Et cela d'autant plus que certains profitent de la fragilitÃ© du deuil pour faire de bonnes affaires. Dans un rapport publiÃ© ce dimanche 29 octobre, l'association de consommateurs Familles Rurales, reconnue d'utilitÃ© publique, alerte sur les arnaques des frais d'obsÃ¨ques.

DerriÃ¨re ces disparitÃ©s se cachent des pratiques douteuses. 60% des devis rÃ©alisÃ©s Ã©taient non conformes Ã  la lÃ©gislation. Ils ne respectaient pas les contraintes de forme, mais prÃ©sentaient aussi certaines prestations optionnelles comme obligatoires.

Ces diffÃ©rentes contraintes, qui visent Ã  informer au mieux les familles en deuil, sont dÃ©finies dans un arrÃªtÃ© ministÃ©riel du 23 aoÃ»t 2010. Le devis, Ã©crit et gratuit, doit distinguer entre prestations obligatoires, optionnelles, et prestations pour le compte de tiers, notamment la reprÃ©sentation auprÃ¨s des diffÃ©rentes administrations, rappelle Familles Rurales.

Les seules obligations, poursuit l'association, sont un cercueil avec quatre poignÃ©es, sans accessoires, ou une urne funÃ©raire, la plaque d'identitÃ©, et l'opÃ©ration d'inhumation ou de crÃ©mation.

Si les Ã©tablissements de santÃ© sont tenus de prÃ©senter un corps "dÃ©cent", certaines entreprises n'en proposent pas moins des options de maquillage ou d'embaumement, qui peuvent alourdir la facture. De mÃªme, beaucoup proposent un transfert en chambre funÃ©raire. Or, l'Ã©tablissement oÃ¹ est mort le dÃ©funt prend en charge, gratuitement pour les trois premiers jours, le sÃ©jour en chambre mortuaire.

Les devis les moins chers sont ceux rÃ©alisÃ©s en boutique, et non pas sur internet. Ainsi, un devis rÃ©alisÃ© en ligne prÃ©sentera un prix en moyenne plus cher de 320â‚¬ pour un enterrement, et de 427,50â‚¬ pour une crÃ©mation.

Face aux grands groupes, les entreprises locales sont elles aussi plus compÃ©titives, indique le rapport. Les tarifs des grands rÃ©seaux de pompes funÃ¨bres sont ainsi plus Ã©levÃ©s de quelques 54â‚¬ en moyenne pour une crÃ©mation, et de plus de 393â‚¬ pour un enterrement.

L'association recommande ainsi de demander des devis Ã  plusieurs entreprises, pour les mettre en concurrence. Elle indique aussi qu'il vaut mieux Ãªtre accompagnÃ©, pour ne pas se laisser piÃ©ger par sa fragilitÃ© Ã©motionnelle.

"Apprenez Ã  rÃ©sister au discours de commerciaux parfois peu scrupuleux", conclut Familles Rurales, et ce mÃªme si ces conseillers peuvent paraÃ®tre empathiques. Un conseil qui vaut de toute faÃ§on, prÃ©cise l'association de consommateurs, "quel que soit le domaine".

Er fÃ¼hlt sich "perplex, ratlos und auch beÃ¤ngstigt ob alledem, was gerade in Katalonien passiert." Der deutsch-spanische Schauspieler Daniel BrÃ¼hl (39, "Der ganz groÃŸe Traum") spricht Ã¼ber seine Heimat, seine erste oder zweite, ganz wie man will. Er ist in Barcelona geboren und in KÃ¶ln aufgewachsen. Er lebt in Berlin und Barcelona. Katalonien ist fÃ¼r ihn mehr als ein RÃ¼ckzugsort. Es ist Teil seines Lebens - auch im aktuellen politischen Konflikt.

"Colonia Dignidad - Es gibt kein ZurÃ¼ck" mit Daniel BrÃ¼hl und Emma Watson kÃ¶nnen Sie hier auf DVD bestellen

In einem Beitrag fÃ¼r die "SÃ¼ddeutsche Zeitung" schwÃ¤rmt BrÃ¼hl von seiner Heimatstadt: "Ich habe hier als Kind gespielt und als Schauspieler gearbeitet. Ich habe hier FamilienangehÃ¶rige, Freunde, Schauspielerkollegen, Regisseure; hier spielt mein Klub, der FC Barcelona, im Camp Nou, dem besten Stadion der Welt. Barcelona war mein Zufluchtsort, vor allem in persÃ¶nlichen Krisen". Nun ist dieser Ort selbst in einer schlimmen Krise.

Er habe mit seiner Partnerin Felicitas Rombold PlÃ¤ne geschmiedet, ganz nach Barcelona zu ziehen, "erst recht, nachdem unser Sohn geboren wurde". Aber nun falle es ihm schwerer, seit er "fassungslos" die Nachrichten in spanischen und deutschen Zeitungen lese, die davon handeln, dass Katalonien sich von Spanien abspalten will. Seitdem frage er sich, "ob Barcelona das noch ist oder sein kann: Heimat. Oder ob man gerade dabei ist, mir etwas zu nehmen".

Einer wie er, der "dieses goldene, gleiÃŸende Licht der mediterranen Sonne" Ã¼ber alles liebt, "die offenherzigen Menschen, die MÃ¤rkte, die Bars", spÃ¼re nun, "wie der Konflikt an mich heranreicht, wie ich in meinem ganz persÃ¶nlichen Umfeld GrÃ¤ben beobachte, die jeden Tag tiefer werden".

"Ich habe mich immer als EuropÃ¤er gefÃ¼hlt"

Daniel BrÃ¼hl ist wie viele andere Katalanen gegen die Abspaltung von Spanien, "weil ich, Sohn eines Deutschen und einer Spanierin aus Barcelona, mich immer als EuropÃ¤er gefÃ¼hlt habe. Und weil mich das immun gemacht hat gegen die Engstirnigkeit, die ich jetzt in Katalonien wahrnehme".

2006 hatte BrÃ¼hl die Hauptrolle in Manuel Huergas Film "Salvador - Kampf um die Freiheit". Er spielte den jungen katalanischen Anarchisten Salvador Puig Antich, der gegen die spanische Franco-Diktatur gekÃ¤mpft hatte und dafÃ¼r 1974 hingerichtet wurde. Daniel BrÃ¼hl schildert in seinem "SZ"-Beitrag die Sympathien, die ihm in Barcelona entgegenstrÃ¶mten als der Film in die Kinos kam: "Man identifizierte mich so sehr mit dem Protagonisten, dass ich damals in Barcelona fast nur auf Katalanisch angesprochen wurde. Ich kann mich noch gut erinnern, wie unwohl ich mich fÃ¼hlte, wenn ich auf Spanisch antwortete".

Er verstehe zwar Katalanisch "perfekt", doch es falle ihm schwer, Katalanisch zu sprechen. "Das war auch nie ein Problem. Meine GesprÃ¤chspartner wechselten ins Spanische, wenn sie merkten, dass ich kein Katalanisch sprach", so BrÃ¼hl. In letzter Zeit sei es ihm aber passiert, "dass GesprÃ¤chspartner ihr Katalanisch durchzogen, demonstrativ. Ich fÃ¼rchte, das gehorcht einer Stimmung: Die da drauÃŸen gehÃ¶ren nicht zu uns. Das sind tendenziell Rechte".

Es mache ihn fassungslos, wenn er hÃ¶re, dass die Filmemacherin Isabel Coixet (57), eine linksorientierte Katalanin, "auf der StraÃŸe als Faschistin beschimpft wurde, weil sie gegen die UnabhÃ¤ngigkeit ist".

Aufgeheizte Stimmung innerhalb der Familie

Die Lage sei so aufgeheizt, dass es in seiner eigenen Familie auseinandergehe. "Es gibt einige, die extrem fÃ¼r die UnabhÃ¤ngigkeit sind... Andere sind radikal dagegen. Im Freundeskreis ist es Ã¤hnlich, und ich ertappe mich dabei, wie ich dem Thema ausweiche, um Freundschaften nicht zu gefÃ¤hrden", erklÃ¤rt der Schauspieler.

BrÃ¼hl hÃ¤lt das Referendum zur UnabhÃ¤ngigkeit fÃ¼r "illegal", fÃ¼r "eine Farce", weil es "nicht mal den Mindestanforderungen an eine demokratische Abstimmung entsprach". Er glaube nicht, dass die Mehrheit der Katalanen fÃ¼r eine LoslÃ¶sung von Spanien sei. Doch jetzt, wo die Zentralregierung in Madrid die katalanischen Institutionen unter ihre Kontrolle stellen will, "dÃ¼rfte es wieder mehr Zulauf fÃ¼r jene geben, die sich abspalten wollen. Denn das verletzt die Katalanen in ihrem Stolz", gibt BrÃ¼hl zu bedenken.
TITLE: Daniel BrÃ¼hl: Wie sein spanisches Herz leidet

Les deux principaux partis montrÃ©alais ignoreraient d'importants outils de marketing numÃ©rique dans le cadre de la campagne Ã©lectorale municipale. MÃªme Denis Coderre, roi incontestÃ© des relseaux sociaux, laisserait Ã  dÃ©sirer.

La firme AOD Marketing a analysÃ© les outils numÃ©riques utilisÃ©s par Ã‰quipe Denis Coderre et Projet MontrÃ©al. Constat: internet est sous-exploitÃ©.

Â«Aujourd'hui, les Canadiens passent en moyenne 5h49 par jour sur internet depuis leur PC ou tablette et 1h42 depuis leur cellulaire, c'est majeurÂ», note Augustin Vasquez-Levi, prÃ©sident et fondateur d'AOD Marketing.

Ã‰galitÃ© sur Facebook?

Un premier constat surprenant se dÃ©gage de l'analyse: malgrÃ© une large avance dans le nombre d'abonnÃ©s sur Facebook, les publications de Denis Coderre rejoignent le mÃªme nombre d'utilisateurs que celles de ValÃ©rie Plante. La portÃ©e de M. Coderre et son parti se situerait entre 1300 et 6300 internautes alors qu'ils sont suivis par 48 500 personnes. Avec 27 000 abonnÃ©s au profil et la page professionnelle de ValÃ©rie Plante ainsi qu'Ã  la page de Projet MontrÃ©al, l'aspirante-mairesse arrive Ã  rejoindre entre 1400 et 4500 internautes.

Le rapport n'offre pas d'explication pour cette faible performance, mais notÃ© qu'aucun des deux candidats nla fait de campagne sponsorisÃ©e ciblÃ©e sur Facebook, c'est-Ã -dire des campagnes publicitaires visant les internautes selon leur code postal.

Â«Ã‡a permet de comprendre le discours dans chaque arrondissement et avoir une campagne spÃ©cifique Ã  chaque rÃ©gionÂ», note M. Vazquez-Levi.

En 2015, le quotidien The Gazette a analysÃ© les tweets de M. Coderre et notÃ© lÃ  aussi que la porte le du maire Ã©tait faible malgrÃ© ses 219 000 abonnÃ©s (308 000 aujourd'hui). Selon le journal, ce rÃ©sultat s'explique par le fait que les deux tiers des comptes Twitter qui suivent le maire sont faux ou inactifs, une proportion bien plus Ã©levÃ©e que d'autres politiciens.

Quant Ã  Mme Plante, elle a fait l'erreur d'avoir Ã  la fois un profil personnel et une page professionnelle sur Facebook.

Â«Avoir un profil personnel et une page publique dilue la performance de ses publications et Ã©parpille ses suiveurs potentielsÂ», lit-on dans l'analyse de AOD Marketing.

PublicitÃ©s Google

M. Coderre est le seul Ã  avoir lancÃ© des campagnes payantes sur Google jusqu'Ã  prÃ©sent. Au dÃ©but de la pÃ©riode Ã©lectorale, le site web de son parti Ã©tait mÃªme les premier rÃ©sultat Ã  sortir lorsqu'on entrait Â«Projet MontrÃ©alÂ» dans le moteur de recherche.

AOD Marketing estime que Projet MontrÃ©al aurait eu tout intÃ©rÃªt la mener une telle campagne publicitaire Ã©tant donnÃ© le manque de notoriÃ©tÃ© de sa chef, ValÃ©rie Plante.

Â«Ã€ noter que le Facebook de ValÃ©rie Plante est recherchÃ© sur Google. [...] Ceci est symptomatique d'un manque de notoriÃ©tÃ© sur le webÂ», note la firme.

M. Coderre aurait toutefois pu faire mieux. Entre autres, il a payÃ© pour que le site de son parti apparaisse en premier dans les recherches Google portant sur son nom alors qu'il Ã©tait dÃ©jÃ  bien rÃ©fÃ©rencÃ©.

Selon M. Vazquez-Levi, les deux partis ont manquÃ© une asoirÃ©e tre opportunitÃ© de cibler des Ã©lecteurs avec des campagnes gÃ©olocalisÃ©es sur Google.

Ã€ l'heure oÃ¹ les intentions de vote sont annoncÃ©es comme quasi-identiques, une campagne numÃ©rique aurait dÃ©finitivement permis Ã  nos candidats d'avoir une plus grande visibilitÃ© web et, peut-Ãªtre, faire la diffÃ©renceÂ», conclut l'analyse.
