SUMMARY:
La platea dei beneficiari degli 80 euro si fa piÃ¹ largaSi allarga la platea del bonus Irpef da 80 euro.
Sarebbero cosÃ¬ salvi gli 80 euro dei dipendenti pubblici, che con il rinnovo del contratto supererebbero la soglia ad oggi vigente per ricevere il bonus.
La cedolare secca per gli affitti al 10% prorogata per il 2018-2019 ma non sarÃ  strutturaleNon sarÃ  stabilizzata, ma arriva una proroga di due anni per la cedolare secca al 10% che si applica sui contratti concordati.
Ora invece la norma prevede che si possa applicare "dal 2014 al 2019", con una estensione quindi anche al prossimo biennio.
Il testo definitivo della manovra conferma la sterilizzazione delle clausole di salvaguardia per il 2018, ma rimanda l'aggravio all'anno successivo.
TEXT:
La manovra alla prova del Parlamento. La legge di bilancio approda al Senato, dove martedÃ¬ inizierÃ  il suo iter, e nella versione ufficiale, bollinata dalla Ragioneria generale dello Stato, figurano alcune novitÃ , come la proroga per due anni della cedolare secca per gli affitti al 10%, che perÃ² non sarÃ  strutturale. I gruppi parlamentari avranno tempo fino al 10 novembre per presentare le proprie proposte di modifica e non sono esclusi correttivi da parte del Governo alla luce del forte pressing di Mdp e dei sindacati. Il partito di Bersani e Speranza spinge in particolare per l'abolizione del superticket sanitario di 10 euro, mentre Cgil, Cisl e Uil chiedono lo stop dell'aumento automatico dell'etÃ  pensionabile.

La platea dei beneficiari degli 80 euro si fa piÃ¹ larga

Si allarga la platea del bonus Irpef da 80 euro. La versione finale della legge di bilancio, approdata in Senato, prevede infatti l'innalzamento delle soglie di reddito per ottenere la maggiorazione in busta paga: il tetto di 24.000 euro sale a 24.600 e quello di 26.000 sale a 26.600 euro. Sarebbero cosÃ¬ salvi gli 80 euro dei dipendenti pubblici, che con il rinnovo del contratto supererebbero la soglia ad oggi vigente per ricevere il bonus.

La cedolare secca per gli affitti al 10% prorogata per il 2018-2019 ma non sarÃ  strutturale

Non sarÃ  stabilizzata, ma arriva una proroga di due anni per la cedolare secca al 10% che si applica sui contratti concordati. Le bozze circolate nei giorni scorsi prevedevano invece una stabilizzazione a regime di questo meccanismo. Ora invece la norma prevede che si possa applicare "dal 2014 al 2019", con una estensione quindi anche al prossimo biennio. Restano esclusi dalla misura uffici e negozi.

L'aumento dell'Iva rinviato al 2019

Rimodulato e rinviato al 2019 l'aumento dell'Iva. Il testo definitivo della manovra conferma la sterilizzazione delle clausole di salvaguardia per il 2018, ma rimanda l'aggravio all'anno successivo. In particolare, l'aliquota Iva al 10% salirÃ  di 1,5 punti percentuali dal 2019 e di altri 1,5 punti dal 2020, mentre quella al 22% aumenterÃ  di 2,2 punti percentuali dal 2019, di ulteriori 0,7 punti percentuali dal 2020 e di 0,1 punti dal 2021. Confermato l'aumento delle accise dal 2019.

Raddoppia la tassa per i licenziamenti, fino a 2.940 euro

Aumenta l'importo della "tassa sui licenziamenti" collettivi che le imprese industriali e commerciali con piÃ¹ di 50 dipendenti versano per la cassa integrazione. Per ogni persona interessata a un licenziamento collettivo il datore di lavoro dovrÃ  versare un'aliquota pari all'82% del massimale della Naspi mensile (l'indennitÃ  di disoccupazione ndr), a fronte del 41% attuale, fino a un massimo di tre anni di anzianitÃ . In pratica se adesso per ogni persona licenziata si pagava al massimo 1.470 euro adesso la tassa potrÃ  arrivare all'82% e sfiorare i 2.940 euro.

Sgravio fiscale per le fondazioni bancarie

Arriva il credito d'imposta per le fondazioni bancarie per promuovere progetti di welfare. Il testo definitivo della manovra prevede un contributo, sotto forma di credito d'imposta, pari al 65% delle erogazioni effettuate a partire dall'anno d'imposta 2018, che puÃ² essere utilizzato solo nell'ambito dell'attivitÃ  non commerciale. Il contributo Ã¨ di 100 milioni l'anno, per il triennio 2019-2021, ed Ã¨ assegnato in base all'ordine temporale con cui le fondazioni comunicano all'Acri l'impegno a effettuare le erogazioni.

Sconti per gli abbonamenti di bus e treni fino a 250 euro

Detrazioni fino a 250 euro per le spese d'abbonamento di trasporti pubblici locali, regionali e interregionali. Tra le novitÃ  anche l'agevolazione per gli accordi di rimborso di questi abbonamenti da parte dei datori di lavoro per i propri dipendenti e per i loro familiari - una sorta di "bonus bus-treno" - che non entrano a far parte del reddito da lavoro tassato.

Un Fondo da 100 milioni per la famiglia

Arriva il fondo da destinare a interventi per le politiche della famiglia con una dotazione di 100 milioni di euro l'anno a partire dal 2018. Il Fondo Ã¨ istituito nello stato di previsione del ministero dell'Economia.

Bond cuscinetto per attutire i colpi delle crisi bancarie

Arriva una nuova classe di bond che vengono coinvolti prima delle obbligazioni senior in caso di crisi bancarie. L'introduzione, anche prima che sia adottata la nuova direttiva Ue (Brrd2), dei nuovi strumenti "di debito chirografario di secondo livello" Ã¨ confermata nel testo finale della legge di Bilancio, dove invece non compare piÃ¹ il pacchetto di misure per accelerare lo smaltimento degli Npl. I nuovi bond cuscinetto devono avere durata minima di 12 mesi e non possono essere collegati a derivati e devono avere valore nominale di almeno 250mila euro. Possono essere emessi anche dalle Sim. L'obiettivo Ã¨ quello, in caso di bail in, di dotare le banche di una maggiore capacitÃ  di assorbire le perdite, limitare l'intervento pubblico e dare ulteriore protezione a risparmiatori e depositanti in caso di crisi bancarie.

Fondi per il post terremoto, da L'Aquila a Ischia

Dieci milioni di contributo straordinario per l'Aquila per il sisma del 6 aprile 2009, altri 2 milioni agli altri Comuni del cratere. Vengono anche prorogate a tutto il 2019 le zone franche urbane create in Emilia e Lombardia dopo il terremoto del 20 e 29 maggio 2012 e per le stesse aree lo stop al pagamento dell'Imu sugli immobili in agibili Ã¨ prorogato a tutto il 2018.

Diverse misure anche per facilitare i mutui per la ricostruzione. Confermata l'istituzione di un fondo da 10 milioni per il 2018, che salgono a 20 per il 2019 e 2020, per la ricostruzione di Casamicciola Terme e Lacco Ameno a Ischia.

Rinvio di un anno per l'Iri, vale quasi 2 miliardi per il 2018

Rinvio di 1 anno dell'Iri l'imposta al 24% sul reddito per le ditte individuali e per le societÃ  di persona a contabilitÃ  ordinaria, che doveva valere dall' 2017, quindi sulle prossime dichiarazioni dei redditi. La misura Ã¨ confermata nel testo finale della legge di bilancio e, come si legge nella relazione tecnica, 'vale' quasi 2 miliardi (1,986) tra Irpef e le addizionali regionali e comunali.

Nasce l'Agenzia nazionale ItaliaMeteo, la sede a Bologna

La manovra istituisce l'Agenzia nazionale per la meteorologia e climatologia denominata 'ItaliaMeteo' con sede centrale a Bologna. L'Agenzia, tra gli altri compiti, dovrÃ  elaborare, sviluppare, realizzare e distribuire prodotti e servizi "per la previsione, valutazione, monitoraggio e sorveglianza meteorologica e meteo-marina, l'omogeneizzazione dei linguaggi e dei contenuti, anche ai fini di una efficace informazione alla popolazione".

Il reddito di inclusione sale fino a 534 euro al mese per le famiglie numerose

Potenziate le misure per la lotta alla povertÃ : cresce la platea dei beneficiari del Rei, il reddito di inclusione, che per le famiglie numerose sale fino a 534 euro al mese.

In particolare, si legge nella relazione tecnica, per i nuclei con 5 o piÃ¹ componenti, gli unici per i quali Ã¨ previsto un beneficio potenziale sopra il massimale, la misura aumenta il contributo massimo dagli attuali 485,41 euro mensili fino a circa 534 euro. Il costo dell'intervento sale di 60 milioni di euro l'anno, con un aumento di circa il 16% rispetto ai 370 milioni stimati per i nuclei con 5 o piÃ¹ a legislazione vigente. L'incremento del massimale comporta anche un lieve ampliamento della platea di beneficiari che, per questa tipologia, passano da 100,1 mila a 106 mila, mentre nel complesso i beneficiari potenziali del ReI si attestano a 499,8 mila.

Iva al 10% per i concerti

Il pacchetto cultura prevede l'Iva agevolata al 10% per i concerti, come giÃ  previsto per gli spettacoli teatrali, fondi per i musei e per incentivare la lettura e misure per accelerare la ricostruzione delle chiese e del patrimonio ecclesiastico dopo il sisma del Centro Italia. In arrivo anche 200 assunzioni tra i vincitori di concorso che portano a 1000 gli ingressi con il ritorno della selezione pubblica, come si legge in una nota del Mibact.
TITLE: La manovra arriva in Parlamento. La cedolare secca per gli affitti al 10% non sarÃ  strutturale, la platea degli 80 euro si allarga

TEXT:
â€˜House Of Cardsâ€™ creator Beau Willimon has spoken out over the accusation that the showâ€™s leading actor, Kevin Spacey, made sexual advances towards a then-teenage Anthony Rapp in the 1980s. Beau addressed the matter on his Twitter page, claiming heâ€™d never witnessed any â€œinappropriate behaviour on or off setâ€ in the time heâ€™s known Spacey, and insisting heâ€™d been left â€œtroubledâ€ by the allegation.

Kevin Winter via Getty Images Kevin Spacey and Beau Willimon at a 'House Of Cards' event in 2014

He wrote: â€œAnthony Rappâ€™s story is deeply troubling. During the time I worked with Kevin Spacey on â€˜House Of Cardsâ€™ I neither witnessed nor was aware of any inappropriate behaviour on or off set. â€œThat said, I take reports of such behaviour seriously, and this is no exception. I feel for Mr. Rapp and I support his courage.â€

My statement regarding Anthony Rapp and Kevin Spacey: pic.twitter.com/8z6zotHWE5 October 30, 2017

Speaking to BuzzFeed News, Anthony Rapp claimed that at the age of 14, Spacey had â€œtried to seduce himâ€ following a party at his apartment, which the Oscar-winner responded to in a Twitter statement in the early hours of Monday morning (30 October).

Dan Wooller/REX/Shutterstock Anthony Rapp
TITLE: Kevin Spacey Accusations Addressed By 'House Of Cards' Creator On Twitter

SUMMARY:
House of Commons Tory and Labour women MPs in the Commons.
PA Wire/PA Images Labour benches crammed with women MPs.
At the 2017 election, a record 208 women MPs were elected, but still make up barely a third of the total.
Normally men dominate proceedings in the Commons, as just 21% of Tories and 45% of Labour MPs are female.
On the Labour benches, women eventually outnumbered male colleagues by two to one (35 women to just 16 men on the green benches).
TEXT:
Male MPs were for once outnumbered by female colleagues as the House of Commons debated the latest sexual harassment allegations sweeping Westminster. The gender balance in the chamber was markedly different from usual as Cabinet minister Andrea Leadsom unveiled plans to offer more support for victims of misconduct and Speaker Bercow called for a new complaints process. The switch in numbers came as some Labour MPs were accused of privately suggesting there was a â€œwitch-huntâ€ against men in Parliament, and had joked that they should â€œfess upâ€ to their misconduct.

House of Commons Tory and Labour women MPs in the Commons.

PA Wire/PA Images Labour benches crammed with women MPs.

At the 2017 election, a record 208 women MPs were elected, but still make up barely a third of the total. Normally men dominate proceedings in the Commons, as just 21% of Tories and 45% of Labour MPs are female. But on Monday, all that changed as women packed the chamber and men turned up in noticeably fewer numbers. Early in proceedings, HuffPost UK counted 65 women and just 56 men in the Commons, giving female Parliamentarians a rare majority. More than a third of Tory MPs present for the Urgent Question â€“ tabled by Labourâ€™s Harriet Harman - were women, way above their usual percentage. Commons Leader Leadsom was flanked by Theresa May and a trio of women - Anne-Marie Trevelyan, the PMâ€™s Parliamentary Private Secretary Seema Kennedy, and Mims Davies â€“ sat behind them.

Commons Empty seats on the Tory benches during the Urgent Question.

Commons Thinning numbers during the debate.

But gaps in the green benches were apparent and by the end of the 75-minute session, there were few Tory MPs left present. Later in the Urgent Question, the gender balance was even more stark. On the Labour benches, women eventually outnumbered male colleagues by two to one (35 women to just 16 men on the green benches). Labour MP Jess Phillips revealed that just before the debate, a pair of her colleagues had not been as gripped of its importance as she was. â€œAs I walked in here, as I rushed in here today to come to this statement, I overheard two male colleagues walking through the halls wittering about a witch hunt that was going on in Parliament,â€ she said.
TITLE: Women MPs Outnumber Men During Commons Sex Harassment Debate

SUMMARY:
Since â€œStranger Thingsâ€ Season 1, a single theory has turned the internet upside down:Steve Harrington (Joe Keery) from â€œStranger Thingsâ€ may be the father of Jean-Ralphio (Ben Schwartz) from â€œParks and Recreation.â€BEN SCHWARTZ REJECTEDJOKESKeery recently told HuffPost he was getting compared to Schwartz long before â€œStranger Thingsâ€ ever came out, so he wasnâ€™t surprised by the theory.
Now, it looks like â€œStranger Thingsâ€ Season 2 may be adding even more evidence, and it appears to come down to this scene:After watching the new season, we noticed Steve seems to struggle a bit on the basketball court.
Keery calls the pairâ€™s basketball â€œskillsâ€ a possible Season 2 clue about the theory.
â€œI think the basketball is the only hint, I would say,â€ Keery told us after being asked if he had noticed any other connections to Jean-Ralphio in Season 2.
Whether or not we get the full story of the creation of Jean-Ralphio in Season 3, you can still call this theory a slam dunk.
TEXT:
Since â€œStranger Thingsâ€ Season 1, a single theory has turned the internet upside down:

Steve Harrington (Joe Keery) from â€œStranger Thingsâ€ may be the father of Jean-Ralphio (Ben Schwartz) from â€œParks and Recreation.â€

BEN SCHWARTZ REJECTEDJOKES

Keery recently told HuffPost he was getting compared to Schwartz long before â€œStranger Thingsâ€ ever came out, so he wasnâ€™t surprised by the theory. But the internetâ€™s reaction, which has even led to Keery and Schwartz appearing in viral videos and Visa ads together, has been out of control, despite a relatively small amount of evidence.

Thus far, the biggest support for the theory has been Keery and Schwartzâ€™s similar looks, the fact that both shows take place in Indiana, and that Steve could technically, timing-wise, become Jean-Ralphioâ€™s papa.

Now, it looks like â€œStranger Thingsâ€ Season 2 may be adding even more evidence, and it appears to come down to this scene:

After watching the new season, we noticed Steve seems to struggle a bit on the basketball court.

Following in his (possible) fatherâ€™s footsteps, Jean-Ralphio is no stranger to similar difficulties.

Keery calls the pairâ€™s basketball â€œskillsâ€ a possible Season 2 clue about the theory.

â€œI think the basketball is the only hint, I would say,â€ Keery told us after being asked if he had noticed any other connections to Jean-Ralphio in Season 2. He added, â€œBut if thatâ€™s the case, in real life Ben is an absolute, great basketball player. He has got a nice, sweet jump shot.â€

If that isnâ€™t enough for all the theory enthusiasts, the actor went on to joke that originally Season 2 went even more in-depth on his characterâ€™s family history.

â€œThere was this entire plotline of the conception and the birth of Jean-Ralphio, but they just had to cut that for time, so hopefully they can fit that in next season,â€ said Keery.

Whether or not we get the full story of the creation of Jean-Ralphio in Season 3, you can still call this theory a slam dunk.
TITLE: 'Stranger Things' Season 2 May Hint At Theory About Steve And Jean-Ralphio

SUMMARY:
Utahâ€™s suicide rate has tripled since 2007 and suicide is the leading cause of death among the stateâ€™s children ages 10 to 17.
Empirical data is hard to delineate, but there seems to be a correlation between Utahâ€™s large Mormon population, the churchâ€™s denunciation of same-sex LDS couples and the communityâ€™s beleaguered LGBTQ youth.
If you or someone you know needs help, call 1-800-273-8255 for the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline.
You can also text HELLO to 741-741 for free, 24-hour support from the Crisis Text Line.
Outside of the U.S., please visit the International Association for Suicide Prevention for a database of resources.
TEXT:
Utahâ€™s suicide rate has tripled since 2007 and suicide is the leading cause of death among the stateâ€™s children ages 10 to 17. Empirical data is hard to delineate, but there seems to be a correlation between Utahâ€™s large Mormon population, the churchâ€™s denunciation of same-sex LDS couples and the communityâ€™s beleaguered LGBTQ youth.

If you or someone you know needs help, call 1-800-273-8255 for the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline. You can also text HELLO to 741-741 for free, 24-hour support from the Crisis Text Line. Outside of the U.S., please visit the International Association for Suicide Prevention for a database of resources.
TITLE: LGBTQ

TEXT:
517 days and counting...

Thatâ€™s how long Britain has to negotiate a deal with the EU - and make no mistake, every single second of it will count.

Just this week Brexit Secretary, David Davis, said: â€œItâ€™s no secret that the way the EU makes its decisions tends to be at the 59th minute of the 11th hour of the 11th day and so on.

â€œThatâ€™s precisely what I expect to happen here.â€
TITLE: 24 Hours In A 'No-Deal' Brexit Britain

SUMMARY:
After driving down dirt roads, HuffPost found Spencer standing in the dark, smoking a cigar and drinking Angelâ€™s Envy bourbon out of a tall glass.
Chris McGonigal/HuffPost Richard Spencer is interviewed by the HuffPost in a remote location outside Gainesville, Florida, on Oct. 18.
Chris McGonigal/HuffPost Richard Spencer says he supports the push for white identity but doesn't want to be called a Nazi.
The next day, about an hour after Spencer left the stage at the universityâ€™s Phillips Center for the Performing Arts, three of his fans were seen driving through town.
The three men, all of whom had traveled to Gainesville from Texas for the Richard Spencer speech, were later arrested on attempted murder charges.
TEXT:
NEAR GAINESVILLE Fla. â€” Richard Spencer, a leader of what he calls the â€œalt-rightâ€ and the man known to most as the â€œNazi who got punched,â€ agreed to talk to HuffPost the night before his speech at the University of Florida in Gainesville last week.

He and his followers had rented a house in the Florida countryside for security reasons, they said. A hotel in Gainesville wasnâ€™t an option.

After driving down dirt roads, HuffPost found Spencer standing in the dark, smoking a cigar and drinking Angelâ€™s Envy bourbon out of a tall glass. Behind him, about a dozen of his followers filtered in and out of the houseâ€™s front door.

It looked as though maybe they were having a small party. Just 14 hours to go until Spencer, their movementâ€™s figurehead, took the stage at the University of Florida in an elaborate and expensive troll aimed at spreading their rebranded version of organized racism.

Chris McGonigal/HuffPost Richard Spencer is interviewed by the HuffPost in a remote location outside Gainesville, Florida, on Oct. 18.

Spencer, president of the innocent-sounding National Policy Institute, which is listed as a hate group by the Southern Poverty Law Center, was a top-billed speaker at the right-wing rally in Charlottesville, Virginia, in August. That event spiraled into violence and ended with a neo-Nazi driving his car into counter-protesters, killing 32-year-old Heather Heyer.

Spencer has since been on a mission to give speeches at multiple universities, threatening schools with lawsuits if they donâ€™t allow him. This has left college towns across the country scrambling to make sure they donâ€™t become the next Charlottesville.

Chris McGonigal/HuffPost Richard Spencer says he supports the push for white identity but doesn't want to be called a Nazi.

In a 20-minute interview with HuffPost, Spencer balked at being called a Nazi, was unapologetic about essentially forcing the University of Florida to spend over half a million dollars in security costs, extolled the virtues of a white â€œethno-state,â€ explained why heâ€™s targeting universities for recruitment and blamed violence at white supremacist events on counter-protesters.

â€œI mean, the only people who would do something that would â€” engage in violence or try to disrupt something or to harm anyone, are these counter-protesters and detractors,â€ Spencer told HuffPost when talking about the University of Florida event.

The next day, about an hour after Spencer left the stage at the universityâ€™s Phillips Center for the Performing Arts, three of his fans were seen driving through town. Police say they screamed â€œHeil Hitler!â€ and other chants at a group of counter-protesters.

Gainesville Police Department Colton Fears, left, Tyler Tenbrink and William Fears were arrested after Richard Spencer spoke at the University of Florida. One of the men is accused of firing a gun at a counter-protester.

When a counter-protester hit their vehicle with a baton, police said, the three men got out of the vehicle. â€œKill them,â€ â€œShoot themâ€ and â€œIâ€™m going to fucking kill you,â€ two of the men screamed.

Police said the third man lifted a gun and fired it at a counter-protester. The bullet missed. The three men, all of whom had traveled to Gainesville from Texas for the Richard Spencer speech, were later arrested on attempted murder charges.
TITLE: HuffPost Special Report: When White Hate Comes To Town

TEXT:
Lors de son passage Ã  l'Ã©mission Deux hommes en or vendredi, Virginie Fortin s'en est pris Ã  Pierre-Yves McSween, qui avait fait une blague qu'elle a jugÃ© dÃ©placÃ©e lors de la rÃ©union d'humoristes pour dÃ©cider de l'avenir de Juste pour rire lundi dernier.

Alors que Virginie abordait le sens de l'humour parfois douteux d'Ã‰ric Salvail, elle est revenue sur un Â«exemple trÃ¨s concret qui a eu lieu cette semaine.Â»

Â«Pierre-Yves McSween monte sur scÃ¨ne et vient faire un exposÃ© sur combien vaut Juste pour rire, et la vÃ©ritÃ© c'est que moi je m'en torche un petit peu parce que j'ai un profond dÃ©sir qu'on ouvre la discussion sur les relations entre les hommes et les femmes et les comportements dÃ©placÃ©s, et un humoriste lÃ¨ve la main et dit Â«Moi, je ne connais rien Ã  la comptabilitÃ©, c'est ma blonde qui s'occupe de Ã§a Ã  la maison.Â» Et Pierre-Yves McSween de dire Â«tu feras attention!Â» Et vois-tu? Ã‡a c'est une blague, et je ne veux pas condamner personne pour une blague, mais on leur donne des avertissements, on leur dit que ce n'Ã©tait peut-Ãªtre pas le timing idÃ©al pour faire une blague qui diminue clairement... Bon.Â»

Virginie Fortin dit que si elle aussi fait des blagues inappropriÃ©es parfois, elle trouve qu'il est temps qu'elle s'Ã©lÃ¨ve au-dessus de Ã§a, et que l'industrie fasse de mÃªme. Elle laisse entendre que les blagues sexistes sont souvent trop faciles Ã  faire.

Le comptable a trouvÃ© dÃ©plorable la rÃ©action de l'humoriste par rapport Ã  sa blague. Dans une longue publication Facebook, il explique qu'il n'a pas voulu Ãªtre sexiste. Â«Quand quelqu'un me dit "Moi, je ne m'occupe pas des finances Ã  la maison, je laisse tout Ã  ma conjointe", je trouve que c'est un comportement irresponsable et une mauvaise gestion des risques. Non pas parce que le (la) conjoint(e) est une femme, mais parce qu'on ne devrait jamais laisser 100% du contrÃ´le Ã  l'autre sans y accorder un minimum de suivi ou d'importanceÂ» a-t-il Ã©crit. Â«Alors, quand j'ai rÃ©pondu Ã  l'humoriste "tu feras attention", avec le sourire, c'Ã©tait une blague imprÃ©gnÃ©e d'un message trÃ¨s sÃ©rieux du point de vue des finances personnelles. Tout dÃ©lÃ©guer Ã  son conjoint est une erreur, c'est mÃªme carrÃ©ment une mauvaise idÃ©e. Si l'humoriste avait eu un homme comme conjoint, j'aurais fait la mÃªme blague, avec le mÃªme ton. Si une femme avait dit "je dÃ©lÃ¨gue tout Ã  mon conjoint" j'aurais fait de mÃªme. Pour une fille qui a Ã©tÃ© porte-parole pour des publicitÃ©s de Desjardins, je trouve cela bien triste de constater que tu ne comprends pas cette nuanceÂ», explique-t-il.

McSween n'a pas aimÃ© la rÃ©action de Virginie Fortin en ondes. Â«Me traiter de sexiste en pleine tÃ©lÃ©vision pour cette rÃ©ponse, c'est non seulement dÃ©montrer du mÃ©pris, mais aussi du sexisme. C'est prendre pour acquis que ma rÃ©ponse aurait Ã©tÃ© diffÃ©rente pour une femme qui aurait dit la mÃªme chose d'un homme. Je trouve ces propos non seulement blessants, mais inappropriÃ©sÂ» Ã©crit-il.

De plus, McSween explique que cette rencontre Ã©tait privÃ©e et qu'il est venu pour donner un coup de main d'un point de vue fiscal. Â«Quand, de mon cÃ´tÃ©, je prends ma journÃ©e pour vous aider, la derniÃ¨re chose Ã  laquelle je m'attends est de me faire manquer de respect par la suiteÂ», explique-t-il.

Il semble que Fortin a mal compris l'intention derriÃ¨re la blague de McSween, et que ce dernier voulait remettre les pendules Ã  l'heure avec sa publication Facebook.
TITLE: Pierre-Yves McSween rÃ©pond aux critiques de Virginie Fortin

es gibt Interviews, die liest man und vergisst sie sofort wieder. Und es gibt Interviews, die einen nachdenklich stimmen und im Kopf bleiben. Ihr Interview mit der Berliner Zeitung vom 25. Oktober 2017 hat mich nicht nur nachdenklich gestimmt - es ist an Frechheit nicht zu Ã¼berbieten!

Der in der Wissenschaft von Ihnen beschriebenen â€šÃ¼berall bestaunten Entwicklung' der vergangenen Jahre steht eine allgemeine Fehlentwicklung gegenÃ¼ber, die Sie als "PrivatbÃ¼rger" schon lange leider nicht mehr sehen.

Die Ansiedlung des Internet-Instituts macht es auch nicht wieder gut, dass mit dem Bau von bezahlbarem Wohnraum unter einer Senatorin Lompscher noch nicht einmal begonnen wurde - stattdessen holt sie Stasi-Spezi Holm immer wieder in ihr Team, dessen Expertise bislang keine notwendige Wohnung hat entstehen lassen. Sie verkennen, dass es nicht um "da werden wir noch besser" oder "Schritt fÃ¼r Schritt merken es die BÃ¼rger" geht. Sie und Ihre Politik sind Teil des Problems, das bei vielen Menschen zu einem verlorenen Vertrauen in die Politik beitrÃ¤gt.

Seit Jahrzehnten regiert Ihre SPD unsere Stadt, die fÃ¼r viele Menschen leider mittlerweile gefÃ¼hlt ein "failed state" ist. Es ist polemisch, wenn man diesen Eindruck nicht durch politisches Handeln entkrÃ¤ftet und bei den Wartezeiten in den Ã„mtern von "immerhin halbiert" spricht.

Sie Ã¤ndern das Verfahren, ohne mit der Wimper zu zucken. Sie fÃ¼hren eine Entscheidung in der Sache im Abgeordnetenhaus herbei, obwohl diese Sachfrage lÃ¤ngst von einer Mehrheit von knapp einer Millionen Menschen, verbunden mit einem klaren Auftrag zur Offenhaltung von TXL beantwortet wurde.

Die Verantwortung im Aufsichtsrat haben Sie ja bereits abgegeben. Den Arbeitsnachweis Ihrer SPD-Regierungszeit dÃ¼rfen jetzt nicht zuletzt die Mitarbeiter von Air Berlin erleben.

Als BundesratsprÃ¤sident wollen Sie "Berlin als Brennpunkt solcher Entwicklungen" einbringen. Meinen Sie damit die Brennpunkte Tiergarten, Kottbuser Tor oder Hermannplatz? Meinen Sie den Brennpunkt Schulen? Meinen Sie den Brennpunkt Verwaltung? Welchen der vielen Brennpunkte meinen Sie?

SUMMARY:
This Spicy Italian "Sausage" Pasta hits two birds with one stone with the ask for more dinner recipes and more plant-based protein options!
It's pretty much a win win win win win.
Let me know if the tempeh "sausage" passes the test.
Combine all tempeh sausage ingredients (except tempeh) into a small bowl.
When your sauce is the desired consistency, add the tempeh sausage to the sauce.
TEXT:
I'm slowly making my way through the list of requests my readers sent in and I have to say thank you again because it has been inspiring some major creativity and new ideas in the kitchen. This Spicy Italian "Sausage" Pasta hits two birds with one stone with the ask for more dinner recipes and more plant-based protein options!

Growing up, my mom used to always make us her famous Spicy Italian Sausage Penne Pasta, inspired by the Bread Garden and man, was it good! To this day, it's still one of the family favourites in the rotation when we all go home to visit. There's just something so comforting about a warm bowl of pasta, and of course, the table full of good conversation and family love doesn't hurt either.

While I do still love my mom's original recipe, I've been playing around a lot with tempeh lately and got the idea to try substituting the sausage for a meat-free version. It's taken a couple of tries to get it just right but I think I've found the winning combo!

I just got to Hawaii yesterday (woohoo!) to visit my sister and they've been trying out a more plant-based diet, so I'm really excited to make this for them and see if it passes the three-year-old test...

I love tempeh as a plant-based protein substitute because it's also a great source of fibre and it's got the gut-healthy benefits of probiotics. It's pretty much a win win win win win.

This one's definitely going to be on repeat this fall and winter in our house. It's super easy to throw together, so enjoy it for a Sunday dinner or treat yourself any night of the week!

I know this recipe looks a lot longer than what I usually share but the steps really are quite simple so don't be intimidated by that! Most are just different spices.

Time-saving tip: Use your favorite store-bought tomato sauce instead of making your own.

If you try it out, I'd love to hear what you think of it! Let me know if the tempeh "sausage" passes the test. Follow me on Instagram and tag me in your creations so I can see what you're up to! I'll also be sharing my Hawaiian adventure over there for the next two weeks, if you're interested in seeing what we're getting up to!

Serves 3-4

Ingredients

1 1/2 cups dry rotini or penne noodles (Note: I always find it confusing when pasta is listed in grams so I find this method much easier! This will cook up to approximately three cups cooked pasta so if you'd like bigger servings, increase accordingly!)

Spicy Tempeh "Sausage"

1 x 200 g package of tempeh

2 tbsp olive oil, divided

1 tbsp Italian spice blend

1 tsp fennel, ground

Â½ tsp onion powder

Â½ tsp garlic powder

Â½ tsp. chili peppers (flakes), dried (adjust or omit if you don't like spice)

â…› tsp pepper

Â¼ cup soy sauce

Sauce (or replace for your favorite store-bought sauce)

2 tbsp olive oil

10 plum tomatoes, cut into eight pieces each (quartered and then halved again)

3 cloves garlic, minced

Â½ of a medium red onion, roughly chopped

2 cups water

Coarse salt and freshly-cracked pepper to taste (approx â…› tsp each and increase to taste)

Â¼ cup fresh basil

Directions:

Cook pasta according to package directions. Combine all tempeh sausage ingredients (except tempeh) into a small bowl. Whisk together with a fork and set aside. Cut your block of tempeh into four strips, lengthwise. Next, on a diagonal, cut each strip into bite-sized pieces (like you would slicing up a sausage into oblong coin-like pieces). Start cooking your pasta, according to package directions. Drain and set aside. If it starts to clump together before you mix with the sauce, run hot water over it to separate the noodles right before mixing with your sauce. Next, over medium-high heat, add your tempeh and sauce to a large frying pan. Cover with two cups of water and bring to a boil. Once boiling, reduce to a simmer and allow all liquid to boil off, approximately 10-15 minutes. (If you're using a store-bought tomato sauce, skip steps six and seven) Meanwhile, heat two tablespoons olive oil in a medium frying pan over medium-high heat. Once heated, add your onion and saute for about two minutes. Add your garlic and cook an additional two-three minutes, until both garlic and onion are translucent and fragrant. Next add tomatoes to the olive oil and reduce to a simmer to cook down, approx 10-15 minutes. You want this to cook down into a chunky sauce. When your sauce is the desired consistency, add the tempeh sausage to the sauce. Finish with the fresh basil and adjust the flavour with any extra salt, pepper or chili flakes if needed. Finish by tossing the noodles in the sauce, stir to combine well and serve!

Happy eating!

Xo Lindsay

TITLE: You Won't Miss The Meat In This Spicy Tempeh 'Sausage' Rotini

Since then it has been up to each tech giant - Apple, Microsoft, Google, Whatsapp, Twitter, Facebook - to decide how they want to display the icon.
TEXT:
If youâ€™re anything like us, your Monday to-do list would have included surviving that 9.30 meeting and deleting all the unread emails in your inbox. But for Googleâ€™s CEO Sundar Pichai, his top priority at the start of this new week will be an emergency redesign of the brandâ€™s hamburger emoji. This is after a Twitter outcry at the weekend, when a user noticed that the cheese slice had been placed underneath the beef patty. Our poor eyes.

I think we need to have a discussion about how Google's burger emoji is placing the cheese underneath the burger, while Apple puts it on top pic.twitter.com/PgXmCkY3Yc October 28, 2017

It was writer and publisher Thomas Baekdal who first drew our attention to the mess that is the Google hamburger. Not only did they include a tomato under the lettuce (everyone knows they are just a soggy-bun inducing disaster) but they also made the executive decision to put the cheese slice under the hamburger. Ensuring a soggy bottom as well as top. And to think this horror show went through several rounds of approval. In response Pichai has promised that Google will resolve their mistakes this week, but only if the internet can agree on the correct way to do this - which doesnâ€™t hold much hope for actually getting this sorted anytime soon.

Will drop everything else we are doing and address on Monday:) if folks can agree on the correct way to do this! https://t.co/dXRuZnX1Ag â€” Sundar Pichai (@sundarpichai) October 29, 2017

According to Emojipedia - the definitive catalogue of all things emoji - the hamburger emoji was first approved as part of a Unicode 6.0 round in 2010 and subsequently added to Emoji 1.0 five years later in 2015. Since then it has been up to each tech giant - Apple, Microsoft, Google, Whatsapp, Twitter, Facebook - to decide how they want to display the icon. But Google it seems, werenâ€™t to be trusted with such power. After a quick browse around the definitive emoji catalogue, there is not one other design (out of the 13 out there on our devices) that thought the cheese below meat was acceptable.

Google just had to be difficult #hamburgergate pic.twitter.com/golnf6gYjC â€” Sophie Gallagher (@SCFGallagher) October 30, 2017

And while weâ€™re at it Pichai, can we possibly get the beer fixed too?
TITLE: Google Will 'Drop Everything' To Fix That Hamburger Emoji After Public Outcry, Says CEO

SUMMARY:
This is somewhere I need to be,â€ Jennifer Onwenu, a 25-year-old from Detroit, Mich., told HuffPost.
But several women HuffPost spoke to said they had not marched.
They felt driven to go to the Womenâ€™s Convention because they wanted to join what organizers have taken pains to paint as an ongoing movement, rather than a one-time event.
â€œItâ€™s just very inspirational to be able to be a part of it from now on.â€Catherine Pearson/HuffPost Karen Dunnam, 60, posed in front of a poster at the Women's Convention wearing her fall "pussy hat."
Another attendee, who wore a Wonder Woman T-shirt and a pink â€œpussy hatâ€ covered in feminist pins, told HuffPost sheâ€™d knit it especially for the occasion.
TEXT:
DETROITâ€” The day after President Donald J. Trump took office last January, millions of people joined womenâ€™s marches around the world, setting attendance records and elevating expectations about what organized resistance to the ideals that gave rise to the 45th president could look like.

Nine months later, the crowd gathered in Detroit for the inaugural Womenâ€™s Convention â€” which was put together by the same organizers â€” was a fraction of the size, but for the reported 4,000 attendees, that same energy was still there.

â€œI was like, this is something I have to be a part of. This is somewhere I need to be,â€ Jennifer Onwenu, a 25-year-old from Detroit, Mich., told HuffPost. â€œThe women that I have met, the lessons I have learned to take back to my community as far as organizing and mobilizing people, have been so useful.â€

â€œItâ€™s a national womenâ€™s conference in Detroit. Why wouldnâ€™t I be here?â€ echoed Deborah Bunklay, 63, also from Detroit. Bunklay received a scholarship to the convention, covering the nearly $300 cost of a three-day ticket.

She and her friend, Cheryl Bukoff, 72, said they were particularly struck by the diversity of the gathering. A heterogenous crowd of women â€” and a few men â€” networked under soaring banners that declared they were â€œreclaiming our time.â€

Catherine Pearson/HuffPost The convention included an "art gallery" with pieces curated by the design lab Amplifier.

â€œOne of the the things I think is most important is that there are many younger women here, and that for many of us have been active for a long time, we know we need to have the young women taking leadership,â€ Bukoff said. â€œIâ€™d be glad to support any of them.â€

Over three days, attendees listened to panels like, â€œ94 percent voted against Trump: following black women in 2018â€ and â€œHow to organize a protest/rally in less than 24 hours!â€ EMILYâ€™s List, the group that works to elect Democratic women who support abortion rights, hosted a free half-day training for those interested in running for local elections. Indeed, much of the convention focused on the goal of Democrats gaining ground in the 2018 midterm elections.

There were also addresses from public figures such as Rose McGowan, who spoke publicly for the first time since accusing Harvey Weinstein of rape, and fiery speeches from Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand (D-NY) and Sen. Amy Klobuchar (D-MN), both of whom have been floated as potential presidential candidates. Both Congresswomen were met with standing ovations and raucous cheers.

On Saturday, Rep. Maxine Waters (D-Calif.) led an enthusiastic crowd in chants of â€œImpeach 45!â€ and told cheering attendees how thrilled she had been to march with them last winter.

But several women HuffPost spoke to said they had not marched. They felt driven to go to the Womenâ€™s Convention because they wanted to join what organizers have taken pains to paint as an ongoing movement, rather than a one-time event.

â€œI feel like I really missed a lot,â€ said Zitlatlli Roman, 27, from Ill. whose employer paid for her to go to the convention. â€œItâ€™s just very inspirational to be able to be a part of it from now on.â€

Catherine Pearson/HuffPost Karen Dunnam, 60, posed in front of a poster at the Women's Convention wearing her fall "pussy hat."

Another attendee, who wore a Wonder Woman T-shirt and a pink â€œpussy hatâ€ covered in feminist pins, told HuffPost sheâ€™d knit it especially for the occasion. It was lighter than the wool version sheâ€™d worn while marching in January.

Whether or not the convention is considered a success is largely a matter of spin and perspective. News outlets have called it a â€œtestâ€ of the movement that grew out of last winterâ€™s marches, and it is not certain whether organizers met the ticket sales goals theyâ€™d initially set forth.

But at the Cobo Center, where the mood was frequently jubilant, it was clear that many attendees got exactly the kind of camaraderie they had come for.
TITLE: Thousands Went To The Womenâ€™s Convention. And It Was Just What They Needed.

Temperatures fell as low as minus 5C in parts of Scotland and northern England as the autumnâ€™s first widespread grass frost spread across the country.
Sunday night saw temperatures broadly plummet into low single figures.

TEXT:
Much of us woke to the first frost of the season on Monday morning with temperatures in some places dipping below zero. Temperatures fell as low as minus 5C in parts of Scotland and northern England as the autumnâ€™s first widespread grass frost spread across the country. Sunday night saw temperatures broadly plummet into low single figures.

Dry and bright for many. Some rain in the northwest. Here to help with your weather queries. ^Eric pic.twitter.com/M8xsdRYxEI â€” Met Office (@metoffice) October 30, 2017

Met Office forecaster Matthew Box said: â€œWhat we have is high pressure centred over parts of the UK, and thatâ€™s bringing a northerly flow across, in particular, eastern parts of the UK, and itâ€™s brought northerly winds and polar maritime air mass across the UK. â€œWith that cooler air coming down and the high pressure moving slowly but surely eastwards, the combination of that cold air and the clear skies associated with that high pressure are going to allow temperatures to drop off.â€

Just how cold did it get? Below freezing for lots of us, with -5 Â°C at Tulloch Bridge pic.twitter.com/vOEUQKgYrK â€” Met Office (@metoffice) October 30, 2017
TITLE: Met Office Weather Forecasts First Frost Of The Year As Temperatures Dip To -5C

TEXT:
Un auto transita por una carretera daÃ±ada en las secuelas del huracÃ¡n MarÃ­a en Humacao, Puerto Rico el 2 de octubre del 2017.

DespuÃ©s de escribir y leer "arrasado", "devastado" y "destruido" cientos de veces, las palabras pierden significado. Â¿CÃ³mo explicar la magnitud de la destrucciÃ³n que dejÃ³ el huracÃ¡n MarÃ­a en Puerto Rico?

Cuando se dice que este territorio estadounidense perdiÃ³ su energÃ­a elÃ©ctrica y quedÃ³ incomunicado, pocos imaginan cÃ³mo eso afectÃ³ la vida de cada uno de sus 3,4 millones de habitantes.

Los vientos de MarÃ­a, que entrÃ³ como categorÃ­a 4, golpearon Puerto Rico la maÃ±ana del miÃ©rcoles 20 de septiembre a 155 millas por hora (250 Km/h). AFP ya tenÃ­a en el terreno a tres reporteros, a los que se sumaron otros dos una semana despuÃ©s. AquÃ­ los cinco cuentan cÃ³mo fue para ellos cubrir el peor desastre natural que golpea la isla en un siglo.

SUSCRÃBETE Y SÃGUENOS Enviarme diariamente por correo electrÃ³nico los blogs y las notas mÃ¡s destacadas. EntÃ©rate de mÃ¡s Newsletter Por favor escribe una direcciÃ³n de correo electrÃ³nico Â¡Gracias por suscribirte! Pronto estarÃ¡s recibiendo un correo para confirmar tu suscripciÃ³n. El trabajo tiene que salir

Ricardo Arduengo, fotÃ³grafo en Puerto Rico

De pequeÃ±o vivÃ­ el huracÃ¡n Hugo, que golpeÃ³ esta isla en 1989. Luego, como periodista, me ha tocado cubrir otras tormentas, como el huracÃ¡n Irene en RepÃºblica Dominicana en 2011. Pero yo nunca habÃ­a visto una como esta.

La destrucciÃ³n esta vez pegÃ³ en casa, literalmente. Mi familia estaba en Barranquita, en el centro de la isla y, como no habÃ­a comunicaciones y estaba cerrado el paso, demorÃ© tres dÃ­as en ir para saber si estaban bien. Al igual que en los demÃ¡s lugares, habÃ­a Ã¡rboles caÃ­dos alrededor, pero, por suerte, solamente se rompiÃ³ una ventana.

RecibÃ­ el huracÃ¡n en Fajardo, en el este de la isla, en el mismo lugar donde cubrÃ­ la llegada del huracÃ¡n Irma dos semanas antes. Por ahÃ­ no iba a pasar el ojo de MarÃ­a, pero sÃ­ estaba bastante cerca.

PasÃ© la noche en un catre y a las 5 de la maÃ±ana ya el viento estaba soplando bastante fuerte. Como a las 10 de la maÃ±ana el rÃ­o Fajardo se habÃ­a desbordado y estaba cerca de la alcaldÃ­a, aunque no llegÃ³ a entrar.

Hubo un momento de tranquilidad en medio de la tormenta en que pude salir e hice un par de fotos de un seÃ±or rescatando de un garaje que tenÃ­a al lado de su casa unos gallos de pelea. Estaba cargando uno de los animales con el agua hasta la cintura.

DespuÃ©s de la tormenta recorrÃ­ toda la isla. Casi todas las fotos que hice con dron tambiÃ©n las habÃ­a hecho desde abajo, como la del hombre que estÃ¡ caminando en la inundaciÃ³n. Esa escena solo podÃ­a ilustrarla bien si la tomaba desde arriba.

AÃºn a pesar de que esta es una situaciÃ³n que me toca en lo personal, me concentrÃ© en mostrar la historia. Hay momentos en que a uno se le hace un nudo en la garganta frente a todo este dolor, pero uno tiene que seguir. TratÃ© de concentrarme en hacer mi trabajo. "Estoy retratando. Si dejo que me afecte, va a afectar el trabajo", pensÃ©.

Mi responsabilidad aquÃ­ no es solamente como puertorriqueÃ±o. No hago esto solo porque quiero que el mundo vea lo que estÃ¡ pasando aquÃ­. Trabajo igual si estoy cubriendo otro tipo de noticias. Estoy pensando en que el trabajo tiene que salir, en que hay que mostrar lo que estÃ¡ pasando.

La responsabilidad de ser testigo

ElÃ©onore Sens, videorreportera en Washington

Por primera vez en mi joven carrera de periodista sentÃ­ el peso de la responsabilidad de nuestro oficio. Mientras tenÃ­a lugar una disputa mediÃ¡tica entre la alcaldesa de la capital puertorriqueÃ±a, Carmen YulÃ­n Cruz, y el presidente Donald Trump sobre la entrega -o no- de la ayuda a Puerto Rico, presenciÃ© una catÃ¡strofe natural y humanitaria. Cada imagen filmada y testimonio era prueba de la urgencia de la situaciÃ³n a la que estÃ¡bamos asistiendo.

Apenas salimos de San Juan, las condiciones de vida de los pobladores eran cada vez mÃ¡s rudimentarias. No tenÃ­an agua corriente, electricidad, cobertura telefÃ³nica y, muy a menudo, ni siquiera una casa digna de este nombre.

La gente que nos cruzÃ¡bamos tomaba agua del rÃ­o a falta de provisiones. Algunos lo perdieron todo: su hogar, su sustento. Los puertorriqueÃ±os ni siquiera podÃ­an contarles a sus familiares si estaban bien o no.

Luego, a medida que nos alejamos de la ciudad, los habitantes de los pueblos que nos cruzÃ¡bamos no habÃ­an visto ninguna ayuda. MÃ¡s de diez dÃ­as despuÃ©s de la catÃ¡strofe, los testimonios eran todos iguales: nadie del ejÃ©rcito, ni de FEMA (fondo federal de EU de ayuda para desastres), ni ninguna autoridad gubernamental habÃ­an venido para ayudar a estas personas totalmente aisladas del mundo.

Sin embargo, frente a una situaciÃ³n insoportable, la resistencia de los puertorriqueÃ±os me impresionÃ³. En lugar de llorar por la falta de ayuda, la mayorÃ­a de la gente parecÃ­a organizarse por su cuenta y ayudarse mutuamente. Conocimos, por ejemplo, a profesionales de la salud que iban a los refugios para proveer tratamientos y medicinas.

A veces uno se olvidaba de la gravedad y la angustia de esta situaciÃ³n. Estos paisajes tan caÃ³ticos se me hicieron familiares. La gente nos sonreÃ­a y nos agradecÃ­a por venir a reportear. Pero luego habÃ­a algunos recordatorios.

Una noche vimos una niÃ±a que prÃ¡cticamente vivÃ­a entre planchas de chapa hÃºmeda: su casa habÃ­a volado con MarÃ­a. El grado de insalubridad en el que vivÃ­a me impactÃ³. Su madre no habÃ­a recibido ninguna ayuda de las autoridades y, aÃºn asÃ­, mientras escribo esto, el presidente estadounidense habla de quitar la ayuda a este territorio.

Cubrir un huracÃ¡n con otro desastre en casa

JosÃ© Osorio, videorreportero en MÃ©xico

El 18 de septiembre estaba listo para cubrir al dÃ­a siguiente el aniversario del sismo que matÃ³ a miles de personas en MÃ©xico en 1985 cuando sonÃ³ el telÃ©fono y mi editora en Montevideo me pidiÃ³ que viajara a Puerto Rico a cubrir el huracÃ¡n. LleguÃ© a San Juan al otro dÃ­a, justo antes del cierre del aeropuerto, a tiempo para ir a Fajardo a recibir la tormenta.

ParÃ© en una gasolinera en la ruta para grabar a la gente haciendo fila para llenar el tanque de gasolina. Eran pasadas las dos de la tarde y era tambiÃ©n el inicio de otra desgracia, en tierra propia y sin vientos huracanados, otra cara de la furia de nuestro planeta-isla.

Me llamÃ³ mi novia para decirme que en MÃ©xico acababa de temblar. La escuchÃ© muy nerviosa y tratÃ© de calmarla, pensando que era otro de esos temblores que solo causan un susto menor. Pero no, este era otra cosa, otro calibre.

Me vi en una situaciÃ³n difÃ­cil. TenÃ­a que llegar a Fajardo porque en unas horas mÃ¡s entrarÃ­a el huracÃ¡n MarÃ­a, pero sentÃ­a ya ganas de regresar y estar con los mÃ­os en MÃ©xico. TardÃ© poco mÃ¡s de un dÃ­a en saber que toda mi gente estaba bien, y tambiÃ©n me fui enterando de que el edificio donde vivimos se habÃ­a daÃ±ado, que el edificio de mi padre se habÃ­a resquebrajado y que Ã©l no podÃ­a seguir viviendo ahÃ­.

Mientras me preparaba para el huracÃ¡n, mentalmente me estaba preparando para regresar en algÃºn momento a mi ciudad, que ya no iba a ser la misma. Pero la posibilidad de volver al DF se desvanecÃ­a. El dÃ­a despuÃ©s del paso de MarÃ­a tuve que salir de la alcaldÃ­a de Fajardo, el lugar donde nos resguardamos, para poder transmitir desde un hotel, que habÃ­a sufrido daÃ±os severos pero pudo mantenerse operando.

El trayecto me mostrÃ³ la gravedad de los daÃ±os. Cientos de Ã¡rboles caÃ­dos, postes en el piso, cables colgando, zonas inundadas, nadie en la calle. Tuve que hacerme a la idea de que estarÃ­a ahÃ­ un buen rato y me dediquÃ©, junto con mis compaÃ±eros, a cubrir de la mejor manera posible esa otra desgracia. PasÃ³ otra semana antes de que pudiera dejar Puerto Rico.

â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹

La Ãºnica forma que hay

HÃ©ctor Retamal, fotÃ³grafo en HaitÃ­

Vivo en HaitÃ­ desde hace 4 aÃ±os. Y hace un aÃ±o cubrÃ­ el huracÃ¡n Matthew. Las situaciones que vemos, el dolor de las personas por el azote de los desastres naturales, claramente nos afecta. Pero debemos procesar estos sentimientos. Trato de canalizar toda esa energÃ­a para mostrar lo que ocurre en mis fotos.

En los dÃ­as siguientes al paso del HuracÃ¡n MarÃ­a tratÃ© de mostrar cÃ³mo fue afectada la poblaciÃ³n: casas destruidas y personas buscando agua o cocinando en la noche fuera de las ruinas de sus casas como MarÃ­a, una mujer de Toa Alta que cocinaba afuera de su casa, alumbrÃ¡ndose con una linterna.

A medida que pasaban los dÃ­as intentÃ© buscar historias que mostraran cÃ³mo las personas afectadas luchaban y salÃ­an adelante, a pesar de haberlo perdido todo. Me gusta especialmente la imagen del joven con una bandera que dice "voy a ti Puerto Rico", que significa "hincho por ti", porque para mÃ­ simboliza fuerza y esperanza despuÃ©s de la destrucciÃ³n.

No tienen sentido ir allÃ­ a tomar fotos y ni siquiera saber quÃ© les pasÃ³.

Unos dÃ­as antes de volver a HaitÃ­ visitÃ© a las personas que habÃ­a fotografiado en los dÃ­as posteriores al huracÃ¡n.

Debemos estar cerca, no tan solo para tener buenas imÃ¡genes, sino por respeto hacia los afectados . No tienen sentido ir allÃ­ a tomar fotos y ni siquiera saber quÃ© les pasÃ³ o no mostrar interÃ©s en sus relatos y sus vidas. Por eso siempre intento volver a verlos antes de marcharme. Quiero que sientan que a alguien le importa su dolor.

Trabajando en la oscuridad

Leila Macor, corresponsal en Miami

MarÃ­a dejÃ³ en Puerto Rico una crisis humanitaria e hizo retroceder a sus habitantes dÃ©cadas atrÃ¡s en tÃ©rminos de telecomunicaciones. No habÃ­a electricidad, agua corriente, telÃ©fono ni internet. En este contexto cubrir la noticia fue particularmente desafiante.

TenÃ­amos un telÃ©fono satelital para emergencias y dos terminales de internet satelital BGAN, con los que podÃ­amos transmitir, aunque no revisar continuamente la prensa en la web. Un recurso tan elemental del oficio como confirmar una noticia era una odisea. Normalmente todo lo que hay que hacer es un par de llamadas telefÃ³nicas.

Ahora, la Ãºnica forma de saber si un rumor era cierto era yendo al pueblo en cuestiÃ³n y preguntarle a los residentes si habÃ­an visto pasar al alcalde por allÃ­, para consultarle a Ã©l sobre el asunto.

TrabajÃ¡bamos a oscuras la mayor parte del tiempo, sin ver la "big picture" hasta que llegaba la noche y nos conectÃ¡bamos en el Centro de Convenciones en San Juan, donde todavÃ­a hoy opera el gobierno y habÃ­a una sala de prensa.

AllÃ­ nos enterÃ¡bamos de que Trump habÃ­a dicho durante el dÃ­a que los periodistas estÃ¡bamos exagerando. Con una triste impotencia, tocaba transmitir lo que habÃ­amos visto y que Ã©l no nos creÃ­a.

Los puertorriqueÃ±os no tenÃ­an adÃ³nde ir ni cÃ³mo irse. No funcionaban los hospitales. Los enfermos estaban sufriendo. No habÃ­a nada abierto. No se podÃ­a llamar a nadie. Tras el paso de MarÃ­a, cada residente estaba -y estÃ¡, muchos siguen estando- solo, en su casa o lo que quedÃ³ de ella, sano o herido, en un pequeÃ±o universo personal en el que los dÃ­as transcurrÃ­an lentamente, buscando quÃ© comer, quÃ© beber y dÃ³nde baÃ±arse.

La ayuda comenzÃ³ a llegar a cuentagotas despuÃ©s de que el tema se volviÃ³ polÃ©mico. Pasada una semana, aÃºn los pobladores de los pueblos del interior nos recibÃ­an con la esperanza de que fuÃ©ramos la FEMA o la Cruz Roja. Pero no. "Somos periodistas", les decÃ­amos. "Lo Ãºnico que podemos hacer es contar tu historia".

Por eso, los textos que salieron desde el terreno tuvieron la misma atmÃ³sfera que las fotografÃ­as y los videos de mis colegas: eran retratos de los damnificados que nos cruzÃ¡bamos; imÃ¡genes en palabras, escenas, microhistorias.

Alesha Dixon has shared an update on how Simon Cowell is doing, after stepping in to replace him on Sundayâ€™s (29 October) â€˜X Factorâ€™ .

Speaking to HuffPost UK on the red carpet at the Pride Of Britain Awards - which Simon had been planning to attend prior to his ill-health - Alesha said: â€œHeâ€™s doing okay, and I wish him a speedy recovery and I want him back there next week.â€

Addressing what it was like to briefly swap â€˜Britainâ€™s Got Talentâ€™ for â€˜X Factorâ€™, she added: â€œI was there under not the best circumstances. Iâ€™m glad that none of Simonâ€™s acts went home under my watch.

â€œAnd yes, Iâ€™d much rather had been at home with a cup of tea watching Simon on the show.

â€œBut we are all like a family and I help where I can I was glad to help him out.â€
TITLE: Alesha Dixon Shares An Update On Simon Cowell After Temporarily Replacing Him On 'X Factor'

SUMMARY:
Davis and Cranston's episode 'Human Is' is based on the short story of the same name set in a distant future.
The investors could rest assured, fans wanted to see Miss Fisher on the big screen.
"I think there are many elements to why fans love 'Miss Fisher', but I'm sure it's Phryne's independence with joy.
Back to the idea of love and kindness defining us as human, Davis notes Phryne Fisher embodies that and more.
You can catch Davis in 'Philip K. Dick's Electric Dreams' in the episode 'Human Is' now streaming exclusively on Stan.
TEXT:
There's something magnetic about Essie Davis that demands your attention, both on and off screen, so it's no surprise that she's been linked to projects with massive fan followings.

From 'Game of Thrones' and 'The Babadook' to 'Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries' Davis has amassed a devoted following in each role she inhabits.

"I like to play roles that are very different from each other," Davis told HuffPost Australia.

"But you don't always get to choose your roles, quite often they choose you."

Recently Davis starred alongside Bryan Cranston in an episode of 'Phillip K. Dick's Electric Dreams', an anthology series of 10 standalone episodes based on Dick's work.

Davis and Cranston's episode 'Human Is' is based on the short story of the same name set in a distant future. Davis plays Vera, a woman whose cold husband -- Silas, played by Cranston -- chips away at her emotionally. Their loveless marriage is as desolate as the dying Earth.

When Silas travels to the nearby planet Rexor IV he comes back changed, for the better, but it begins to dawn on Vera that perhaps this is no longer her husband. If he really has been taken over by something otherworldly, does that make him any less human?

Bryan Cranston and Essie Davis in 'Human Is'.

"[Vera] is a powerful woman who is incredibly vulnerable in her relationship, and living with that kind of oppression while still having a very high powered role... versus what's happening at home," Davis said.

"I've been fortunate to have the opportunities to have played to many strong women, and I've also played many vulnerable women. Finding that strength and the reason behind, sometimes being soft is strong, sometimes being flexible is the strongest position to take. Even in good, caring relationships equality is not necessarily equality."

At the heart of the episode is the question what makes us human? What defines humanity?

When we asked Davis what she thought the answer to those questions would be she thought for a moment before saying, "having great intelligence is one thing, but having the capacity to care for each other is another".

"Love, kindness and democracy make us human. Caring for another person, that's really the essence of what defines humanity."

Davis is no stranger to love; as we mentioned some of her roles have garnered cult-like followings.

Recently the producers behind the 'Miss Fisher' series set up a crowdfunding page. The aim was to fill a funding gap in the production budget as well as to assure investors there was a keen fan base hungry for a 'Miss Fisher' movie.

In less than two days they had reached their initial goal of $250,000. By the end of the Kickstarter campaign they had raised over $700,000. The investors could rest assured, fans wanted to see Miss Fisher on the big screen.

"I think there are many elements to why fans love 'Miss Fisher', but I'm sure it's Phryne's independence with joy. There's something so attractive about being around a happy person," she laughed, immediately proving her own point.

Davis starring as Phryne Fisher in 'Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries'.

"She can break the rules in the most satisfyingly naughty way, but for the good of all. She stands up for the underdog, male or female, she's a feminist but she's a lover. She loves men but she won't be treated badly by them, the ones who try... she gets one over."

Back to the idea of love and kindness defining us as human, Davis notes Phryne Fisher embodies that and more.

"That burst between Jack and Phryne, there's nothing more attractive that you want to lean into than watching people fall in love with each other."

Miss Fisher isn't the only role Davis is tied to, she mentioned the other project she's constantly recognised for is playing Amelia in Jennifer Kent's 2014 film 'The Babadook'. The film made little waves in Australia but began to snowball when it traveled overseas, becoming a cult favourite of audiences.

Then there was the resurgence of the film this year, with the internet christening the character of the Babadook as a queer icon.

"We've all been very, very amused," Davis laughed at the mention of the Babadook's newfound status. "I'm very happy we've acquired an even wider audience.

"It's a great film and yes, the Babadook does want to get out of that closet. I love it, I think it's great."

You can catch Davis in 'Philip K. Dick's Electric Dreams' in the episode 'Human Is' now streaming exclusively on Stan.
TITLE: Essie Davis Is Exploring What It Means To Be Human, On And Off Screen

SUMMARY:
But more remarkable is that this record population growth has exceeded all forecasts.
Back then, slowing population growth was responded to with policy changes like the baby bonus and efforts to increase overseas migration.
Australia's population growth is now one of the highest in the developed world.
While population growth can't realistically be stopped, it must be better planned for and managed to ensure the Australian lifestyle continues.
And when in doubt, assume the higher growth forecasts not the lower ones.
TEXT:
"Sydney is now home to more people than the whole country of New Zealand."

Australia has increased its population by one third in the past 20 years, from 18.5 million in 1997 to 24.7 million people currently.

But more remarkable is that this record population growth has exceeded all forecasts. In 1998, the Australian Bureau of Statistics predicted that, based on low-growth assumptions, Australia's population would reach 23.5 million people in 2051, a benchmark it went on to achieve in July 2014.

â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹

The mid-growth forecast of 24.9 million people by 2051 will be reached in the middle of next year, 33 years early! The upper-end forecast of 26.4 million, based on high-growth assumptions, will be reached in mid-2021, less than four years away.

The current growth patterns of Australia will lead us to a population of 38 million by 2051, around 12 million higher than even the high-ball forecasts of the late '90s. It's not that the calculations were wrong, it's that migration policy changes as well as longevity increases and a solid birth rate have defied the trends that were evident 20 years ago.

Back then, it was assumed that the total fertility rate (babies per woman in a lifetime) would remain low. However, today's TFR of 1.81 is above even the highest assumption allowed for in the '90s of 1.75.

It was also thought that life expectancy at birth would hit a high of 82 for males and 86 for females by 2051. However, current life expectancy is already closing in on 81 for males and 85 for females and will reach these 2051 targets decades early.

The biggest growth factor that has blown out previous population modelling has been the rise and rise of Australia's net overseas migration. In 1998 it was thought that it would grow our population annually by around 70,000, or at the most, 90,000. In the past 12 months, Australia has added 231,900 through net migration which is more than 2.5 times even the high-forecast of two decades ago.

The expectations for our largest cities back in this era were also well below what has eventuated. This 1998 report expected Melbourne to reach a population of between 3.6 million and 4.5 million by 2051. It is currently well above this range at 4.8 million. Sydney was predicted to reach between 4.7 million and 6.2 million by the middle of this century. It is currently around 5.1 million and will reach the higher forecast within a decade, 23 years early.

While the late '90s may not seem like that long ago -- John Howard was Prime Minister, and Bill Clinton was the U.S. President -- the past two decades have seen significant shifts in our demographic trends.

Back then, slowing population growth was responded to with policy changes like the baby bonus and efforts to increase overseas migration. Australia's population growth is now one of the highest in the developed world.

We have added 390,000 people to our population in the past 12 months, which is like adding three cities the size of Darwin to our population each year. Sydney is now home to more people than the whole country of New Zealand. Speaking of which, New Zealand, back in 1998 was expected to reach 4.7 million in 2050 -- its population currently exceeds 4.8 million. Melbourne is growing even faster and rather than having 1.7 million fewer people than Sydney in 2051 as was predicted, it will likely overtake Sydney to be Australia's largest city this year.

The lesson for policy makers, urban planners and governments alike, is to keep a close eye on the population forecasts and plan early for the growth that is being experienced so that our cities are not left short of infrastructure.

While population growth can't realistically be stopped, it must be better planned for and managed to ensure the Australian lifestyle continues. And when in doubt, assume the higher growth forecasts not the lower ones. I'm yet to see an Australian population forecast that needs adjusting down.
TITLE: Why Australia's Population Has Boomed Beyond All Growth Forecasts

Les directions d'Option nationale et de QuÃ©bec solidaire invitent leurs membres dÃ©but dÃ©cembre Ã  ratifier une entente fusionnant les deux formations. Aucun indÃ©pendantiste ne peut Ãªtre contre l'addition de ces deux forces, mais les termes du projet de fusion rendent peu probable la stabilitÃ© d'un tel mariage. L'entente de principe nÃ©gociÃ©e prÃ©serve en effet le maintien d'Option nationale comme organisation au sein de QuÃ©bec solidaire. Elle lui octroie en outre un droit de prÃ©emption sur tout ce qui touche Ã  la question nationale et prÃ©voit le remplacement du programme indÃ©pendantiste de QS par celui d'ON.

TrÃ¨s pointilleux sur la question de l'Ã©galitÃ© des sexes, QS n'a pas de Â« chef Â», mais une porte-parole fÃ©minine et un porte-parole masculin. Sans Ã©gard aux statuts et sans Ã©lection, le projet d'entente ajoute un troisiÃ¨me porte-parole en la personne de Sol Zanetti : Â« 18. Le parti unifiÃ© mettra de l'avant le chef actuel d'ON dans les communications publiques et les activitÃ©s du parti unifiÃ© sur les enjeux entourant l'indÃ©pendance du QuÃ©bec Â». Zanetti se voit Ã©galement garantir sa candidature dans un comtÃ© Â« gagnable Â» en 2018, une hÃ©rÃ©sie pour une formation qui critique rÃ©guliÃ¨rement les partis traditionnels pour leur recours au parachutage de candidats.

Option nationale deviendrait un vÃ©ritable parti dans le parti.

Option nationale deviendrait un vÃ©ritable parti dans le parti. Il existe bien Ã  QS des Â« collectifs Â» (Ã©cosocialisme, laÃ¯citÃ©, jeunesse, etc.), mais ces collectifs n'ont ni budget ni pouvoirs particuliers. En pratique, ce sont de simples cercles de discussion. Il est par contre prÃ©vu qu'Option nationale deviendra un collectif avec budget autonome. Dans les faits, il sera le dÃ©positaire de l'orthodoxie souverainiste au sein de QS. Ce collectif ON contrÃ´lera la conception et la production de matÃ©riel sur l'indÃ©pendance, organisera une universitÃ© annuelle sur le sujet et fera rÃ©imprimer aux frais de QS son ouvrage leLivre qui fait dire oui. Le thÃ¨me de l'indÃ©pendance serait omniprÃ©sent, sur les communiquÃ©s, sur le logo, sur les affiches.

Option nationale obtient l'abandon du programme de QuÃ©bec solidaire sur l'indÃ©pendance et son remplacement par le sien. QS a toujours refusÃ© de hiÃ©rarchiser ses valeurs fondamentales, Ã©cologie, fÃ©minisme, justice et solidaritÃ© sociale, indÃ©pendance, dÃ©mocratie, respect des droits des minoritÃ©s et des autochtones, etc. Pour les solidaires, la souverainetÃ© n'a aucun sens sans projet de sociÃ©tÃ©. Ce que disaient d'ailleurs les souverainistes de la premiÃ¨re heure dans le programme du Parti quÃ©bÃ©cois de 1969. L'entente, elle, hiÃ©rarchise. Elle Ã©dicte que la lutte contre le Â« rÃ©gime colonial canadien Â» devra avoir une importance au moins Ã©gale Ã  celle contre le nÃ©olibÃ©ralisme, sans aucune mention des autres principes. Le QuÃ©bec, colonie du Canada ? DerriÃ¨re cet absurde raccourci historique se profile l'illusion que le QuÃ©bec peut proclamer unilatÃ©ralement son indÃ©pendance en invoquant un statut de colonie, une position intenable en droit international.

Le dÃ©bat durerait de longs mois et ce serait aux indÃ©pendantistes de convaincre la majoritÃ© que leur option est la meilleure.

Depuis sa crÃ©ation, QS veut sortir le QuÃ©bec de l'impasse qui dure depuis 1995 et rompre avec la stratÃ©gie rÃ©fÃ©rendaire classique oÃ¹ un gouvernement souverainiste rÃ©dige une question alambiquÃ©e et demande Ã  l'Ã©lectorat de rÃ©pondre par oui ou par non. QS se rÃ©clame plutÃ´t de la dÃ©mocratie participative oÃ¹ c'est le peuple qui exerce sa souverainetÃ© et dÃ©cide de son avenir, par le biais d'une AssemblÃ©e constituante Ã©lue au suffrage universel qui rÃ©digera un projet de constitution, Ã  ratifier lors d'un rÃ©fÃ©rendum. Cette approche a l'avantage de permettre la participation de ceux qui ne favorisent pas l'indÃ©pendance (68 % des QuÃ©bÃ©cois selon le sondage CROP du mois d'aoÃ»t) et de briser 35 ans de dialogue de sourds oÃ¹ le camp fÃ©dÃ©raliste se contente de dire non sans prÃ©ciser ses propres solutions quant Ã  l'avenir de la nation. Le dÃ©bat durerait de longs mois et ce serait aux indÃ©pendantistes de convaincre la majoritÃ© que leur option est la meilleure.

Cette vision dÃ©mocratique disparaÃ®t dans l'entente proposÃ©e. Il est dit que l'AssemblÃ©e constituante Â« aura pour mandat d'Ã©laborer un projet de constitution d'un QuÃ©bec indÃ©pendant Â». C'est lÃ  le programme d'Option nationale. Il appartiendrait ainsi Ã  une minoritÃ© agissante de dÃ©finir l'issue du dÃ©bat avant mÃªme qu'il n'ait commencÃ©, la rÃ©daction de la constitution d'un pays indÃ©pendant. Autre symptÃ´me d'une dÃ©rive sectaire, l'entente prÃ©voit que QuÃ©bec solidaire sera tenu de dÃ©noncer Ã  tous les tournants le Â« Quebec bashing Â». Comme si les relations avec le Canada se rÃ©sumaient Ã  un combat simpliste entre bons et mÃ©chants.

Tout ceci culmine dans la thÃ©orie oniste de la gouvernance souverainiste. Les nÃ©gociateurs solidaires l'ont reprise Ã  leur compte : Â« Un gouvernement de QuÃ©bec solidaire appliquera les mesures prÃ©vues Ã  son programme, qu'elles soient compatibles ou non avec le cadre constitutionnel canadien Â». Ceci contredit carrÃ©ment le programme de QS qui a toujours fait la distinction entre ce qui est rÃ©alisable avant l'indÃ©pendance et ce qui le sera aprÃ¨s. ON a au contraire la prÃ©tention de pouvoir gouverner comme si Ottawa n'existait pas. Sur la base de quel mandat ? Aucun, sauf la conviction de possÃ©der la vÃ©ritÃ©. Car, ne l'oublions pas, aucun gouvernement quÃ©bÃ©cois n'a gouvernÃ© avec plus de 50 % des suffrages depuis Robert Bourassa en 1989. Le dernier gouvernement Charest et celui de Philippe Couillard aujourd'hui Ã©taient majoritaires, mais ils n'ont obtenu tous deux que 42 % des voix. Une telle confusion entre mandat de gouvernement et mandat de sÃ©cession est fonciÃ¨rement antidÃ©mocratique. Sans compter qu'elle ne rÃ©sisterait pas Ã  l'examen des tribunaux.

La direction de QS n'a pas permis Ã  ses associations locales d'intervenir dans la genÃ¨se de cet accord de fusion. De plus, elle a dÃ©crÃ©tÃ© que le texte ne sera pas amendable lors du congrÃ¨s de dÃ©cembre, Ã©cartant ainsi toute possibilitÃ© de compromis que pourrait suggÃ©rer sa base. Les membres de QS sont maintenant confrontÃ©s Ã  un choix non dÃ©mocratique, une sorte de bill omnibus Ã  la Stephen Harper. S'ils veulent accueillir ON en leur sein, ils devront adopter en bloc tout ce que contient l'entente. Une union Ã  la hussarde qui va Ã  l'encontre de tout ce que QuÃ©bec solidaire prÃ©tend reprÃ©senter jusqu'Ã  prÃ©sent.
TITLE: Fusion QuÃ©bec solidaire - Option nationale: la dÃ©rive idÃ©ologique

SUMMARY:
Soprattutto dopo le esternazioni del presidente Casini, che i malevoli vogliono piÃ¹ legate a aspirazioni politiche personali (un seggio?).
"Leggo che per Bankitalia non Ã¨ un problema che si passi dall'organismo che vigila alle banche vigilate â€“ twitta gelido il presidente dem â€“ E questo spiega molte cose".
Per il parlamentare democrat, poi, sembra assurdo che si dica che il capo segreteria di un governatore non abbia fatto l'ispettore.
Insomma, le cosiddette "illazioni" (come le definisce Bankitalia) non sono destinate a diminuire, almeno per il momento.
Anche se domani, davanti alla comunitÃ  finanziaria, si prevede che il governatore venga accolto con calore, visto l'appoggio che gli ha tributato il presidente Acri Giuseppe Guzzetti.
TEXT:
MartedÃ¬ mattina, alla giornata del risparmio organizzata dall'Acri, ci sarÃ  il primo intervento pubblico del governatore di Bankitalia appena riconfermato (oggi in Gazzetta il decreto di nomina), alla presenza del ministro dell'Economia Pier Carlo Padoan. Ignazio Visco ci arriva "corazzato" dalle ultime "precisazioni" di Via Nazionale: nessuno degli ex dipendenti della banca assunti dalla popolare di Vicenza Ã¨ stato ispettore nella banca veneta. Nessun caso di porte girevoli: stop alle illazioni.

Questo il senso della nota diffusa in serata da palazzo Koch, dopo che negli ultimi 5 giorni un'ondata di articoli e dichiarazioni su questo tema ha preso forma sui mass media. Tutto Ã¨ partito dall'audizione in commissione bicamerale sulle banche del procuratore di Vicenza Antonio Cappelleri, il quale, dopo aver dichiarato che i vigilanti sono stati fuorviati da un gruppo di potere all'interno della popolare di Vicenza guidati dall'ex presidente Gianni Zonin, ha anche consegnato la lista di collaboratori della banca. Tra questi, 3 ex dipendenti dei Via Nazionale, tra cui anche un alto dirigente, Giannandrea Falchi, capo segreteria del Direttorio durante la gestione di Mario Draghi. Quanto basta per far scoppiare un fuoco di fila contro l'istituto, partito prima dal presidente Pd Matteo Orfini, e poi ribadito, anche se con toni diversi, dal presidente della commissione Pier Ferdinando Casini in un'intervista a La Repubblica. Casini parla di rischi per i vigilanti di essere "catturati" dai vigilati, rischi a cui guardare con attenzione. PiÃ¹ duri gli attacchi dem, che sui social diventano un'onda montante.

" Tutta politica, e la tireranno pure per le lunghe nella convocazione del governatore" dicono fonti vicine a Bankitalia, sospettando che non basterÃ  neppure la precisazione appena diffusa, definita un "fact checking" da mettere a disposizione dei cittadini. Sicuramente sarÃ  al calora bianco l'audizione in commissione del capo della Vigilanza Carmelo Barbagallo, fissata per giovedÃ¬ 2 ottobre. Soprattutto dopo le esternazioni del presidente Casini, che i malevoli vogliono piÃ¹ legate a aspirazioni politiche personali (un seggio?). Ma la questione per Orfini non Ã¨ affatto chiusa. "Leggo che per Bankitalia non Ã¨ un problema che si passi dall'organismo che vigila alle banche vigilate â€“ twitta gelido il presidente dem â€“ E questo spiega molte cose". Se il fenomeno di ex Bankitalia passati a lavorare per istituti vigilati dovesse risultare esteso, significherebbe che c'Ã¨ un vuoto normativo da colmare al piÃ¹ presto. Vuoto che finora Via Nazionale non ha segnalato. Per il parlamentare democrat, poi, sembra assurdo che si dica che il capo segreteria di un governatore non abbia fatto l'ispettore. "SarÃ  pure vero, ma il suo ruolo implica funzioni di alto livello". Quanto all'audizione di Visto, Ã¨ probabile che sia collocata dopo essere passati dalle banche venete al Montepaschi. Insomma, le cosiddette "illazioni" (come le definisce Bankitalia) non sono destinate a diminuire, almeno per il momento. Anche se domani, davanti alla comunitÃ  finanziaria, si prevede che il governatore venga accolto con calore, visto l'appoggio che gli ha tributato il presidente Acri Giuseppe Guzzetti. ("bene la sua riconferma").
TITLE: Bankitalia smentisce Casini e Orfini

SUMMARY:
Americans spend one third of their lives in bed, but as a nation, we still arenâ€™t getting enough sleep.
As a result of chronic under-rest, our wellbeing is eroding.
To bring awareness -- and solutions -- to this public health issue, The Huffington Post has partnered with Sleep NumberÂ® to present Sleep + Wellness, an editorial section dedicated to empowering readers to live their best, healthiest lives by gaining a better understanding of sleep as a crucial pillar of our well-being.
By taking an all-encompassing, personalized approach to wellness, and educating readers on how sleep connects to fitness, work-life balance, and more, Sleep + Wellness aims to take the stress out of sleep, for good.
To contribute, please email sleeppluswellness@huffingtonpost.com.
