TEXT:
CDU-Politiker Spahn hat in einem Interview die Abschaffung der Rente mit 63 gefordert

Zuspruch kam aus der Wirtschaft, Kritik von der SPD

Kaum ist die groÃŸe Koalition Geschichte, wird eines ihrer Rentenprojekte zerpflÃ¼ckt: die Rente mit 63.

CDU-PrÃ¤sidiumsmitglied Jens Spahn verlangte in der "Rheinischen Post" ihre Abschaffung. Diese "Form der FrÃ¼hverrentung" sollte auslaufen und das Geld lieber in die Renten von Witwen und Erwerbsgeminderten investiert werden, argumentierte er. "Die Rente mit 63 fÃ¼r langjÃ¤hrig Versicherte wird vor allem von mÃ¤nnlichen Facharbeitern genutzt, die wir eigentlich noch brauchen."

IW-Direktor ist fÃ¼r die Abschaffung

Der Direktor des arbeitgebernahen Instituts der deutschen Wirtschaft (IW) KÃ¶ln, Michael HÃ¼ther, sagte der "Welt", die Rente mit 63 mÃ¼sse "rÃ¼ckabgewickelt" werden. Mehr als 200.000 ArbeitskrÃ¤fte hÃ¤tten deswegen schon zu arbeiten aufgehÃ¶rt â€“ alles gut verdienende Menschen mit mittlerer und hÃ¶herer Bildung.

"Wenn ich GrÃ¼ne und FDP wÃ¤re, wÃ¼rde ich die Union da vor mir hertreiben", sagte HÃ¼ther mit Blick auf die Jamaika-Sondierungen. Zudem mÃ¼sse man darÃ¼ber nachdenken, ab 2029 das Renteneintrittsalter auch Ã¼ber 67 Jahre hinaus zu erhÃ¶hen.

Nach Angaben der Deutschen Rentenversicherung Bund haben bis Ende August 160.000 Versicherte einen Antrag auf abschlagsfreie Rente mit 63 gestellt. Im Vorjahreszeitraum waren es noch 165.000.

Kritik von der SPD

Wer mindestens 45 Jahre in die Rentenversicherung eingezahlt hat, kann seit Juli 2014 ab 63 Jahren ohne Abschlag in Rente gehen. Allerdings wird diese Altersgrenze seitdem pro Jahr um zwei Monate angehoben, so dass die JahrgÃ¤nge ab 1964 erst mit 65 nach 45 Jahren abschlagsfrei in Renten gehen kÃ¶nnen. Die "Rente mit 63" ist insofern etwas missverstÃ¤ndlich.

Die frÃ¼here Bundesfamilienministerin Manuela Schwesig (SPD) wies den VorstoÃŸ Spahns zurÃ¼ck. "Das zeigt, wie die CDU heute tickt. Da ist mehr soziale KÃ¤lte als soziale Verantwortung zu spÃ¼ren", sagte sie dem SWR.

Das Vorstandsmitglied des Deutschen Gewerkschaftsbundes (DGB), Annelie Buntenbach, hielt Spahn entgegen: "Wer die Rente mit 63 zurÃ¼ckdrehen will, ignoriert schlicht die Lebenswirklichkeit vieler Menschen. Wir brauchen nicht weniger MÃ¶glichkeiten fÃ¼r BeschÃ¤ftigte, vor dem 67. Lebensjahr in Rente gehen zu kÃ¶nnen, sondern mehr." Viele erreichten heute schon den regulÃ¤ren Rentenbeginn nicht.

Der Wirtschaftsrat der CDU sieht in einem Jamaika-BÃ¼ndnis die groÃŸe Chance, das SPD-Projekt der Rente mit 63 zu beerdigen, und unterstÃ¼tzt den VorstoÃŸ Spahns.

Die MÃ¼tterrente

Die CSU wollte in den Jamaika-Sondierungen auch eine weitere ErhÃ¶hung der MÃ¼tterrente fordern. Dabei geht es um MÃ¼tter, deren Kinder vor 1992 geboren wurden. Sie sollen einen Rentenpunkt mehr bekommen und damit genauso viel wie MÃ¼tter, deren Kinder nach diesem Datum geboren wurden. Ein Rentenpunkt fÃ¼r diese Frauen kostet zwischen sechs und sieben Milliarden Euro.

Die GrÃ¼nen-Fraktionsvorsitzende Katrin GÃ¶ring-Eckardt sagte im ARD-"Morgenmagazin": "FÃ¼r mich ist das Entscheidende, dass wir keine Altersarmut mehr haben." Die MÃ¼tterrente sei dafÃ¼r nicht das richtige Instrument. Besser wÃ¤re eine "Garantierente". Wer lange gearbeitet habe, solle mehr haben als die Grundsicherung.

Die PrÃ¤sidentin des Sozialverbands VdK, Ulrike Mascher, forderte die vollstÃ¤ndige Angleichung der MÃ¼tterrente sowie eine Stabilisierung des Rentenniveaus und dessen Anhebung auf 50 Prozent.

Ihre Partei sei durch die Wahl nicht geschwÃ¤cht, sie gehe "selbstbewusst in die SondierungsgesprÃ¤che zu Jamaika", erklÃ¤rt sie am Montag im Konrad-Adenauer-Haus.

Viele andere in der Partei starren nur auf die schlechten Ergebnisse in Niedersachsen und bei der Bundestagswahl zwei Wochen zuvor. Sie sprechen von einem Ende der Ã„ra Merkel - und laden ihren Frust ab.

Wie etwa bei der Bundestagsabgeordneten Sylvia Pantel.

Unter der OberflÃ¤che brodelt es

Ihr Telefon stand am Morgen nicht mehr still. Bei ihr meldeten sich aufgebrachte Parteifreunde, denen die Geduld ausgeht. "Sie fÃ¼rchten, dass wir noch weitere Stimmen an die AfD verlieren und sorgen sich um das Profil unserer Partei", sagt sie im HuffPost-GesprÃ¤ch. "Ich kann das nachvollziehen".

Pantel erwartet von ihrer Partei nun VerÃ¤nderungen. Und die mÃ¼ssen ganz oben anfangen. Es brauche einen Merkel-Nachfolger.

"Die CDU muss einen Kandidaten aufbauen", fordert sie. "Nichte heute, nicht morgen, aber in der Mitte der Legislatur brauchen wir hier Klarheit." Vor vier Jahren habe man die Nachfolgeregelung versÃ¤umt. Jetzt sei es hÃ¶chste Zeit. "Ich bin Ã¼berzeugt davon, dass ein GroÃŸteil der CDU-WÃ¤hler kein "Weiter so" will."

"Ein Kandidat, der Merkel ablÃ¶sen soll"

Pantel ist klar, dass sie damit ein Tabu in der Politik bricht.

In der Ã–ffentlichkeit wird nicht Ã¼ber die Zeit nach dem Amtsinhaber spekuliert. Pantel macht das trotzdem - und hofft, dass mÃ¶glichst viele in der CDU mitmachen. "HÃ¤ufig ist es doch so: Wer sich zuerst mit einer guten Idee herauswagt, wird Ã¶ffentlich an den Pranger gestellt. Zwei Jahre spÃ¤ter wollen es dann alle gesagt haben."

Ganz alleine ist sie in der CDU mit ihrer Forderung aber nicht.

"Unreflektiertes Weiterso"

Die Werteunion, ein Zusammenschluss konservativer Kreise der Partei, fordert gar Merkels RÃ¼cktritt. Der Zusammenschluss verschickte eilig nach den ersten Hochrechnung einen "Fahrplan zur Ãœbergabe der Kanzlerschaft".

Merkel mÃ¼sse als Parteivorsitzende zurÃ¼cktreten, heiÃŸt es darin. Die WÃ¤hler in Niedersachsen hÃ¤tten ein "unreflektiertes Weiterso der Kanzlerin nach der desastrÃ¶sen Bundestagswahl abgestraft".

Solche Maximalforderungen liegen auf der EmpÃ¶rungsskala freilich ganz weit oben und sind sicher nicht merheitsfÃ¤hig in der CDU. Auch wollen einflussreiche CDU-Politiker davon nichts wissen. Die Frage stelle sich nicht, sagen sie - oder drÃ¼cken sich moderater aus.

"Unangreifbarkeit von Merkel ist nicht mehr aufrechtzuerhalten"

Der CDU-Wirtschaftsrat etwa gab der Kanzlerin am Sonntag eine Mitschuld an dem niedersÃ¤chsischen Ergebnis.

"Der SchlÃ¼ssel fÃ¼r die Niederlage in Hannover liegt leider im Berliner Wahlabend am 24. September, als man die verheerenden Verluste von Ã¼ber acht Prozent zu einem strategischen Sieg schÃ¶ngeredet hat", sagt der GeneralsekretÃ¤r Wolfgang Steiger der "Bild".

Und CSU-GeneralsekretÃ¤r Andreas Scheuer sprach von einem "Alarmsignal fÃ¼r die gesamte Union".

Angesichts solcher Ã„uÃŸerungen beschreiben Beobachter Merkel mindestens als angeschlagen.

"Die Position von Merkel ist in ihrer Unangreifbarkeit nicht mehr aufrechtzuerhalten", sagt etwa der Politik-Experte Wolfgang Oberreuter im GesprÃ¤ch mit der HuffPost.

"Merkels Beruhigungspillen werden einige in der Partei nicht mehr anstandslos schlucken", sagt er. Und in dem Augenblick, in dem Ã¼ber ihre Nachfolge offen diskutiert werde, sei ihre FÃ¼hrungskraft geschwÃ¤cht.

"Massive inhaltliche Auseinandersetzungen"

Noch deutlicher drÃ¼ckt sich der Berliner Politologe Albrecht von Lucke aus. "Merkels Ende ist eingeleitet", sagte er dem Nachrichtensender N24. Es gehe vor allem um eine "massive inhaltliche Auseinandersetzung" in der Partei - eine Art Stellvertreterkrieg der Merkel-AnhÃ¤nger und -Gegner.

"Eine Fraktion macht sich stark, die die Union nach rechts ziehen will". Dass das sogar die SondierungsgesprÃ¤che mit den Jamaika-Parteien treffen kÃ¶nnte, gab sogar Merkel indirekt zu.

Die Gefahr ist groÃŸ, dass sich die Verhandlungsparteien mit ihren Forderungen und roten Linien Ã¼berwerfen, allen voran die angeschlagene Union. Die GesprÃ¤che werden deswegen einige Wochen dauern, sagte die Kanzlerin.

Wenigstens das klang nicht so, als ginge es gerade ums Wetter.

FlÃ¼chtlingskrise: Helft den Helfern! Die FlÃ¼chtlingskrise bewegt die Deutschen wie kein anderes Thema. Viele blicken fassungslos auf das, was sich an Europas Grenzen abspielt. Auf das Leiden und die NÃ¶te der Hilfesuchenden. Dabei gibt es zahlreiche Menschen und Organisationen, die vor Ort helfen, die Probleme zu lÃ¶sen. Wie ihr selbst aktiv werden kÃ¶nnt, erfahrt ihr bei unserem Kooperationspartner Betterplace..

TEXT:
INTERNATIONAL - C'Ã©tait une des questions restÃ©es sans rÃ©ponse depuis l'annonce par Madrid des Ã©lections anticipÃ©es en Catalogne le 21 dÃ©cembre prochain: les partis sÃ©paratistes catalans qui ont annoncÃ© l'indÃ©pendance de la rÃ©gion vendredi 27 octobre accepteraient-ils de participer Ã  ses Ã©lections dÃ©cidÃ©es et organisÃ©es par une autoritÃ© qu'ils ne reconnaissent plus et qui a placÃ© la rÃ©gion sous tutelle?

Une partie de la rÃ©ponse est arrivÃ©e ce lundi 30 octobre par la porte-parole du parti du prÃ©sident catalan destituÃ©, Carles Puigdemont. Marta Pascal a annoncÃ© lundi que le PDeCAT participera bel et bien aux Ã©lections rÃ©gionales convoquÃ©es en dÃ©cembre. "Le 21, nous irons aux urnes, nous irons avec conviction et nous sommes trÃ¨s attachÃ©s Ã  ce que la sociÃ©tÃ© catalane puisse s'exprimer", a-t-elle dit Ã  la presse.

Le chef du gouvernement espagnol Mariano Rajoy avait lui-mÃªme annoncÃ© ces Ã©lections rÃ©gionales, placÃ©es sous son contrÃ´le. Il avait dÃ©chu de leurs fonctions le prÃ©sident de l'exÃ©cutif catalan et son Ã©quipe, et chargÃ© la vice-prÃ©sidente du gouvernement espagnol, Soraya Saenz de Santamaria, d'administrer la rÃ©gion.

Participer tout en qualifiant ces Ã©lections d'"illÃ©gitimes"

Oriol Junqueras, prÃ©sident du parti Gauche rÃ©publicaine de Catalogne (ERC, membre de la coalition indÃ©pendantistes avec le PDeCAT de Puigdemont) -par ailleurs vice-prÃ©sident destituÃ© de l'exÃ©cutif catalan- a Ã©galement indiquÃ© son intention de "participer" d'une maniÃ¨re ou d'une autre Ã  ces Ã©lections, bien qu'il les juge "illÃ©gitimes".

"Les Catalans ne craignent pas les urnes (...) et le 21 dÃ©cembre doit Ãªtre une opportunitÃ© supplÃ©mentaire pour consolider la rÃ©publique" catalane, a dÃ©clarÃ© le porte-parole de ERC, Sergi Sabria, Ã  l'issue d'une rÃ©union de son parti Ã  Barcelone. "Le 21 dÃ©cembre, nous trouverons la maniÃ¨re de participer, que ce soit en nous prÃ©sentant ou non", a-t-il ajoutÃ©, laissant planer un doute sur la prÃ©sence de candidats en son nom.

ERC a admis que la dÃ©claration d'indÃ©pendance, adoptÃ©e vendredi par 70 dÃ©putÃ©s catalans sur 135, Ã©tait difficile Ã  mettre en oeuvre: "Notre rÃ©publique n'est pas pour le moment en pleine capacitÃ© de s'imposer comme nous le souhaiterions, mais il nous revient de la dÃ©fendre", a dÃ©clarÃ© Sergi Sabria, visiblement Ã©mu.

Lors des Ã©lections rÃ©gionales de 2015 en Catalogne, la coalition "Ensemble pour le oui" formÃ©es par plusieurs partis et mouvements sÃ©paratistes, avait remportÃ© 62 siÃ¨ges sur 135 dÃ©putÃ©s. Les 10 siÃ¨ges obtenus par le parti de gauche radicale CUP avaient permis aux indÃ©pendantistes d'obtenir la majoritÃ© absolue.

SUMMARY:
It's a new week which means we can collectively forget about the pizza, burgers and booze we just consumed over the weekend and set healthy intentions for the week.
These seven easy, quick, healthy and delicious recipes are perfect for weeknight dinners and will help you stay on track -- hey, maybe even through the weekend.
Pea pesto pasta with sundried tomatoes and rocketFrom Minimalist Baker.
Pasta lovers, try this healthy pesto pasta made with basil, peas, garlic and pine nuts.
Greek pasta salad with cucumber and artichoke heartsFrom Foodie Crush.
TEXT:
It's a new week which means we can collectively forget about the pizza, burgers and booze we just consumed over the weekend and set healthy intentions for the week.

That starts with a healthy breakfast all the way to the end of the day with a nutritious dinner. But if you don't have much time in the evenings (or don't want to faff about in the kitchen for too long), then you need some quick dinner recipes up your sleeve.

These seven easy, quick, healthy and delicious recipes are perfect for weeknight dinners and will help you stay on track -- hey, maybe even through the weekend.

1. Crunchy roasted chickpea pitas

From How Sweet Eats.

If you prefer minimal prep, these crunchy roasted chickpea pitas are the answer. Simply buy wholemeal pita bread, roast some chickpeas with spices and assemble your pita with hummus, cherry tomatoes, feta and the roasted chickpeas. So easy, so delicious.

Here's the recipe.

2. Pea pesto pasta with sundried tomatoes and rocket

From Minimalist Baker.

Pasta lovers, try this healthy pesto pasta made with basil, peas, garlic and pine nuts. Stir the pesto through fusilli (go for wholemeal), sundried tomatoes and rocket. Make a batch and take it for lunch the next day.

Get the recipe here.

3. Green salad with prawns, beetroot, sweet pecans and goat cheese

From Foodie Crush.

This fresh low-carb salad is ideal for evenings when you just want something light. Packed with lemony prawns, goat cheese, pecans and marinated beetroot (aka beetroot from a tin), this salad takes under 10 minutes to whip up.

Try the recipe here.

4. 30-minute salmon caprese skewers

From How Sweet Eats.

Get your omega-3 fix with these delicious salmon caprese skewers -- layered with cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella and basil, and finished with a balsamic glaze. Put on some brown rice while you make these and you have yourself a meal.

Here's the recipe.

5. Sweet potato cauliflower curry

From Minimalist Baker.

For a more comforting weeknight dinner, this 30-minute vegan sweet potato served with Indian-spiced cauliflower is a delicious option. You can serve the curry with naan bread or brown rice, or skip them and enjoy the dish on its own.

Get the recipe here.

6. Greek pasta salad with cucumber and artichoke hearts

From Foodie Crush.

This fresh salad is packed with flavour thanks to tangy feta cheese, olives, artichoke hearts and a herby dressing. All you need to do is pick up some jarred Greek ingredients from the supermarkets, cook your pasta (again, go for wholemeal) and mix it all together.

Try the recipe.

7. Chicken avocado salad with peanut dressing

From How Sweet Eats.

This salad is packed with such delicious elements you'll forget it's salad. Picture paprika chicken brushed with a honey peanut butter glaze on top of a bed of a cabbage slaw mix, finished with avocado, cucumber and chopped peanuts.

Here's the recipe.
TITLE: Easy Weeknight Dinners To Make This Week

SUMMARY:
â€œDirty old manâ€ just joined â€œboys just being boys,â€ â€œthe casting couchâ€ and â€œharmless locker room talkâ€ on the list of sexual harassment excuses that are in their death throes, U.S.
â€œBut just donâ€™t pronounce them dead until we see the coffin.â€The Bush story is definitely a sign of the times though.
Women saw the behavior as just another example of powerful men treating women and their bodies with a sense of entitlement.
â€ McGrath issued a followup statement after Grolnick told Deadspin that she too had been groped by the former president.
To anyone he has offended, President Bush apologizes most sincerely.
TEXT:
With at least two actresses and an author accusing former President George H.W. Bush of groping them from his wheelchair during photo-ops, the sexual harassment conversation that exploded three weeks ago with Harvey Weinstein is poised to fell yet another social more: the idea that the actions of a â€œdirty old manâ€ should be simply shrugged off.

â€œDirty old manâ€ just joined â€œboys just being boys,â€ â€œthe casting couchâ€ and â€œharmless locker room talkâ€ on the list of sexual harassment excuses that are in their death throes, U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commissioner Chai R. Feldblum told HuffPost. â€œBut just donâ€™t pronounce them dead until we see the coffin.â€

The Bush story is definitely a sign of the times though. Back in 2007, we all thought it was adorable that No. 41 â€• at age 82 â€• gave actress Teri Hatcher a peck on the cheek and a pat on the behind after their lunch together. He was labeled â€œfriskyâ€ then. What a difference a decade makes.

â€œThere is no doubt that this greater focus on sexual harassment is a good thing,â€ Feldblum said, â€œbecause it wonâ€™t go away on its own.â€ And, no, she cuts no slack for men of any age â€• even former presidents â€• who behave or touch anyone else inappropriately.

Actresses Heather Lind and Jordana Grolnick both reported that they were posing for photos with the elder Bush when he groped their behinds and made an off-color joke. Grolnick and author Christina Baker Kline said he quietly joked about his favorite magician or his favorite book.

Grolnick said, â€œI felt his hand dig into my fleshâ€ as they smiled for the photographer and Bush delivered his jokeâ€™s punchline: â€œDavid Cop-A-Feel.â€

Some have suggested that Bush, 93, who suffers from a form of Parkinsonâ€™s disease and has been in a wheelchair for five years, should be given a pass and excused from the accusations of sexual harassment. NBC anchor Andrea Mitchell tweeted to that end:

Mrs Bush was at his side. He is in a wheelchair with Parkinson's syndrome. Really? Someone should be ashamed and it isn't '41. https://t.co/CGhy8yNX5i â€” Andrea Mitchell (@mitchellreports) October 26, 2017

Not all agreed though that what Bush did was defensible.

Iâ€™m sure itâ€™s a difficult job but I do object to the mindset that my body is fair game because of an illness or age. â€” Countessâ„¢ TinaBob (@tinabobuk) October 26, 2017

Touching women's "rears" without consent is not cute even if you are a 93 year old former President in a wheelchair. ğŸ˜ â€” SocialnnPolitics (@SocialnnPolitic) October 26, 2017

The non-apology apology

Other possible excuses for Bushâ€™s groping were offered up on social media, most notably that as people become elderly, they develop certain medical conditions that can result in a loss of impulse control.

The man has Parkinson's and is likely getting senile. Inhibitions notoriously slip as mental faculties decline. â€” Susan Hough (@SeismoSue) October 26, 2017

Some suggested that if he cannot control himself in public, those who are responsible for his care must stop putting him in situations where inappropriate behavior can occur â€• not just laugh uncomfortably at it and then look away.

Two statements of apology issued from Bushâ€™s office indicated that the former president should be let off the hook because of his age or illness. Women saw the behavior as just another example of powerful men treating women and their bodies with a sense of entitlement.

The former presidentâ€™s spokesman Jim McGrath initially told CNN that â€œPresident Bush would never â€” under any circumstance â€” intentionally cause anyone distress, and he most sincerely apologizes if his attempt at humor offended Ms. Lind. â€ McGrath issued a followup statement after Grolnick told Deadspin that she too had been groped by the former president. The statement read: At age 93, President Bush has been confined to a wheelchair for roughly five years, so his arm falls on the lower waist of people with whom he takes pictures. To try to put people at ease, the president routinely tells the same joke â€” and on occasion, he has patted womenâ€™s rears in what he intended to be a good-natured manner. Some have seen it as innocent; others clearly view it as inappropriate. To anyone he has offended, President Bush apologizes most sincerely.

But Feldblum said that when it comes to harassment, it doesnâ€™t matter what people think might be OK but rather how they behave.

â€œWorkplace training is about how to change behaviors, not minds,â€ she said. And the same advice is applicable to what occurs outside the workplace.
TITLE: We've Long Excused The Sexually Abusive Behavior Of Older Men. Not Anymore.

SUMMARY:
Manafort left his Virginia condo and, with his attorney, walked into the FBI field office in Washington early Monday.
Manafort and Gates both pleaded not guilty to the charges in federal court.
The charges are the first in the probe led by the office of special counsel Robert Mueller, a former FBI director.
â€œManafort and Gates generated tens of millions of dollars in income as a result of their Ukraine work,â€ the indictment says.
The indictment charging Manafort and Gates makes no mention of Trump or the election.
TEXT:
WASHINGTON â€• Former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort and onetime business associate Rick Gates were indicted by a federal grand jury on charges of conspiracy and money laundering in connection with an intensifying investigation into Russian meddling in the 2016 presidential election.

Manafort left his Virginia condo and, with his attorney, walked into the FBI field office in Washington early Monday. A 12-count federal grand jury indictment unsealed shortly after his surrender includes charges of conspiracy against the U.S., conspiracy to launder money, failure to file foreign bank reports and false statements.

Manafort and Gates both pleaded not guilty to the charges in federal court.

Separately, a former Trump campaign foreign policy adviser has pleaded guilty to lying to FBI agents about Russian â€œdirtâ€ he was offered on Hillary Clinton, according to a plea deal prosecutors unsealed Monday. George Papadopoulos, 30, pleaded guilty on Oct. 5 and has been cooperating in the Russia probe.

The charges are the first in the probe led by the office of special counsel Robert Mueller, a former FBI director. Mondayâ€™s arrests come three days after news broke that a federal grand jury in Washington had filed charges stemming from Muellerâ€™s investigation.

â€œManafort and Gates generated tens of millions of dollars in income as a result of their Ukraine work,â€ the indictment says. â€œIn order to hide Ukraine payments from United States authorities, from approximately 2006 through at least 2016, Manafort and Gates laundered the money through scores of United States and foreign corporations, partnerships, and bank accounts.â€

Failing to pay taxes allowed Manafort a â€œlavish lifestyle in the United States,â€ according to the indictment, which alleges he â€œspent millions of dollars on luxury goods and services for himself and his extended family through payments wired from offshore nominee accounts to United States vendors.â€

Manafort laundered more than $18 million, which he used to buy property, goods and services in the U.S., the indictment alleges. Heâ€™s accused of spending $849,215 at one clothing store, $520,440 at another clothing store, about $934,000 at an antique rug store, $62,750 for a Mercedes Benz, and $47,000 for a Range Rover.

Reports have suggested federal investigators could use criminal charges as way to pressure those arrested into providing more information about alleged collusion between President Donald Trumpâ€™s campaign and the Kremlin to influence the election. The indictment charging Manafort and Gates makes no mention of Trump or the election.
TITLE: Former Trump Campaign Manager Paul Manafort Charged In Russia Probe

President John F. Kennedy of America acknowledges the cheers of the crowd when he visits New Ross, Co. Wexford, Ireland.
ADVERTISEMENTUS President Donald Trump today said he will release all files associated with the assassination of former president John F Kennedy to end all "conspiracy theories".
Trump said this in a tweet a day after the National Archives, at his direction, released more than 2,800 secret files related to the assassination of Kennedy on November 22, 1963.
At the same time he ordered for a 180-day review of all such files.

TEXT:
President John F. Kennedy of America acknowledges the cheers of the crowd when he visits New Ross, Co. Wexford, Ireland.

ADVERTISEMENT

US President Donald Trump today said he will release all files associated with the assassination of former president John F Kennedy to end all "conspiracy theories".

Trump said this in a tweet a day after the National Archives, at his direction, released more than 2,800 secret files related to the assassination of Kennedy on November 22, 1963.

At the same time, he agreed to the request from various intelligence and security agencies mainly FBI and CBI, to withhold quite a number of such files, which remains away from the public domain, thus increasingly providing fodder to conspiracy theories.

In his tweet, Trump said after strict consultation with his Chief of Staff, General John Kelly, the CIA and other agencies, "I will be releasing ALL JFK files" other than the names and addresses of any mentioned person who is still living.

"I am doing this for reason of full disclosure, transparency and in order to put any and all conspiracy theories to rest," Trump said, a day after he ordered a large number of JFK files still be under the wraps.

At the same time he ordered for a 180-day review of all such files.

"This temporary withholding from full public disclosure is necessary to protect against harm to the military defence, intelligence operations, law enforcement, or the conduct of foreign relations that is of such gravity that it outweighs the public interest in immediate disclosure," Trump said in a memo.

The American public expects -- and deserves -- its government to provide as much access as possible to the Kennedy assassination records so that the people may finally be fully informed about all aspects of this pivotal event, Trump argued.

Trump's Attorney General Jeff Sessions agreed and said that there is need to expedite the process.

"We are working this weekend. We are going to be working every way possible to expedite the production of these documents as completely as possible and they will be virtually, completely revealed from the FBI files," he told Fox News in an interview.

Sessions said Trump is right to say to get these materials out.

"Some of documents have already been produced today and they will be moving faster, there will not be, I believe, any significant redactions - redaction that may have been suggested will not be in there," he said.

"There's going to be virtually complete disclosure. Some people who are alive may not need their names or their current addresses revealed. Lot of it is extraneous entirely," Sessions said.
TITLE: Trump Promises To Release All Files On JFK

SUMMARY:
When airport foreman Scott Babcock went out onto the runway at Wiley Post-Will Rogers Memorial Airport in Utqiagvik, Alaska, on Monday to clear some snow, he was surprised to find a visitor waiting for him on the asphalt: a 450-pound bearded seal chilling in the milky sunshine.
"It was very strange to see the seal.
I've seen a lot of things on runways, but never a seal," Babcock told ABC News.
His footage of the hefty mammal went viral after he posted it on Facebook.
TEXT:
When airport foreman Scott Babcock went out onto the runway at Wiley Post-Will Rogers Memorial Airport in Utqiagvik, Alaska, on Monday to clear some snow, he was surprised to find a visitor waiting for him on the asphalt: a 450-pound bearded seal chilling in the milky sunshine.

"It was very strange to see the seal. I've seen a lot of things on runways, but never a seal," Babcock told ABC News. His footage of the hefty mammal went viral after he posted it on Facebook.
TITLE: Huge Bearded Seal Blocks Airport Runway In Alaska

Selon les rumeurs les plus tenaces, et les plus crÃ©dibles, deux hommes tiennent la corde: Jerome Powell, un proche de Yellen, ancien de Wall Street, rÃ©putÃ© pragmatique; et John Taylor, l'intellectuel de Stanford, plus dogmatique.
Voici ce qu'il faut savoir des deux prÃ©tendants Ã  l'un des postes les plus influents des Etats-Unis, et du monde.
Le favori: Jerome Powell, le pragmatique de Wall StreetPour l'instant, il a la faveur des sites de paris et des confidences de "proches du prÃ©sident".
Sa formule permet, en thÃ©orie, de calculer de maniÃ¨re objective le taux d'intÃ©rÃªt le plus adaptÃ© Ã  l'Ã©conomie des Etats-Unis.

TEXT:
Ã‰CONOMIE - Qui sera "The Governor"? Dans un teasing digne d'une tÃ©lÃ© rÃ©alitÃ©, Donald Trump a annoncÃ© le 27 septembre Ãªtre sur le point de dÃ©voiler son choix pour le poste de prÃ©sidente du Conseil des gouverneurs de la RÃ©serve fÃ©dÃ©rale, la fameuse "Fed".

Son choix doit intervenir avant son dÃ©part pour une tournÃ©e asiatique le 3 novembre, le 2 novembre selon toute vraisemblance. "Les gens attendent avec impatience ma dÃ©cision sur l'identitÃ© du prochain prÃ©sident de la Fed, a indiquÃ© Donald Trump. Ce sera quelqu'un qui, je l'espÃ¨re, fera un travail fantastique."

"J'ai quelqu'un de trÃ¨s prÃ©cis en tÃªte et je pense que tout le monde sera trÃ¨s impressionnÃ©", a-t-il encore dit.

Janet Yellen, nommÃ©e en 2014 par Barack Obama, peut prÃ©tendre Ã  un nouveau mandat de quatre ans. Mais elle ne fait pas partie des favoris. Selon les rumeurs les plus tenaces, et les plus crÃ©dibles, deux hommes tiennent la corde: Jerome Powell, un proche de Yellen, ancien de Wall Street, rÃ©putÃ© pragmatique; et John Taylor, l'intellectuel de Stanford, plus dogmatique.

Si quelques autres noms circulent, comme ceux de Kevin Warsh et Gary Cohn, leurs chances de victoire semblent improbables. Voici ce qu'il faut savoir des deux prÃ©tendants Ã  l'un des postes les plus influents des Etats-Unis, et du monde.

Le favori: Jerome Powell, le pragmatique de Wall Street

Pour l'instant, il a la faveur des sites de paris et des confidences de "proches du prÃ©sident". Collaborateur direct de Janet Yellen depuis 2012, il n'a jamais votÃ© contre une de ses dÃ©cisions, et est coutumier du fonctionnement de la Fed. "C'est le candidat de la continuitÃ©. Il s'est trÃ¨s peu exprimÃ© sur la politique monÃ©taire, mais on imagine qu'il fera pareil qu'elle", analyse Marc-Antoine Collard, chef Ã©conomiste de Rothschild & Cie Gestion.

Avocat d'affaires de formation, il a commencÃ© sa carriÃ¨re Ã  la banque d'investissement Dillon, Read & Co. Entre 1997 et 2005, il est aussi associÃ© du fonds d'investissement Carlyle, l'un des plus importants au monde. Un pur produit de Wall Street qui a aussi eu un rÃ´le secondaire au secrÃ©tariat du TrÃ©sor sous l'administration de Georges Bush (1989-1993).

S'il remporte le poste, il deviendra le premier prÃ©sident de la Fed Ã  ne pas dÃ©tenir un doctorat d'Ã©conomie. MalgrÃ© cela, les marchÃ©s ne devraient pas, ou peu, rÃ©agir.

L'outsider: John Taylor, le thÃ©oricien de Stanford

En revanche, celui-lÃ  pourrait bien faire bouger les lignes. John Taylor, cÃ©lÃ¨bre professeur de l'encore plus cÃ©lÃ¨bre universitÃ© de Stanford, est surtout connu des milieux Ã©conomiques pour sa rÃ¨gle, dite "rÃ¨gle de Taylor", Ã©noncÃ©e en 1993.

Sa formule permet, en thÃ©orie, de calculer de maniÃ¨re objective le taux d'intÃ©rÃªt le plus adaptÃ© Ã  l'Ã©conomie des Etats-Unis. Cela tombe bien, c'est justement le job du gouverneur de la Fed.

"Sauf que cette rÃ¨gle dÃ©pend de variables qu'on ne peut pas connaÃ®tre Ã  l'instant T, et qu'il faut donc estimer, avertit Marc-Antoine Collard, de Rothschild & Cie Gestion. Avec toute l'honnÃªtetÃ© du monde, c'est trÃ¨s compliquÃ©. La probabilitÃ© que la Fed fasse une erreur me semble plus importante."

Sa position serait favorable Ã  une hausse des taux d'intÃ©rÃªt plus rapide que le rythme trÃ¨s modÃ©rÃ© prÃ©vu par Janet Yellen. Quelle serait la rÃ©action des marchÃ©s en cas de victoire? Difficile Ã  dire, tant cela dÃ©pendrait de son comportement d'ici sa prise de fonction en fÃ©vrier.

"Il pourrait y avoir une rÃ©action initiale avec une hausse des taux Ã  court terme, et peut-Ãªtre Ã  long terme aussi. Mais si le marchÃ© pense que la Fed se trompe, que cette dÃ©cision va provoquer une rÃ©cession, cela peut aussi se traduire par une baisse des taux Ã  long terme", tente de rÃ©sumer Marc-Antoine Collard.

En clair, si les marchÃ©s redoutent un retournement Ã©conomique, les investisseurs pourraient Ãªtre tentÃ© de placer leur argent en sÃ»retÃ©, en achetant des bonds du trÃ©sor amÃ©ricain, d'oÃ¹ la baisse de leur rendement.

Ã€ voir Ã©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: PrÃ©sidence de la Fed: Entre le pragmatique de Wall Street et le thÃ©oricien de Stanford, qui Trump choisira-t-il?

SUMMARY:
To mark World Psoriasis Day, we asked people with psoriasis what they want others to know.
A total of 48% of all people living with psoriasis in the UK are lonely, compared to 33% living with psoriasis globally.
The first World Psoriasis Happiness Report shows the UK ranks third from bottom based on wellbeing responses from more than 120,00 people living with psoriasis across 184 countries.
Psoriasis is an inflammatory skin condition that can cause red, flaky, crusty patches of skin that are sometimes covered in silvery scales.
If they donâ€™t know about psoriasis, quite often people are visibly disturbed which doesnâ€™t make you feel brilliant.
TEXT:
To mark World Psoriasis Day, we asked people with psoriasis what they want others to know.

A total of 48% of all people living with psoriasis in the UK are lonely, compared to 33% living with psoriasis globally. Around 40% of women and 39% of men in the UK feel isolated due to psoriasis, compared to the global averages of 26% and 21% respectively.

The first World Psoriasis Happiness Report shows the UK ranks third from bottom based on wellbeing responses from more than 120,00 people living with psoriasis across 184 countries.

Psoriasis is an inflammatory skin condition that can cause red, flaky, crusty patches of skin that are sometimes covered in silvery scales. As well as causing physical symptoms, psoriasis can lead to psychological distress and feelings of social isolation.

There are 1.3 million people in the UK living with psoriasis , but the vast majority (84%) feel there is a lack of public awareness around the condition.

â€œThe impact the condition has on your mental wellbeing is often overlooked.â€

Pete, 32, began suffering from psoriasis at the age of eight.

â€œI suffer with psoriasis on my face, scalp, ears, back, legs, knees, arms and elbows so hiding it from public view is at most times impossible.

â€œI often find myself being very self-conscious, covering my skin to avoid awkward looks from the scars left by the condition, which are a permanent reminder that this autoimmune disease will be with me for life.

â€œAs we move into cooler months my anxiety levels go through the roof as I know itâ€™s the time of the year where my psoriasis will flare up and be at its worse, the plaques will worsen and be more visible and the itch can cause me to have multiple nights without sleep.

â€œPsoriasis has been part of my life from about the age of eight, but I was only formally diagnosed with psoriasis three years ago when I moved GP, prior to that it was misdiagnosed as dermatitis.

â€œAround Christmas 2016 a new GP arrived at our doctorâ€™s surgery and he was the first person in 23 years to ask me how the condition makes me feel, I now see him exclusively for ongoing treatment.

â€œUltimately the lack of understanding from family, friends and colleagues can at times make you feel out of place and alone.â€





â€œPsoriasis is not contagious.â€

Sam Winters, 25, had his first psoriasis flare up at 19.

â€œWhen you have visible patches of psoriasis, people ask what it is (if they bother to ask at all). If they donâ€™t know about psoriasis, quite often people are visibly disturbed which doesnâ€™t make you feel brilliant. Iâ€™ve been asked at the gym if I should really be exposing areas affected by psoriasis in communal spaces in case I infect others.

â€œIt definitely puts me off going into public spaces during a bad flare up. Fortunately mine tends to be on my arms, legs and scalp so can be covered, but it must be a lot harder for those who arenâ€™t so lucky.

â€œYouâ€™d think people think you had leprosy or something from some reactions. Psoriasis definitely has a strong mental impact along with the physical discomfort.â€





â€œPsoriasis is not a cosmetic issue.â€

Ciena Rae Nelson, 25, began experiencing symptoms aged four.

â€œI think that the one thing I want people to know is that Psoriasis is not a cosmetic issue. It is not simply a rash.

â€œIt is an autoimmune disorder that can have a negative impact on the quality of life and sometimes very serious negative affects on the general health of its sufferers.

â€œSometimes it feels like Iâ€™m trapped in my own body. Unbearable itchiness that feels like stinging instead of itching. I suffer from sleep deprivation because I itch in my sleep. Dehydration is also a side effect, which at one point put me in the hospital when I had a psoriasis flare of 80% of my body.

â€œAs long as we treat it like a cosmetic issue, we are not going to raise the awareness we need to find a cure.â€





â€œIt makes dating hard.â€

Holly Dillon, late twenties, was diagnosed with guttate psoriasis aged 14.

â€œIâ€™m a single late 20-something gal and Iâ€™m on the dating scene and between finding the perfect rom-com boyfriend and swiping through all dating apps, I have found that living with psoriasis and dating is yet another added layer that comes with the condition. When do you tell your date? What will they say? How will they react? As if the first date wasnâ€™t awkward enough!

â€œIn all truth, bringing it up and hitting preconceptions out of the park has been my go-to - no itâ€™s not contagious, not an STD, yes it can hurt, especially during the friction that can come with sex.

â€œSometimes I donâ€™t feel sexy, sometimes Iâ€™m embarrassed, but overall Iâ€™m comfortable in my skin and you should be to if youâ€™re dating me. Living with psoriasis absolutely flips the societal vision of sex on its head - your skin can flake and be all over the sheets, you can bleed, your skin isnâ€™t smooth like every poster girl we see, it can get messy. But hey, this is real life, this is reality, and this is passion with your psoriasis.

â€œSo my advice would be never be afraid to be you living with psoriasis. If anyone rejects you for living with it, be it dating or a one night stand, then they arenâ€™t worth it and have far bigger issues than psoriasis. Be empowered by your condition, #getyourskinout and start a conversation around living with psoriasis and definitely keep having sex.





â€œIt affects every part of life.â€

Michael, 44, began suffering with psoriasis aged 14.

â€œItâ€™s restrictions go beyond the purely physical and affect psychological, sociological, emotional aspects of life; eg. Issues around self-esteem and interaction.

â€œIt can affect what you wear, how you carry yourself before others, responding to comments, feeling unable to go swimming publicly, intimacy, effects of constant itch and pain, awareness of stares, brushing off dandruff, hoovering up skin, embarrassment of giving lifts in car with shed skin. I could go on.â€



â€œIt can be a sign of a deeper problem.â€

Jane Austin, 52, began experiencing psoriasis at the age of 25.

â€œMy dad died when I was 24. We didnâ€™t know each other well - he was largely absent in my childhood - but I guess his â€˜absenceâ€™ was as significant as if heâ€™d been an involved parent. A year after his death I suffered from depression and thatâ€™s when my psoriasis began.

â€œOver the last 20-odd years, itâ€™s been my companion, sometimes being more vocal or obvious than I would like, but I have learnt to realise that its presence is a clanging bell that something is upsetting me and I need to take stock. Stop drinking red wine for a while, get some early nights, remove myself from the company of people that drain me.

â€œWhat I have learnt from my psoriasis is to try to welcome it and use it on my body as a barometer for how Iâ€™m living my life. I would ask people not to stare or point at my hand, elbows and knees on public transport, donâ€™t move your children away from me. Donâ€™t loudly ask â€˜Whassat?â€™ Youâ€™re not a fucking moron, itâ€™s some dead skin, there because Iâ€™m temporarily feeling vulnerable, lost or bereft.

â€œTo go back to the bereavement point: in the old days, mourners would wear a black armband for a year just to let people know that they were a bit sad, shaky and not quite in the game. Please treat my psoriasis like a black band and show consideration.â€
TITLE: World Psoriasis Day: This Is What People With Psoriasis Want You To Know

TEXT:
Wir Alleinerziehenden sind die heimlichen LeistungstrÃ¤gerinnen in diesem Land! | GETTY

Liebe Frau Merkel,

jetzt regieren Sie also wohl weiter, und das auch noch mit einer starken AfD und FDP im Bundestag. Schlimmer hÃ¤tte es fÃ¼r uns Alleinerziehende kaum kommen kÃ¶nnen.

Dass Sie an der Macht bleiben werden, ist nicht Ã¼berraschend. Und trotzdem tue ich mich schwer, mich damit abzufinden. Denn vier weitere Jahre CDU an der Regierung bedeuten, eine Frau als Kanzlerin hin oder her, dass wir Alleinerziehenden weiterhin als Randgruppe bedauerlicher EinzelfÃ¤lle angesehen werden.

Wobei das mit dem Bedauern auf wackeligen FÃ¼ÃŸen steht: Den Quatsch mit dem selbstverschuldeten Lebensmodell, den die AfD verzapft, gehen Sie zwar so offen nicht mit. Bei der CDU herrscht Barmherzigkeit, wir kÃ¶nnen uns etwas Mitleid abholen - und dann sollen wir Alleinerziehenden aber gefÃ¤lligst auch ruhig sein.

Wir wuppen das, was in Familien zwei Erwachsene tun, ganz alleine

Aber wenn ich genau hingucke, dann ist das Bild, das die AfD von Alleinerziehenden zeichnet, gar nicht so weit entfernt von dem, das ich bei Ihnen in der Partei finde.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: 15 Dinge, die eine Alleinerziehende dir sagen will

Denn fÃ¼r die tiefglÃ¤ubigen Katholiken, und mit denen ist die CDU ja schon vom Parteinamen her im Pakt, ist eine Alleinerziehende eine Frau, die mit einem Bein in der HÃ¶lle steht. Schon die Scheidung ist verpÃ¶nt, die Ehe ein Sakrileg â€“ und folgerichtig stellen Sie und Ihre Partei die Ehe Ã¼ber alles, sogar Ã¼ber Kinder.

Sie sehen uns nicht â€“ und wenn, dann als gescheiterte Existenzen, als MÃ¼tter zweiter Klasse, die mit durchgefÃ¼ttert werden, weil es der christliche Gedanke gebietet. Aber Sympathien, oder gar Hochachtung fÃ¼r uns, das haben Sie nicht.

Dabei sind wir die heimlichen LeistungstrÃ¤gerinnen in diesem Land! Ja, das meine ich ganz ernst. Wir wuppen das, was in Familien zwei Erwachsene tun, ganz alleine, oft noch unter Anfeindungen von missgÃ¼nstigen Mitmenschen, die nur darauf warten, dass bei uns irgendwas schiefgeht, und sei es nur der vergessene Kuchen zum Klassenfest.

Wir sind MÃ¼tter mit Makeln

"Die ist alleinerziehend, die packt das nicht!â€œ, tuscheln die Leute dann oder schauen einfach tadelnd. Oder sie schicken uns gleich das Jugendamt auf den Hals, weil die Kinder schon wieder krank sind oder Mama nach der Arbeit erst um 17 Uhr nach Hause kommt, und das Grundschulkind seit dem Mittagessen alleine Zuhause ist.

All dies ist Alltag fÃ¼r alleinerziehende MÃ¼tter. "Wenn euch Alleinerziehenden nicht die MÃ¤nner weglaufen wÃ¼rden, dann mÃ¼sste ich jetzt nicht die Gewerbesteuer erhÃ¶hen, um KitaplÃ¤tze zu schaffen", sagte allen Ernstes ein CDU-BÃ¼rgermeister zu einer Leserin von mir.

Er sagte es nicht Ã¶ffentlich, so wie derjenige Ã¤ltere Herr aus der CDU, der mir deutlich zu verstehen gab, dass ich als Alleinerziehende per se versagt habe, weil die Ehe um jeden Preis zu erhalten sei, und ich als Frau, die ihren Mann verlieÃŸ, gesÃ¼ndigt hÃ¤tte.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Die etablierte Politik vernachlÃ¤ssigt Familien und Alleinerziehende - und die AfD nutzt das gezielt fÃ¼r sich aus

HÃ¤tte er mich verlassen, dann hÃ¤tte ich Ã¼brigens auch versagt, weil ich ihn nicht halten konnte. Alleinerziehende kÃ¶nnen eigentlich gar nichts richtig machen, wir sind MÃ¼tter mit Makeln. AusgestoÃŸene gewissermaÃŸen, von der Teilhabe ausgeschlossen, auch wegen der Armut, unter der viele von uns trotz Arbeit und guter Bildung leiden.

"Ja, aber wir tun doch auch was fÃ¼r Alleinerziehende! Wir planen den Rechtsanspruch auf einen Hortplatz!", mÃ¶gen Sie sagen. Schon â€“ aber das machen Sie, liebe Frau Merkel, fÃ¼r die Wirtschaft. Nicht fÃ¼r die Eltern, und schon gar nicht fÃ¼r Alleinerziehende.

Die meisten sind froh, wenn sie am Ende des Monats noch Geld fÃ¼r Essen haben

Denn im Grunde finden Sie ja, dass alles gut so ist, wie es ist, das ist das KernstÃ¼ck von wahrem Konservativismus. Das Ehegattensplitting muss bleiben, sagen Sie, das mit der Altersarmut werde schon nicht so schlimm, eine Frauenquote brauche man nicht, und hey, Sie wollen sogar ein Kinderbaugeld zahlen.

Da muss ich allerdings ziemlich bitter lachen â€“ als ob Alleinerziehende das Geld fÃ¼r Wohneigentum hÃ¤tten. Die meisten sind froh, wenn sie Ã¼berhaupt am Ende des Monats noch Geld fÃ¼r Essen haben. Aber daran sieht man ja ganz klar, welches Familienbild die Union propagiert: keins, in dem eine Mutter oder ein Vater mit den Kindern alleine lebt.

Dann schon lieber ein homosexuelles Paar mit Kindern. Damit haben sich ja zumindest Teile Ihrer Partei angefreundet. Am besten, ich rate meinen Kindern, schwul oder lesbisch zu werden. Alleinerziehend jedenfalls sollten sie unter Ihrer Regierung nicht sein.

â¨ Das kÃ¶nnte euch auch interessieren: "FÃ¼r diese Kinder ist das Busticket schon ein Luxus" - wie arme Familien in Deutschland leben

(lk)

When your BFF asks you to come up with a brilliant way to make her wedding photos extra memorable, you do it.
That's why maid of honour Sharilyn Wester decided to go all out when her best friend's photographer asked her to help with the veil toss at her July wedding in Bonnyville, Alta.
In a series of images shared on Facebook, Wester is seen epically photobombing her bestie Rebecca Foster and her husband, James.

TEXT:
When your BFF asks you to come up with a brilliant way to make her wedding photos extra memorable, you do it.

That's why maid of honour Sharilyn Wester decided to go all out when her best friend's photographer asked her to help with the veil toss at her July wedding in Bonnyville, Alta.

In a series of images shared on Facebook, Wester is seen epically photobombing her bestie Rebecca Foster and her husband, James. Naturally, the results were hilarious!

If you're wondering why the bride looks fairly oblivious to her friend's charades compared to her new husband, it's because Foster was in on the prank.

"The groom had no idea what we decided to do, but once we started acting goofy, he played along and was laughing," Wester, who lives in St. Paul, Alta., told HuffPost Canada via email.

"We had been outside in the 36 C weather in the sun all day in formal attire for hours, and we figured we could try and perk everyone up and make them laugh."

Although Wester says her poses were done in the spur of the moment, the 23-year-old noted that the idea for the photobomb was actually conceived years earlier.

"It was based off a photo Rebecca saw that we both decided we had to recreate," she explained. "This was two years before the actual wedding!"

It was so funny. The whole bridal party was cracking up.

In addition to the groom, Bonnyville-based photographer Ashley Hempel was also caught off guard by the maid of honour's antics.

"Sharilyn was like 'Oh we want to do this one photo of me tossing her veil,' and I was like 'Sure, okay,' thinking to myself we had already done a few with my assistant tossing it," Hempel said. "So I posed Becca and James, and then Sharilyn started HER posing and I died. It was so funny. The whole bridal party was cracking up."

Hempel added that the hilarity of the photo was definitely thanks to the two best friends and their silly sense of humour.

"They are hilarious," she said of Foster and Wester. "They have each other's backs â€” constantly striking poses and goofing off even during the getting ready photos."

"I think they're the type of friends who will be 75 at an old folks' home pantsing the orderlies," she added with a laugh.

Clearly Foster and Wester are serious BFF goals.

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Maid Of Honour Pranks Alberta Newlyweds In Hilarious Veil Toss Photos

TEXT:
If you're pregnant at Halloween, you might think your costume options are limited to "Juno."

While the film character is a classic â€” after all, even Jessica Alba chose the look this year â€” moms on Twitter are proving it's actually pretty easy to come up with genius Halloween costumes while pregnant.

Just take a look at exhibit A: Krang from "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles."

A friend of a friend, who is 5 months pregnant, dressed up as Krang and should win all Halloween. pic.twitter.com/gllETziXu7 â€” ğŸ¦‡Tomb of DracuLanğŸ¦‡ (@pittsed_off) October 29, 2017

And here's Bob-omb from Nintendo.

Other classics include a bun in the oven, an avocado and a pregnant unicorn.

My pregnant cousin and her little family are winning Halloween ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜ pic.twitter.com/zrA0FhOclv â€” jackie (@jacckiee_s) October 30, 2017

If you're pregnant and looking for a last-minute Halloween costume...this is genius! Ha ha! @avocados pic.twitter.com/OzClw0oyTH â€” Greta Podleski (@gretapodleski) October 30, 2017

Halloween Costume idea: Pregnant Unicorn Woman with Chef Child pic.twitter.com/rPdCEfW003 â€” home girl (@lustedafter) October 19, 2017

And for those who are into pop culture, trendy options this year include pregnant Kylie Jenner and a pregnant Handmaid.

i made a pregnant Kylie Jenner Halloween costume :)



help :)https://t.co/GmIox59YqL pic.twitter.com/SIdjnQlGHA â€” Mikaela (@MikaelaLong) October 1, 2017

@camilluddington is this girl pregnant or is just the costume? anyway you look gorgeous and your friends too ğŸ’• pic.twitter.com/ncEV4lvRdM â€” â„³Î±ddy â™¡ (@ciaoluddington) October 29, 2017

In the past, Miley Cyrus' "Wrecking Ball," pregnant zombies and Wilson from "Castaway," have also been popular choices among expectant moms. But by far, one of our forever favourites has to be when moms-to-be transform their bellies into beer guts. Hilarious!

I can't with my damn costume. Only thing that looked good with a 9 month pregnant belly pic.twitter.com/6wX5xJR52p â€” CariğŸ¦‹ (@cari_tla) October 29, 2017

Without a doubt, any one of these killer ideas is sure to win you all the love â€” and hopefully, plenty of candy.

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Moms-To-Be Prove Halloween Costumes Can Still Be Epic When Youâ€™re Pregnant

SUMMARY:
One of the advantages of the hot mess that 2017 has been, 10 months in, is that there's plenty of fodder for last-minute Halloween costumes.
Some of the 20 last-minute DIY costumes below are best done as a solo affair, while others work well as couples or group costumes â€” use your imagination!
A few of them are a little dark, a lot of them are funny, but all of them will be perfectly at home at a 2017 Halloween party.
BoJack HorsemanA post shared by ilduca_acudli (@ilduca_acudli) on Oct 20, 2017 at 5:59am PDTEveryone's favourite terrible-yet-compelling animated B-list horse!
Fidget spinnerHow to make a fidget spinner Halloween costume: https://t.co/KzHYghTd6l pic.twitter.com/Rrf76qAiBS â€” Lifehacker (@lifehacker) September 27, 2017The trendiest toy of 2017 may be fading from popularity, but it's still a great costume idea.
TEXT:
One of the advantages of the hot mess that 2017 has been, 10 months in, is that there's plenty of fodder for last-minute Halloween costumes.

And fortunately, most of these costumes are relatively easy to DIY with what you already have at home and/or a quick trip to the dollar or thrift store. You don't even necessarily need glue to put these together â€” just some creativity will do.

Some of the 20 last-minute DIY costumes below are best done as a solo affair, while others work well as couples or group costumes â€” use your imagination! A few of them are a little dark, a lot of them are funny, but all of them will be perfectly at home at a 2017 Halloween party.

BoJack Horseman

A post shared by ilduca_acudli (@ilduca_acudli) on Oct 20, 2017 at 5:59am PDT

Everyone's favourite terrible-yet-compelling animated B-list horse! If you can get your hands on one of those creepy horse masks, you just need a terrible sweater and the air of defeat, but it'd be even better with a printed-out illustrated BoJack head.

Fake news

People are saying it's everywhere! Well, one particular person, anyway. Make yourself an outfit out of newspapers (they're still a thing!) and stamp a big red FAKE all over it. Much more creative than the "sexy" version that was of course released this year.

'90s resurrection

A post shared by Elizabeth Keene (@elizabethkeene) on Oct 19, 2017 at 5:25pm PDT

Put all those discounted crop tops and platform slides at the mall to good use and go as your most coveted teenage outfit from the Delia's catalogue.

Avocado toast

A post shared by Brit + Co (@britandco) on Oct 13, 2017 at 3:39pm PDT

If avocado toast is going to bring us all down eventually, we might as well celebrate the food that's allegedly preventing you from ever owning a home. This costume is made with fabric but you can do it even more easily with cardboard and coloured paper.

Millennial pink

A post shared by Oh Happy Day (@ohhappyday) on Oct 14, 2017 at 11:16am PDT

Go as the colour of the moment by adorning yourself with millennial pink from head to toe. We bet you already have a bunch of the pieces in your closet. Don't forget lips, nails â€” even hair!

Your favourite emoji

A post shared by Kevin (@fashionelevatorshoes) on Oct 25, 2016 at 12:57am PDT

OK, so the movie wasn't great â€” but emojis are still a lot of fun. It's easy to go as your favourite for Halloween with a costume made from bristol board, thin foam and paint, or even felt and a brightly coloured t-shirt.

Multiple Taylor Swifts

Get some inspiration from Swift's "Look What You Made Me Do" music video for your group costume and go as the various Taylor incarnations: "bad" Swift, zombie Swift, etc.

Fidget spinner

How to make a fidget spinner Halloween costume: https://t.co/KzHYghTd6l pic.twitter.com/Rrf76qAiBS â€” Lifehacker (@lifehacker) September 27, 2017

The trendiest toy of 2017 may be fading from popularity, but it's still a great costume idea. Just get some cardboard â€” bonus points if you can figure out how to really make it move.

Eleven from "Stranger Things"

Photo documentation of all the outfits and junk food! ^^ #elevencosplay #eleven #strangerthingscosplay #strangerthings #netflix @netflixstrangerthings @strangerthingsfanatics A post shared by Mary & Feinobi cosplay (@maryandfeinobi) on Jul 10, 2017 at 10:46am PDT

Dig that box of Eggos out of your freezer and celebrate the return of "Stranger Things." If you're really on the ball, binge the new episodes and go as season 2 Eleven.

BBC interview girl

A post shared by Guardian Australia (@guardianaustralia) on Mar 12, 2017 at 2:27pm PDT

She swaggered her way into our hearts earlier this year, and "BBC Interview Girl" â€” complete with yellow sweater, glasses and pigtails â€” would be welcome to interrupt any Halloween party.

Dart Guy

I would do my face paint and dress up like "Dart Guy". Would love to go to the game with @dpurch79 @googz88 and @VidaGlam #fansgofurther pic.twitter.com/MZO9ZWStbI â€” The Guggemeister (@googz80) October 23, 2017

Already have a Leafs jersey hanging in your closet? Then you're well on your way to going as "Dart Guy," everyone's favourite Leafs fan. Just stick to fake cigarettes, OK?

Vacation Obama

Started wearing less and going out more. pic.twitter.com/0FLoF9vZwX â€” Blue Shakalaka (@BeezHunny) February 7, 2017

Wouldn't you be smiling too if you'd had a tropical getaway? Throw on a helmet and a sleek life vest, pull out those wraparound shades, and start smiling.

This Is The Future That Liberals Want meme

this is the future liberals want pic.twitter.com/26wWUKfLCg â€” darth:â„¢ (@darth) March 2, 2017

There are endless variations here thanks to the popularity of the meme, but we are personally fans of this version of "This Is The Future That Liberals Want." Recreate it with a bunch of plush dogs â€” or just photos â€” attached to every spare surface of your clothing.

Babadook loves Pennywise

The Babadook and Pennywise are the next big horror couple...



But who wears the better threads? ğŸ¤” pic.twitter.com/QfSUMyQIzl â€” Antifreeze ğŸ‡ (@AntiBunbun) September 12, 2017

Many have referred to Halloween as "Gay Christmas" but why not bring in a bit of Valentine's-style romance? We are referring, of course, to the LGBTQ couple of the year: Babadook and Pennywise. Get out the clown makeup, start constructing a giant Babadook made of fabric, and have fun.

Dancing Snapchat hot dog

I'm the Snapchat hot dog & Madam is an astronaut. pic.twitter.com/8XaIdHh3IQ â€” Alexandra Benson (@alexandraeryn) October 22, 2017

Get a red T-shirt and pants, a brown vest, put on headphones, and add some squiggles of green and yellow. Now put on some music and you're not just a hot dog â€” you're the dancing Snapchat hot dog!

The ladies of "â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹GLOW"

A post shared by Janie Brookshire (@brookshirejane) on Jun 27, 2017 at 6:16pm PDT

Get your best friends together and celebrate "GLOW," the Netflix hit that provides plenty of great uber-'80s Halloween ideas.

Solar eclipse

A post shared by Abhinav Sharma (@thebackstorybyabhinav) on Oct 20, 2017 at 3:47am PDT

That was a nice distraction from regular news for a bit, huh? Bring the eclipse black with an all-black outfit accented by a sliver of gold or yellow â€” a bow, a single glove, you choose.

A handmaid from The Handmaid's Tale

This may fall under the category of "too soon" but it could also be seen as combining costume and protest. Make the hat with white bristol board, pair it with a dark red dress, and get some friends in on the action.

Ivanka's neighbour

Aesthetic goals: Ivanka Trump's neighbor sipping wine in a fur coat as a protest goes down ğŸ’…ğŸ¼ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ pic.twitter.com/osvamoECkj â€” Cá´É´á´Ê€ AÊ€á´˜á´¡á´‡ÊŸ ğŸŒ¹ (@Arpwel) April 3, 2017

Ivanka Trump's D.C. neighbour â€” who was spotted enjoying a protest in a fur, with wine in hand â€” broke the internet last spring. Bring her aesthetic back with a big fake fur from the thrift store, a glass of vino, and a big smile.

Vacation Mario

Is this a first for Mario? Mario letting them nipples fly free? What a time to be alive. pic.twitter.com/zqlEFfpouY â€” GoNintendoTweet (@GoNintendoTweet) September 13, 2017

One of the most shocking news items of 2017? Mario has nipples. Pay homage to what looks like his great vacation with red shorts, a full mustache, that signature hat â€” and not much else.

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Last-Minute Halloween Costumes You Can Easily DIY

SUMMARY:
TORONTO â€• The leader of Canadaâ€™s most left-wing political party vowed to stand up to President Donald Trump if elected prime minister and called on current Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to do the same.
Asked whether he believes that Prime Minister Trudeau, leader of the center-left Liberal Party, has done an adequate job standing up to Trump, Singh said, â€œI donâ€™t think so.â€â€œHe could be stronger.
If Singh remains leader of his party in two years, he will run for prime minister against Trudeau and the Conservative Party leader, a post currently held by Andrew Scheer.
But in keeping with its role as the most ardent proponent of universal health care in Canadian history, the NDP got its fair share of the limelight.
And aside from Sanders, Singh was clearly a crowd favorite, drawing raucous applause when he entered the room and took his seat in the front row.
TEXT:
TORONTO â€• The leader of Canadaâ€™s most left-wing political party vowed to stand up to President Donald Trump if elected prime minister and called on current Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to do the same.

â€œI believe that you have to stand up to a bully. You canâ€™t back down from a bully â€• thatâ€™s what they want you to do,â€ Jagmeet Singh, the recently elected leader of the National Democratic Party told HuffPost following Vermont Sen. Bernie Sandersâ€™ speech on health care at the University of Toronto.

Asked whether he believes that Prime Minister Trudeau, leader of the center-left Liberal Party, has done an adequate job standing up to Trump, Singh said, â€œI donâ€™t think so.â€

â€œHe could be stronger. He could stand up,â€ Singh said.

Trudeau has developed a close working relationship with the U.S. president since Trump took office in January, notwithstanding their major disagreements on issues like trade and immigrant rights. Trump appeared to get along well with Trudeau during the prime ministerâ€™s first visit to Washington, D.C., under the new presidency in February. Trudeau returned for renegotiation talks earlier this month among the U.S., Canada and Mexico on the North American Free Trade Agreement.

Trudeau praised Trump in June as someone who â€œknows how to interact socially on a very effective level.â€

â€œIâ€™ve always found that whenever he has made an engagement to me or a commitment to me on the phone or in person, he has followed through on that,â€ Trudeau said. â€œAnd thatâ€™s someone you can work with.â€

Andrew Francis Wallace/Getty Images Jagmeet Singh celebrates his win as leader of the New Democratic Party on Oct. 1. 2017.

Singh was elected head of the New Democratic Party, or NDP, Canadaâ€™s most left-wing major party, on Oct. 1. If Singh remains leader of his party in two years, he will run for prime minister against Trudeau and the Conservative Party leader, a post currently held by Andrew Scheer. The next national elections are on Oct. 21, 2019.

Singh, a 38-year-old criminal defense attorney and member of Ontarioâ€™s provincial parliament, rose to international fame thanks to a viral video capturing him patiently reasoning with a xenophobic heckler at a town hall meeting.

In September, Singh, who is a practicing Sikh, was holding one of his â€œJagmMeet and Greetâ€ community forums in the Toronto suburb of Brampton when a woman began interrupting the event with anti-Muslim vitriol directed at Singh. (Practicing Sikh men, who typically wear turbans and grow large beards, are often subject to Islamophobic hate crimes and other prejudice based on the uninformed perception that they are Muslim.)

Singh encouraged the audience to chant â€œlove and courageâ€ to drown out her yells.

â€œWe welcome you. We love you. We support you, and we love you,â€ he told the woman.

Even as he declared Sunday that he would adopt a confrontational stance toward Trump as prime minister, Singh advised Americans concerned about rising xenophobia and other forms of bias under Trumpâ€™s leadership to emulate the high-road approach he modeled at the town hall.

â€œWe all need love and courage to tackle the issues of the day, to keep that love in your heart, that weâ€™re all connected, weâ€™re all in this together, and it requires courage for us to demand better, dream bigger and fight for a better world,â€ he told HuffPost. â€œThat love and courage is a big part of why I do what I do, and I think that will motivate other people as well.â€

Sen. Sanders arrived in Toronto on Saturday for a two-day tour of Canadaâ€™s publicly financed health care system. The trip was aimed at learning about its successes and challenges as he continues his push for the United States to adopt a similar system. On Saturday, Sanders visited several hospitals in downtown Toronto alongside Ontario Premier Kathleen Wynne of the Liberal Party, several American medical professionals and Canadian physicians and health care advocates.

Wynne introduced Sanders on Sunday ahead of his speech to an audience of over 1,000 people, most of them University of Toronto students.

But in keeping with its role as the most ardent proponent of universal health care in Canadian history, the NDP got its fair share of the limelight.

In his speech, Sanders sang the praises of Tommy Douglas, who was the first leader of the NDP and is credited as the forefather of Canadaâ€™s national health care system. The party is now fighting for universal coverage of pharmaceutical drugs, which the government does not guarantee across the board, as well as dental care, which is entirely private. (Wynne said she also supports universal pharmaceutical coverage, and has overseen the expansion of Ontarioâ€™s health insurance program to cover pharmaceutical drugs for all provincial residents from birth through age 24, which will take effect in January.)

And aside from Sanders, Singh was clearly a crowd favorite, drawing raucous applause when he entered the room and took his seat in the front row.

Speaking after Sanders, Ed Broadbent, who led the NDP from 1975 to 1989, gave Singh a shout-out.

A bill the NDP introduced in parliament that would provide universal pharmaceutical coverage, Broadbent noted, â€œdidnâ€™t pass, but I can tell you the struggle for it will continue.â€

â€œAnd I also want you to know that it pleases me a lot that the man who will lead that battle is Jagmeet Singh,â€ he added.

The applause at the mention of Singhâ€™s name was so loud that he stood up and waved to acknowledge the ovation.

Singh met with Sanders on Sunday morning prior to his speech, a conversation Singh described as â€œawesome.â€ He asked Sanders what motivated him to fight so hard for universal health care.
TITLE: Progressive Canadian Leader: Justin Trudeau Should â€˜Stand Upâ€™ To Donald Trump

SUMMARY:
WASHINGTON â€• A foreign policy adviser to President Donald Trump's presidential campaign has pleaded guilty to a charge of lying to FBI agents about "dirt" he was offered on Hillary Clinton.
George Papadopoulos, 30, pleaded guilty on Oct. 5, but the case wasn't unsealed until Monday, when two other Trump associates were indicted by a federal grand jury.
Papadopoulos reached a plea deal with prosecutors, and has since been cooperating with special counsel Robert Mueller's probe into Russian interference in the 2016 election.
Prosecutors' statement of the offense alleges Papadopoulos was offered thousands of emails containing "dirt" on Clinton in April 2016 â€• months before the Russian hack of the Democratic National Committee was known.
TEXT:
WASHINGTON â€• A foreign policy adviser to President Donald Trump's presidential campaign has pleaded guilty to a charge of lying to FBI agents about "dirt" he was offered on Hillary Clinton.

George Papadopoulos, 30, pleaded guilty on Oct. 5, but the case wasn't unsealed until Monday, when two other Trump associates were indicted by a federal grand jury.

Papadopoulos reached a plea deal with prosecutors, and has since been cooperating with special counsel Robert Mueller's probe into Russian interference in the 2016 election.

Prosecutors' statement of the offense alleges Papadopoulos was offered thousands of emails containing "dirt" on Clinton in April 2016 â€• months before the Russian hack of the Democratic National Committee was known.
TITLE: George Papadopoulos, Trump Campaign Adviser, Lied To FBI About Russian 'Dirt'

SUMMARY:
CIBC says in a new report that the Canadian dollar is likely to come under pressure in coming months.
Among the most prominent voices calling for a lower Canadian dollar is CIBC, which in a report issued Friday suggested that betting against the loonie is a good idea these days.
"We suggest that the Canadian dollar is still mispriced," the bank's deputy chief economist, Benjamin Tal, wrote.
"Too many factors are pointing in unison to one direction â€” a lower loonie."
Tal predicts that the loonie will fall to around 75 cents U.S. in the first few months of 2018.
TEXT:
A CIBC sign in Toronto's financial district, Thurs. Feb. 26, 2009. CIBC says in a new report that the Canadian dollar is likely to come under pressure in coming months.

A growing number of analysts are predicting the loonie is in for a rough few months.

Among the most prominent voices calling for a lower Canadian dollar is CIBC, which in a report issued Friday suggested that betting against the loonie is a good idea these days.

"We suggest that the Canadian dollar is still mispriced," the bank's deputy chief economist, Benjamin Tal, wrote. "Too many factors are pointing in unison to one direction â€” a lower loonie."

Tal predicts that the loonie will fall to around 75 cents U.S. in the first few months of 2018. It was trading at 77.8 cents U.S. on Monday morning, already down from highs above 82 cents in September.

Watch: How NAFTA talks are impacting the loonie and Mexican peso

Tal argued that U.S. President Donald Trump's pick for a new Federal Reserve chair will likely be more aggressive than their predecessor, Janet Yellen, so interest rates are likely to rise faster in the U.S. than Canada, driving up the U.S. dollar against the loonie.

He noted that, when it comes to policy decisions from the Trump administration, "the current level of expectation ... is basically zero."

So if Trump and congressional Republicans manage to pass a tax reform package, that "could lead to a notable market reaction ... putting downward pressure on our currency," Tal wrote in a report titled "Short the Loonie."

Other analysts are making similar arguments. Kurt Reiman of global investment management firm BlackRock noted that a failure of NAFTA renegotiations could also push the loonie lower, as so far, investors haven't priced in that risk.

"Since NAFTA re-negotiations began, the loonie has risen one per cent while the Mexican peso weakened seven per cent. The Canadian dollar arguably has more room to reflect concerns of a bleak NAFTA outcome," he wrote.

Reiman also noted that Canadians have accumulated one of the largest household debt burdens in the developed world, so he expects the Bank of Canada to move cautiously in raising interest rates in the coming months. That, again, will put downward pressure on the loonie.

CIBC's Tal agrees. He notes that the markets have priced in a 28-per-cent chance of the Bank of Canada raising interest rates in December.

"That's 28 per cent too high," Tal wrote.

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Bet Against The Loonie, CIBC Says

TEXT:
CDU-Politiker Spahn hat in einem Interview die Abschaffung der Rente mit 63 gefordert

Zuspruch kam aus der Wirtschaft, Kritik von der SPD

Kaum ist die groÃŸe Koalition Geschichte, wird eines ihrer Rentenprojekte zerpflÃ¼ckt: die Rente mit 63.

CDU-PrÃ¤sidiumsmitglied Jens Spahn verlangte in der "Rheinischen Post" ihre Abschaffung. Diese "Form der FrÃ¼hverrentung" sollte auslaufen und das Geld lieber in die Renten von Witwen und Erwerbsgeminderten investiert werden, argumentierte er. "Die Rente mit 63 fÃ¼r langjÃ¤hrig Versicherte wird vor allem von mÃ¤nnlichen Facharbeitern genutzt, die wir eigentlich noch brauchen."

IW-Direktor ist fÃ¼r die Abschaffung

Der Direktor des arbeitgebernahen Instituts der deutschen Wirtschaft (IW) KÃ¶ln, Michael HÃ¼ther, sagte der "Welt", die Rente mit 63 mÃ¼sse "rÃ¼ckabgewickelt" werden. Mehr als 200.000 ArbeitskrÃ¤fte hÃ¤tten deswegen schon zu arbeiten aufgehÃ¶rt â€“ alles gut verdienende Menschen mit mittlerer und hÃ¶herer Bildung.

"Wenn ich GrÃ¼ne und FDP wÃ¤re, wÃ¼rde ich die Union da vor mir hertreiben", sagte HÃ¼ther mit Blick auf die Jamaika-Sondierungen. Zudem mÃ¼sse man darÃ¼ber nachdenken, ab 2029 das Renteneintrittsalter auch Ã¼ber 67 Jahre hinaus zu erhÃ¶hen.

Nach Angaben der Deutschen Rentenversicherung Bund haben bis Ende August 160.000 Versicherte einen Antrag auf abschlagsfreie Rente mit 63 gestellt. Im Vorjahreszeitraum waren es noch 165.000.

Kritik von der SPD

Wer mindestens 45 Jahre in die Rentenversicherung eingezahlt hat, kann seit Juli 2014 ab 63 Jahren ohne Abschlag in Rente gehen. Allerdings wird diese Altersgrenze seitdem pro Jahr um zwei Monate angehoben, so dass die JahrgÃ¤nge ab 1964 erst mit 65 nach 45 Jahren abschlagsfrei in Renten gehen kÃ¶nnen. Die "Rente mit 63" ist insofern etwas missverstÃ¤ndlich.

Die frÃ¼here Bundesfamilienministerin Manuela Schwesig (SPD) wies den VorstoÃŸ Spahns zurÃ¼ck. "Das zeigt, wie die CDU heute tickt. Da ist mehr soziale KÃ¤lte als soziale Verantwortung zu spÃ¼ren", sagte sie dem SWR.

Das Vorstandsmitglied des Deutschen Gewerkschaftsbundes (DGB), Annelie Buntenbach, hielt Spahn entgegen: "Wer die Rente mit 63 zurÃ¼ckdrehen will, ignoriert schlicht die Lebenswirklichkeit vieler Menschen. Wir brauchen nicht weniger MÃ¶glichkeiten fÃ¼r BeschÃ¤ftigte, vor dem 67. Lebensjahr in Rente gehen zu kÃ¶nnen, sondern mehr." Viele erreichten heute schon den regulÃ¤ren Rentenbeginn nicht.

Der Wirtschaftsrat der CDU sieht in einem Jamaika-BÃ¼ndnis die groÃŸe Chance, das SPD-Projekt der Rente mit 63 zu beerdigen, und unterstÃ¼tzt den VorstoÃŸ Spahns.

Die MÃ¼tterrente

Die CSU wollte in den Jamaika-Sondierungen auch eine weitere ErhÃ¶hung der MÃ¼tterrente fordern. Dabei geht es um MÃ¼tter, deren Kinder vor 1992 geboren wurden. Sie sollen einen Rentenpunkt mehr bekommen und damit genauso viel wie MÃ¼tter, deren Kinder nach diesem Datum geboren wurden. Ein Rentenpunkt fÃ¼r diese Frauen kostet zwischen sechs und sieben Milliarden Euro.

Die GrÃ¼nen-Fraktionsvorsitzende Katrin GÃ¶ring-Eckardt sagte im ARD-"Morgenmagazin": "FÃ¼r mich ist das Entscheidende, dass wir keine Altersarmut mehr haben." Die MÃ¼tterrente sei dafÃ¼r nicht das richtige Instrument. Besser wÃ¤re eine "Garantierente". Wer lange gearbeitet habe, solle mehr haben als die Grundsicherung.

Die PrÃ¤sidentin des Sozialverbands VdK, Ulrike Mascher, forderte die vollstÃ¤ndige Angleichung der MÃ¼tterrente sowie eine Stabilisierung des Rentenniveaus und dessen Anhebung auf 50 Prozent.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Ãœberwachung, Terrorabwehr, Polizei: Beim Thema innere Sicherheit droht der nÃ¤chste Krach fÃ¼r Jamaika
TITLE: CDU-Politiker Spahn fordert Abschaffung der Rente mit 63 - die SPD kritisiert den VorstoÃŸ

SUMMARY:
â€œExhibit Beâ€Brandan Odums A look at artwork inside Brandan Odums' "Exhibit Be" (2014).
â€œStudio Beâ€Brandan Odums A mural in Brandan Odums' "Studio Be" exhibit (2017).
Brandan Odums A mural in Brandan Odums' "Studio Be" exhibit (2017).
Brandan Odums A mural in Brandan Odums' "Studio Be" exhibit (2017).
Brandan Odums Brandan Odums spray-paints a wall for "Exhibit Be" in 2014.
TEXT:
For the past four years, Brandan â€œBMikeâ€ Odums has been transforming blighted spaces in New Orleansâ€™ poor neighborhoods through powerful art.

Odums spray-paints larger-than-life murals of African-American icons like Malcolm X, Harriet Tubman and Martin Luther King Jr. at abandoned sites, some of which have been falling apart since Hurricane Katrina.

The New Orleans native aims to criticize how the city neglected under-resourced neighborhoods after the 2005 natural disaster â€• but also wants to celebrate the residents of these mostly-black neighborhoods and the pride and beauty of their communities.

â€œThink about the spaces, they were in black, poor communities,â€ Odums told HuffPost. â€œ[The art is] just to feel like you matter and you have value, so people can see themselves reflected in this portrait of Mohammed Ali or Maya Angelou.â€

â€œSeeing a 12-foot painting of a person of color, it immediately asks a question of why itâ€™s this large: It must be valuable,â€ he added.

â€œProject Beâ€

Brandan Odums Brandan Odums in front of a portrait of Coretta Scott King and Martin Luther King Jr. in his "Project Be" space in 2013.

He and other artists covered the buildingsâ€™ decaying walls with enormous murals of famed civil rights figures, from the Black Panthers to Malcolm X to Coretta Scott King.

â€œNew Orleans is a magical city, itâ€™s amazing â€• the resilience of the people has always surfaced,â€ Odums said. â€œMy goal is to speak to issues happening in the community. We have to create the change we want to see.â€

But the Housing Authority of New Orleans boarded up the property after reportedly deeming it unsafe for public visitors. So Odums moved on to a vacant apartment complex in the Algiers neighborhood, which was full of blighted properties after Katrina.

â€œExhibit Beâ€

Brandan Odums A look at artwork inside Brandan Odums' "Exhibit Be" (2014).

There, Odums ran into some luck: Bill Thomason, a director at the RDLN Foundation, a small nonprofit dedicated to charitable building projects that owned the property, came across Odumsâ€™ art in the space and loved it.

Rather than kick him out, he told Odums to keep going. So in 2014, Odums brought together dozens of artists to contribute their talents and launch â€œExhibit Be,â€ a multistory art show celebrating black history and culture with images of Harriet Tubman and quotes like â€œYou are your ancestorsâ€™ wildest dreams.â€

â€œThe goal of that space was to be intentional about where that property stood, to reflect the reality of living in a poorly managed housing unit that ended up being an abandoned space,â€ Odums told HuffPost. â€œI wanted [people] to understand they would not have been standing on that spot without that art, they would have been too afraid of going down the street.â€

Brandan Odums People attending a block party at Odums' "Exhibit Be" space in 2015.

When â€œExhibit Beâ€ opened to the public in 2014, it quickly became a local success, attracting thousands of visitors, national media coverage and school trips to the space.

â€œIt was a crazy story of how we turned lemon into lemonade,â€ Odums told HuffPost. â€œIt was a space so many people avoided, and now there was a line. Erykah Badu came to the block party.â€

Thomason said it was â€œamazingâ€ to watch thousands of people coming to see the art.

â€œEspecially in these times, with all this turmoil, you had people coming to visit, having conversations together â€• black, white, all creeds, colors, religions â€• who would just sit there, enjoying the artwork,â€ Thomason told HuffPost.

â€œStudio Beâ€

Brandan Odums A mural in Brandan Odums' "Studio Be" exhibit (2017).

Odumsâ€™ first solo show, â€œStudio Be,â€ which kicked off in early 2016 and is currently on view in a warehouse in New Orleansâ€™ Bywater neighborhood, is the first â€œBeâ€ project to start up entirely legally.

In â€œStudio Be,â€ Odumsâ€™ large-scale murals reflect social justice issues like civil rights and police brutality. One portrait series features unarmed black men killed by police: Michael Brown, Eric Garner and Oscar Grant.

Odums says he makes a point of hosting school tours there to teach kids about lesser-known black history figures, such as Fred Hampton, a leader of the Black Panthers who was assassinated at age 21.

â€œItâ€™s full circle, from starting painting in the streets without permission to coming to this space. Think about the power of art,â€ Odums said. â€œItâ€™s about me speaking as a young black man from New Orleans, and speaking truth to that existence â€• the hope, the pain, the beauty.â€

Check out more of Odumsâ€™ art below and on his website.

Brandan Odums A mural in Brandan Odums' "Studio Be" exhibit (2017).

Brandan Odums A mural in Brandan Odums' "Studio Be" exhibit (2017).

Brandan Odums Inside "Exhibit Be" (2014).

Brandan Odums A portrait series in the "Studio Be" exhibit (2017).

Brandan Odums Brandan Odums spray-paints a wall for "Exhibit Be" in 2014.
TITLE: Artist Transforms Abandoned Buildings In New Orleans With Powerful Art
