SUMMARY:
That's at least according to results from a new Angus Reid Institute poll, which asked Canadians to dive into their psyches and reveal their biggest fear.
"Nothing" was the answer for almost seven per cent of poll respondents.
Financial woes and death tied for second place, with 8.2 per cent of respondents citing the two as their the biggest fear.
The poll's main focus was on Canadians' attitudes toward Halloween and trick-or-treating.
The Angus Reid Institute's poll was conducted online between Oct. 24-27 among a representative randomized sample of 1,504 Canadian adults.
TEXT:
Watch out, we've apparently got a lot of badasses in Canada.

That's at least according to results from a new Angus Reid Institute poll, which asked Canadians to dive into their psyches and reveal their biggest fear.

"Nothing" was the answer for almost seven per cent of poll respondents.

Yes, nothing.

Illness came in as the No. 1 boogeyman with 9.4 per cent saying it was their biggest fear.

Financial woes and death tied for second place, with 8.2 per cent of respondents citing the two as their the biggest fear. Can we get a hell yeah for the free market?

Other slightly less, shall we say, universal fears such as "bad candy" and the Trudeau government were also mentioned, but "none of these appear to be as prevalent in Canada as fearlessness," ARI said in a release.

Check out the full list here.

The poll's main focus was on Canadians' attitudes toward Halloween and trick-or-treating.

ARI found that there are "decreasing concerns" around children's safety on Halloween compared to previous decades.

In a 1989 Gallup Canada poll, for example, 21 per cent of respondents said it was "as safe" for kids to go out trick-or-treating as it was a decade prior. In ARI's 2017 survey, 52 per cent said it was as safe to go out as it was 10 years ago.

The poll also found that millennials were "much more lenient" when it came to the question of which age trick-or-treating careers came to an end.

Four-in-ten respondents in the 18-34 demographic said age 15 was the right time to stop. Those 55 and older, meanwhile, said trick-or-treaters should give it up at 12.

The Angus Reid Institute's poll was conducted online between Oct. 24-27 among a representative randomized sample of 1,504 Canadian adults. For comparison purposes, a probability sample of this size would carry a margin of error of plus or minus 2.5 per cent, 19 times out of 20.

Click here for more of the findings.

Also On HuffPost:
TITLE: Halloween Poll From Angus Reid Institute Asks Canadians To Reveal Their Biggest Fears

SUMMARY:
But there's a new generation of sport fans who are engaging with another dimension of sport that online gambling has brought about.
For them, gambling makes sport more fun, at least more interactive.
They are no longer simply satisfied with sport -- they want to add to the entertainment value of it by gambling on it.
Of course, sports betting companies know they're on to a winner here, and so do most sports organisations.
And that's exactly why, like it or not, sports have been willing participants in the integration of gambling and sport.
TEXT:
"For millennials, in particular, online gambling is right up their alley."

It seems sport is not as exciting as it used to be. At least for some.

It used to be the spectacular marks, the improbable comebacks and the extraordinary moments of athletic genius that kept us all enthralled. And to a certain extent it still is. But there's a new generation of sport fans who are engaging with another dimension of sport that online gambling has brought about.

They're turning to the most enticing odds, the exotic bets and the best bet of the day. For them, gambling makes sport more fun, at least more interactive.

Gambling and horse racing have always gone hand in hand. Between August and the end of the Spring Carnival it's expected that Aussie gamblers will splash around $1.5 billion in bets. We'll drop around $140 million on the Melbourne Cupalone.

But now, it would seem, more and more sports are becoming linked with having a bet.

The theory is, if you have a financial stake in the game, the game is more exciting.

In 2014-15, Australians gambled nearly $7.2 billion on sports betting (not including racing), in the process losing around $815 million.

Alliance for Gambling Reform spokesperson Tim Costello has noted that "sports betting is the fastest growing level of addiction" in Australia and that "sports betting targets young men and that's a rapidly growing area of addiction".

Costello is not alone. A lot of people reckon sports gambling is out of control and wonder why it's even necessary. Surely the games themselves are entertaining enough, right?

Wrong.

For many, gambling has become an enjoyable, exciting and exhilarating part of their sport experience. They are no longer simply satisfied with sport -- they want to add to the entertainment value of it by gambling on it.

The theory is, if you have a financial stake in the game, the game is more exciting. If you bet on outcomes within games, like who'll have the most disposals or kick the first goal, there are more exciting parts within the game. It adds a bit of spice to the contest.

For millennials, in particular, it's right up their alley. Statistics show that 90 percent of those who gamble on sport online are male, with an average age of 31. They like to multi-task, so they'll gamble while watching sport. They like whatever they do to be convenient, such as placing a bet through an app on their phone. They like instant gratification and ongoing excitement, so they'll place exotic bets on outcomes during games. And they like to add to things to generate more entertainment value, so they'll gamble on the outcome of just about anything.

For them, a $20 wager on the outcome of a match is akin to a $20 investment in being entertained. They reckon its good value for money. It's part of their typical sports experience and they see nothing wrong with it at all.

Furthermore, of those I know, they argue they only spend what they can afford and bemoan the idea that betting on sport is naturally problematic. It's only problematic, they say, when you're spending more than you should.

Of course, sports betting companies know they're on to a winner here, and so do most sports organisations.

Most sports organisations peddle the socially responsible line that consumers should always gamble responsibly, but they also count the dollars gambling companies directly and indirectly generate for the game.

And that's exactly why, like it or not, sports have been willing participants in the integration of gambling and sport. They know that some fans are only watching their games because they've had a bet on the outcome. If they were to lose that audience, they'd take a financial hit.

That's why it's different from other forms of sponsorship from so-called socially irresponsible industries. Tobacco companies were banned from sponsoring Australian sport in 1992, but while fans could smoke at matches, it never became ingrained in the entertainment experience of sport. So, it was relatively easy for sports organisations to cut off tobacco companies. Not so with gambling.

In reality, the debate is one that fundamentally starts and stops with money, or more to the point, the pursuit of it and the devastating effects of losing too much of it for individuals who can't afford it.

But don't assume that those who lose on the punt do so expecting to win. For many, it's less to do with making money than it is investing in entertainment, because for them, believe it or not, gambling makes sport more fun.
TITLE: Why Sport Can No Longer Exist Without Gambling

TEXT:
Nous avons tous des dizaines d'idÃ©es par jour. Oui! TOUS! La question serait plutÃ´t de savoir alors comment se fait-il que nous captions certaines idÃ©es et pas d'autres? Pourquoi retenons-nous certaines idÃ©es et pas d'autres? Pourquoi actons-nous sur certaines idÃ©es et pas d'autres?

1. Le plus compliquÃ© avec les idÃ©es c'est d'Ãªtre en mesure de pouvoir les "capter" lorsqu'elles arrivent, lorsqu'elles frappent Ã  votre porte

Selon certaines Ã©tudes scientifiques, nous avons environ 60.000 pensÃ©es par jour, dont plus de 95% sont rÃ©pÃ©titives et 80% sont nÃ©gatives... Autant vous dire que si votre esprit est encombrÃ© comme cela, il vous sera plus difficile de capter vos idÃ©es! Mon activitÃ© me demandant d'Ãªtre trÃ¨s crÃ©ative, je n'hÃ©site donc pas Ã  m'octroyer des temps de pause dans la nature et de mÃ©ditation durant ma journÃ©e car je sais que cela va me permettre de prendre du recul par rapport Ã  mes pensÃ©es et pouvoir mieux Ãªtre rÃ©ceptive Ã  mes idÃ©es.

2. Toutes les idÃ©es ne sont pas pour autant bonnes Ã  suivre

AprÃ¨s les avoir captÃ©es, je prends le temps de discerner celles qui 'valent le coup' pour pouvoir dÃ©cider de les suivre ou pas. Cette Ã©tape peut parfois paraÃ®tre trÃ¨s confuse. Avant je n'aurais Ã©coutÃ© que mon mental, mais je me suis rendue compte qu'il n'Ã©tait juste que le porte-parole de mes peurs. Or, vous savez comme moi, que la magie opÃ¨re lorsque nous sortons de notre zone de confort. Aussi, j'ai pris conscience que j'avais d'autres "indicateurs" qui Ã©taient plus bÃ©nÃ©fiques pour moi d'Ã©couter! Il s'agÃ®t de mes ressentis. Comment je me sens par rapport Ã  cette idÃ©e?

Par exemple, si je n'avais Ã©coutÃ© que mon mental â€“ et donc mes peurs - je n'aurais jamais lancÃ© le "Sommet Francophone des Entrepreneurs de leur Vie". Lorsque j'ai rÃ©ussi Ã  capter cette idÃ©e (je me rappelle trÃ¨s bien du moment oÃ¹ j'ai eu cette idÃ©e d'ailleurs), voilÃ  ce que cela donnait cÃ´tÃ© mental: "C'est Ã©norme Ã  monter", "tu ne sais mÃªme pas comment faire", "cela demande des moyens financiers que tu n'as pas", "cela demande des compÃ©tences techniques que tu n'as pas", "qui es-tu pour te lancer ainsi sur un sommet", et "aucun confÃ©rencier ne voudra s'associer Ã  toi" etc. Bref, vous voyez ce que je veux dire... Cette idÃ©e semblait plutÃ´t bien partie pour aller aux oubliettes, Ã  la poubelle pleine des "bonnes-idÃ©es-que-nous-n'avons-malheureusement-pas-eu-le-courage-de-suivre".

Mais au plus profond de moi je ressentais quelque chose de diffÃ©rent, quelque-chose de bien plus grand. LÃ , dans cet instant, pour moi la rÃ©ponse a Ã©tÃ© nette: je SAVAIS au plus profond de moi. Point. Je SAVAIS que c'Ã©tait ce que j'avais Ã  faire et rien d'autres. Je ne savais pas comment je le ferai ni avec qui, mais je SAVAIS que c'Ã©tait ce que j'avais Ã  faire.

Je me rappelle trÃ¨s bien ce que je ressentais Ã  ce moment-lÃ , et ce que je ressens toujours mÃªme dans mes moments de doute et de peurs: cette certitude, ce calme intÃ©rieur, cette plÃ©nitude, cette foi en mon idÃ©e, et en mÃªme temps cette Ã©nergie nouvelle, cette vibration, cette JOIE: cette idÃ©e m'a littÃ©ralement mise en joie! Alors je savais ce que ce signal signifiait: c'est CELA que j'ai Ã  faire. Et je l'ai bien mÃ©morisÃ© ce ressenti, car c'est un bel ancrage que j'utilise notamment lors de mes moments de doutes et de peurs!

3. Il ne suffit pas d'avoir fait le choix!

Il convient aussi de poser le premier acte au plus vite pour ne perdre le "momentum", cet Ã©lan crÃ©atif et rÃ©solument tournÃ© dans l'action qui nous pousse! Alors pour Ã©viter d'Ãªtre Ã  nouveau Ã  la merci de mes peurs face Ã  l' "Ã©nooooormitÃ©" (mon mental a tendance Ã  l'exagÃ©ration voyez-vous!) de la tÃ¢che Ã  accomplir, ma stratÃ©gie c'est d'Ã©crire la plus petite action que je peux poser dÃ¨s maintenant. Puis la suivante. Et encore la suivante. Etre claire par rapport Ã  ma vision et l'Ã©crire c'est super, mais parfois cela peut me paralyser tellement cela me fait peur! Alors dans ces moments-lÃ , rÃ©duire mon champ de vision et rester focalisÃ©e sur la toute premiÃ¨re Ã©tape Ã  franchir peut m'aider Ã  dÃ©passer mes peurs, puis la suivante, et ainsi de suite.

Un pas aprÃ¨s l'autre... et avoir la foi et le courage de continuer ainsi... Alors je ne dis pas pour autant que c'est tous les jours facile. Comment cela se manifeste au quotidien pour moi depuis que j'ai eu cette idÃ©e ? Cela oscille entre l'excitation et la peur, entre l'envie de sauter de joie et l'envie de rester planquÃ©e sous ma couette! Bref c'est intense, mais c'est ce qui me rend vivante! N'est-ce pas justement cela la vie ?

A votre tour!

Que "faites*"-vous pour Ãªtre en mesure de rÃ©ceptionner vos idÃ©es ?

Lorsque vous avez une idÃ©e, comment savez-vous si c'est une idÃ©e Ã  suivre ou au contraire Ã  laisser de cÃ´tÃ©?

Quelles sont vos stratÃ©gies pour continuer Ã  suivre votre idÃ©e malgrÃ© vos peurs et vos doutes ?

N'hÃ©sitez pas Ã  commenter, #partagerpourinspirer, et aimer cet article!

TEXT:
Actor Woody Harrelson has recalled the â€œbrutalâ€ meal he once had with President Donald Trump.

On Fridayâ€™s broadcast of â€œReal Time with Bill Maher,â€ the star of the upcoming Lyndon B. Johnson biopic â€œLBJâ€ explained how he was invited along to a 2002 dinner with the future president by retired pro-wrestler Jesse Ventura.

Trump was trying to convince Ventura to be his running mate on the 2004 Democratic presidential ticket, said Harrelson.

The meal itself was â€œbrutal,â€ Harrelson told the showâ€™s host, Bill Maher. â€œI never met a more narcissistic man. He talked about himself the whole time. You could see the standard he was going to bear.â€

â€œI had to walk out halfway through to smoke a joint just to like steel myself from the rest of it,â€ he added.
TITLE: Woody Harrelson's Dinner Date With Donald Trump Did Not Go Well

SUMMARY:
Refugee advocates fear violence will erupt on Manus Island as the final countdown begins to the closure of an Australian offshore detention centre holding 600 asylum seekers.
Australia expects the Lombrum centre will close as planned.
Refugee Action Coalition's Ian Rintoul fears a siege situation could develop at the Lombrum centre ahead of Tuesday's deadline.
Mr Rintoul said two of the three centres earmarked for the asylum seekers were still not fenced or guarded, raising concerns about their safety.
The Lombrum centre's closure was announced after the PNG Supreme Court ruled in April 2016 that Australia's detention of refugees and asylum seekers there was illegal and unconstitutional.
TEXT:
Refugee advocates fear violence will erupt on Manus Island as the final countdown begins to the closure of an Australian offshore detention centre holding 600 asylum seekers.

The men are refusing to leave the centre at the Lombrum Navy Base despite its planned closure on Tuesday amid fears they won't be safe at three other facilities they are meant to relocate to in and around the island's main town of Lorengau.

Many locals in the town have threatened to use violence to stop the asylum seekers relocating, prompting Papua New Guinea authorities to deploy extra police to the island.

The refugees held a peaceful protest in rain today. They're still refusing to leave the prison camp. The locals will hold a protest tomorrow pic.twitter.com/EXZQ6HTkUG October 29, 2017

Meanwhile dining facilities at Lombrum have closed, with the asylum seekers now relying on basic food parcels containing museli bars, muffins, cornflakes and pre-cooked meals they've been told will last two days.

Power and water are due to be cut off on Tuesday ahead of PNG's navy retaking control of the site a day later.

Australia is trying to create violence in Manus. Its not the first time they've done that, some politicians benefit when there's violence. â€” Behrouz Boochani (@BehrouzBoochani) October 29, 2017

The Human Rights Law Centre's legal advocacy director Daniel Webb says the situation on Manus is "like a powder keg".

"There are people who are tense and they are frightened," he told AAP on Sunday.

"The refugees are terrified of violence if they stay inside the detention centre and if they leave.

"Many local people are angry, particularly at the Australian government, so it's a disaster waiting to happen."

The system gave food packs for two days.They said there will not be any food, water and power after 31 Oct.The pressure is too much in Manus â€” Behrouz Boochani (@BehrouzBoochani) October 29, 2017

Anger has been building among locals at Lorengau over a lack of consultation about the facility to house some of the asylum seekers in a residential area on the town's outskirts.

Governor of Manus Island Charlie Benjamin has warned that many locals feared they would be in danger and were threatening to arm themselves with knives and other weapons to stop any of the 600 men moving in.

Australia expects the Lombrum centre will close as planned.

"Everything is proceeding at this point," a spokesman for Immigration Minister Peter Dutton told AAP.

Immigration Department Secretary Michael Pezzullo told a Senate committee last week that it was a matter for the PNG government to decide whether the men would be removed by force.

Refugee Action Coalition's Ian Rintoul fears a siege situation could develop at the Lombrum centre ahead of Tuesday's deadline.

"There are some indications that locals would attempt to get food and water to them but it's on a (naval) base so that will mean some kind of confrontation one way or the other," he told AAP.

Mr Rintoul said two of the three centres earmarked for the asylum seekers were still not fenced or guarded, raising concerns about their safety.

"Nobody's inclined to move," he said.

"They would have transferred a long a time a go if they thought they could be safe."

The Lombrum centre's closure was announced after the PNG Supreme Court ruled in April 2016 that Australia's detention of refugees and asylum seekers there was illegal and unconstitutional.
TITLE: Refugees Fear Violence Erupting As Food, Water And Power Cut On Manus

SUMMARY:
But experts are now warning that vaginal seeding, where an infant born by caesarean section is swabbed with fluids from a mother's vagina, could pass potentially-dangerous bacteria and illnesses such as sexually transmitted infections to the newborn.
The very real risks outweigh the potential benefits.
"However, due to the lack of sufficient data, the very real risks outweigh the potential benefits.
Why Is Vaginal Seeding Popular?
A baby born by C-section isn't exposed to the same birth canal bacteria that a vaginal birth provides.
TEXT:
There's always some new birth trend that makes parents wonder whether they too should hop on the bandwagon.

Some, such as professional birth photography and eating your own placenta, are relatively harmless.

But experts are now warning that vaginal seeding, where an infant born by caesarean section is swabbed with fluids from a mother's vagina, could pass potentially-dangerous bacteria and illnesses such as sexually transmitted infections to the newborn.

The very real risks outweigh the potential benefits. Dr. Christopher Zahn

The American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists released new guidelines this week cautioning against the practice.

"Understandably, patients who may need to undergo a C-section are increasingly seeking counsel from ob-gyns on whether vaginal seeding is appropriate," Christopher Zahn, M.D., vice president of Practice Activities for the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists, said in a statement.

"However, due to the lack of sufficient data, the very real risks outweigh the potential benefits. By swabbing an infant's mouth, nose or skin with vaginal fluid after birth, the mother could potentially, and unknowingly, pass on disease-causing bacteria or viruses."

C-Sections In Canada

In Canada, 27 per cent of births were by C-section in 2013, according to the Canadian Institute For Health Information.

The rate is higher in older moms, with one Ontario study finding that 43 per cent of women over age 40 gave birth by C-section. Older women are more likely to face complications that could result in the need for a C-section, the National Post reports, but something called "precious baby" syndrome also plays a role.

"You've either tried a long time to get pregnant, or you've had IVF and finally you get pregnant and you say, 'I can't take any chances, I'm going to have a cesarean section,'" Dr. Michael Klein, a professor emeritus at the University of British Columbia and senior scientist emeritus at the Child and Family Research Institute, told the National Post.

Why Is Vaginal Seeding Popular?

A baby born by C-section isn't exposed to the same birth canal bacteria that a vaginal birth provides.

"The bacteria present in breast milk & on the nipple is sufficient for natural colonization or seeding of the gut." https://t.co/TiVDStagdj â€” ACOG News (@acognews) October 25, 2017

The thought is that "seeding" this bacteria â€” usually by swiping a cotton swab with the mother's vaginal fluids on it against the baby's mouth, nose or skin â€” would expose the infant to bacteria that could help protect it from developing asthma, atopic disease, and immune disorders, the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists said.

But the research doesn't yet outweigh the potential risks, Zahn said.

"Breastfeeding for the first six months is the best way to overcome the lack of exposure to maternal vaginal flora at birth," he added.

Also on HuffPost Canada:
TITLE: Here's Why 'Vaginal Seeding' Is Dangerous For Newborns

TEXT:
Studenten aufgepasst: Vor wenigen Tagen war "Tag der Bibliotheken". Wer den wie ich vergessen hat: Nicht weiter tragisch. Schlimmer - weil teuer - wird es allerdings, wenn ihr noch entliehene BÃ¼cher bei euch rumliegen habt, die eigentlich lÃ¤ngst schon wieder im Bib-Regal stehen sollten. Damit tut ihr nicht nur euren Kommilitonen einen Gefallen - besonders denen der Rechtswissenschaften - sondern auch eurer eigenen Brieftasche. Denn vergessen das kostet, und zwar nicht zu knapp. Wie unterschiedlich stark die Bibliotheken jedoch ihre Schlendrians bestrafen, hat das Finanzportal Vexcash in einer aktuellen Untersuchung zu MahngebÃ¼hren an UniversitÃ¤ts-Bibliotheken herausgefunden. Beispiel MÃ¼nchen: Wer hier auf die Mahnungen nicht reagiert muss bis zu 78 Euro fÃ¼r ein einziges Buch zahlen.

Ãœberhaupt sind die die UniversitÃ¤ts-Bibs in SÃ¼ddeutschland besonders teuer, was die SÃ¤umnisgebÃ¼hren anbelangt. Nach Ablauf der Leihfrist verlangen neben MÃ¼nchen auch die Uni-Bibliotheken in Augsburg, Regensburg, WÃ¼rzburg sowie Erlangen-NÃ¼rnberg bereits 7,50 Euro mit der ersten Mahnung. Zum Vergleich: Der Durchschnitt aller 40 untersuchten Bibliotheken liegt bei 2 Euro.



Wer auf so einem BÃ¼cherstapel sitzt, sollte sie schleunigst zurÃ¼ckbringen

Wer nach Mahnung eins noch immer nicht sein Buch in die BÃ¼cherei zurÃ¼ck trÃ¤gt, erhÃ¤lt weitere Mahnungen. Und damit wird es immer teurer. Mit der dritten und vierten Mahnung mÃ¼ssen die Studenten in MÃ¼nchen und NÃ¼rnberg 25 Euro bzw. 35,50 Euro zahlen. Mit den zehn Euro aus der zweiten Mahnung kommen so am Ende 78 Euro zustande. Nicht schlecht - dÃ¼rften die meisten BÃ¼cher im Verkaufspreis doch deutlich darunter liegen.

Einziger Wermutstropfen: An besagten Hochschulen ist es egal, ob man ein oder 10 BÃ¼cher entliehen hat. In Frankfurt ist das anders: Hier kostet die erste Mahnung zwar nur drei Euro. Allerdings auch fÃ¼r jedes entliehene Medium. Wer also drei BÃ¼cher bei sich hortet, zahlt bereits neun Euro.

An Hamburg und Dresdens UniversitÃ¤tsbibliotheken kommen vergessliche Studenten Ã¼brigens am gÃ¼nstigsten weg. Nur einen Euro wollen die Bibliothekare hier pro Buch mit der ersten Mahnung.

Ein ganz eigenes System der SÃ¤umnisgebÃ¼hren hat die UniversitÃ¤tsbibliothek in Leipzig. Hier werden einfach 50 Cent pro Tag verlangt, ab dem 10. Tag einen Euro. Nicht mehr jedoch als 25 Euro insgesamt. Dabei bietet Leipzig neben dieser speziellen Regelung auch noch eine Bibliothek, die 24 Stunden geÃ¶ffnet ist. Ganz fleiÃŸige Studenten kÃ¶nnen hier sogar an Weihnachten und Silvester lernen, der "Gute Rutsch" kann dann wohl nur geflÃ¼stert werden.

Und in Berlin? Hier gibt es allein zwischen den drei Unis groÃŸe Unterschiede. Die FU Berlin mag mit der ersten Mahnung 1,50 Euro haben, die HU und die TU bereits 2 Euro. Zweite Mahnung: Vier Euro an der FU, fÃ¼nf Euro an den beiden anderen. Am gÃ¼nstigsten kommen Studenten an der TU weg, wenn die dritte Mahnung zur TÃ¼re hinein fliegt: acht Euro. FU, 11,50 und HU, 13 Euro sind da deutlich teurer.

Egal ob gÃ¼nstig oder teuer: MahngebÃ¼hren sind immer Kosten, die man sich sparen sollte. Wer also noch ein Buch bei sich rumliegen hat: Ab damit in die Bib. Mit jedem weiteren Tag wird die ohnehin schmale BÃ¶rse noch weiter unnÃ¶tig belastet.

____

Ihr habt auch ein spannendes Thema?

Die HuffPost ist eine Debattenplattform fÃ¼r alle Perspektiven. Wenn ihr die Diskussion zu politischen oder gesellschaftlichen Themen vorantreiben wollt, schickt eure Idee an unser Blog-Team unter blog@huffingtonpost.de.

SUMMARY:
The complaint was filed against Professor Kamal Mitra Chenoy for criticizing BJP and Modi on Al Jazeera TV, by Satyapal Singh, a former Police Commissioner of Mumbai who later went on to become a BJP Lok Sabha MP from Uttar Pradesh.
A report by the Telegraph said Chenoy agreed that he had criticised the BJP and Modi and cited his freedom of speech to do so.
In a Facebook post on Saturday, Chenoy criticised what he called a "sustained attack on JNU" citing victimisation of students.
Because the ruling party does not want to encourage fearless debate and study, while the Hindutva VC is systematically working to dismantle this university.
It is time that the public intervened," Chenoy wrote in a public post on Facebook.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

A prominent JNU professor and a vocal critic of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has been asked to explain by the government why he called the Narendra Modi-helmed ruling party "anti-Muslim" and referred to the Gujarat riots deaths as "genocide".

The complaint was filed against Professor Kamal Mitra Chenoy for criticizing BJP and Modi on Al Jazeera TV, by Satyapal Singh, a former Police Commissioner of Mumbai who later went on to become a BJP Lok Sabha MP from Uttar Pradesh. Singh accused Chenoy of making anti-India comments.

A report by the Telegraph said Chenoy agreed that he had criticised the BJP and Modi and cited his freedom of speech to do so. He questioned why Modi did not visit Palestine on his trip to Israel.

In July, Singh filed the complaint with parliamentary affairs minister Ananth Kumar who then forwarded it to HRD minister Prakash Javadekar. It was then sent to JNU registrar Pramod Kumar and Chenoy was asked to explain why he said what he did, according to the paper.

Chenoy is a supporter of the Aam Aadmi Party and had campaigned in Varanasi against Modi during the 2014 elections. He had also been vocal against central schemes, including Aadhaar.

"For quite some time activists have been increasingly worried about the growing linkage of the Aadhaar card with several other documents from bank cheques, ration cards, MGNREGA cards, bank accounts, generally the most important document for documentation, and so on. It has become the Indian document par excellence for identification.

"Activists including Jean Dreze, Reetika Khera, Aruna Roy have questioned the staggering validity and reach of the Aadhaar, and the possible misuse for a large variety of purposes. In the privacy judgement of the Supreme Court this aspect was not raised," he wrote for The Citizen in a column titled, 'Need for Sudhaar Not Aadhaar'.

In a Facebook post on Saturday, Chenoy criticised what he called a "sustained attack on JNU" citing victimisation of students.

"Why this sustained attack on one of the top two universities in India? Because the ruling party does not want to encourage fearless debate and study, while the Hindutva VC is systematically working to dismantle this university. It is a contest between Hindutva and secular progressive nationalism. It is time that the public intervened," Chenoy wrote in a public post on Facebook.
TITLE: Why JNU Professor Kamal Mitra Chenoy Is Under BJP Fire

SUMMARY:
Oscar-winning actor Kevin Spacey has addressed a report that he once sexually harassed actor Anthony Rapp.
Rapp, who is currently starring in the TV series "Star Trek: Discovery" and is best known for work in the play and movie "Rent," told BuzzFeed News that Spacey invited him to a party at his apartment in 1986.
Rapp was 14 years old at the time.
Spacey's statement, made on Twitter early Monday, included his first public declaration that he is gay.
"I am sorry for the feelings he describes having carried with him all these years," Spacey wrote.
TEXT:
Oscar-winning actor Kevin Spacey has addressed a report that he once sexually harassed actor Anthony Rapp.

Rapp, who is currently starring in the TV series "Star Trek: Discovery" and is best known for work in the play and movie "Rent," told BuzzFeed News that Spacey invited him to a party at his apartment in 1986. Rapp was 14 years old at the time.

Spacey's statement, made on Twitter early Monday, included his first public declaration that he is gay. He did not deny that the incident took place, citing the passage of time and being drunk on the occasion, but apologized to Rapp for "what would have been deeply inappropriate drunken behavior."

"I am sorry for the feelings he describes having carried with him all these years," Spacey wrote.
TITLE: Kevin Spacey Responds To Report He Sexually Harassed Then-14-Year-Old Anthony Rapp

Mais dÃ¨s que vous parliez dâ€™agriculture, vous constatiez combien il Ã©tait passionnÃ©! Ses fromages au lait cru, dont Le Gaulois de Portneuf, Ã©taient exceptionnels, irremplaÃ§ables. On ne peut pas se permettre de perdre des gens comme lui Â», raconte Charles Trottier, copropriÃ©taire de la Fromagerie Des Grondines qui, partageant la mÃªme profession, lâ€™a bien connu.



Les deux fromagers artisans ont passÃ© Ã  travers la crise de la listÃ©riose de 2008, qui a fait 2 morts et 38 malades, et oÃ¹ le gouvernement a fait jeter aux poubelles des milliers de kilogrammes de fromage. Dans un rapport sur la gestion de cette crise (2010), le ministÃ¨re de lâ€™Agriculture, des PÃªcheries et de lâ€™Alimentation (MAPAQ) exonÃ©rait les fromages au lait cru en identifiant la bactÃ©rie coupable, le pulsovar 93, une souche de la bactÃ©rie Lysteria monocytigene, provenant de fromages au lait pasteurisÃ©. Mais le mal Ã©tait fait, le QuÃ©bec ne compte plus aujourdâ€™hui, avec le dÃ©part de Rudy Ducreux, que quatre ou cinq fromagers au lait cru, selon Normand CÃ´tÃ©, prÃ©sident de lâ€™Association des fromagers artisans du QuÃ©bec, qui regroupe une trentaine de membres.



Pour opÃ©rer notre fromagerie, j'ai besoin de 16 Ã  17 permis diffÃ©rents.

â€“ Charles Trottier



Un mÃ©tier sous trÃ¨s haute tension



Le mÃ©tier de fromager-artisan relÃ¨ve des 12 travaux dâ€™Hercule. Il faut traire des vaches 2 fois par jour, 365 jours par annÃ©e, car on ne peut pas fermer le pis des vaches comme lâ€™eau dâ€™un robinet. Il faut ensuite fabriquer son fromage dans des conditions hygiÃ©niques aussi salubres quâ€™une salle dâ€™opÃ©ration dâ€™hÃ´pital. Et il faut lâ€™emballer, le distribuer et le vendre dans les boutiques spÃ©cialisÃ©es ou les restaurants.



Â« Câ€™est trois mÃ©tiers dans un Â», explique Charles Trottier. Sans compter quâ€™il faut composer avec le stress de la mÃ©tÃ©o, la ferme Ã©tant une usine Ã  ciel ouvert, pour produire des fourrages et des grains afin dâ€™alimenter les vaches.



C'est dans l'Ã©tabli de sa ferme que le jeune agriculteur Rudy Ducreux a mis fin Ã  ses jours.



De plus, ce mÃ©tier sâ€™exerce sous une charge administrative kafkaÃ¯enne. Â« Pour opÃ©rer notre fromagerie, jâ€™ai besoin de 16 Ã  17 permis diffÃ©rents, dont un de fabrication du ministÃ¨re de lâ€™Agriculture, un permis du ministÃ¨re de lâ€™Environnement, un permis de transport du lait, de vente au dÃ©tail, de lâ€™organisme de certification biologique, de la municipalitÃ©â€¦ Â» poursuit Charles Trottier.



Comme si cette lourdeur administrative ne suffisait pas, la dÃ©cision du gouvernement Trudeau de permettre lâ€™importation de 16 000 tonnes mÃ©triques de fromages fins en provenance dâ€™Europe dÃ¨s le 21 septembre prochain sous lâ€™Accord Ã©conomique et commercial entre le Canada et lâ€™Union europÃ©enne (AECG) risque de faucher plusieurs fromagers artisanaux du terroir quÃ©bÃ©cois. Depuis ses dÃ©buts, lâ€™homme dâ€™affaires a investi 1,8 million $ dans la fromagerie, dont 750 000 $ depuis deux ans, entre autres pour construire une nouvelle Ã©table. Et il compte sur sa clientÃ¨le quÃ©bÃ©coise -- plus de 30 000 personnes visitent la fromagerie chaque annÃ©e -- pour survivre.



Contrairement Ã  Charles Trottier, qui dit travailler plus de 105 Ã  110 heures par semaine pour faire tourner la fromagerie avec son associÃ© et une vingtaine dâ€™employÃ©s, Â« Rudy, lui, opÃ©rait seul, avec lâ€™Ã©nergie de la jeunesse Â».



Câ€™est peut-Ãªtre parce quâ€™il devait se battre envers et contre tous que Rudy Ducreux avait surnommÃ© son produit vedette Â« Le Gaulois de Portneuf Â», gagnant dâ€™un prix Caseus (2011), sorte de Jeux olympiques annuels du fromage.



Charles Trottier, co-propriÃ©taire de la Fromagerie Des Grondines, a bien connu Rudy Ducreux, un champion fromager.
